New Contracts:
### Contract: Use of Services for Family Accounts

**Authority.** You acknowledge that you may be permitted to use the Services if you have a valid family account, even if you do not meet the Minimum Age requirement. If you are accessing the Services through a family account, you represent that you are authorized by the account holder to use the Services, and the account holder agrees to these Terms on your behalf.

**Indemnity.** If you are using the Services through a family account, you, alongside the account holder, agree to indemnify the service provider from any claims or actions that may arise from your use of the Services, including but not limited to negligence claims, and any costs incurred as a result.

**Age.** While you may access the Services through a family account despite being below the Minimum Age, you must still refrain from accessing any adult content or features within the Services unless expressly allowed by the account holder.

**Member Conduct.** You agree not to misuse the Services even if you are accessing them through a family account. This means you must not engage in harmful behavior, violate laws, or misrepresent any information while using the Services.

**Support.** The service provider may not offer direct support for individual accounts under the minimum age, but the account holder can request support on your behalf.

**Fees.** If additional charges are implemented for accessing family services, the account holder will be notified, and it is their responsibility to inform you regarding any payment details.

---

**Contract for Question b:**
**Google Play Family Library Terms**
Users of the Google Play Family Library recognize that family members can access apps and games that may not be suitable for their age. The account holder agrees to monitor and manage the content available to their minors and affirms their compliance with the age guidelines established by Google Play.

---

**Contract for Question c:**
**Apple Music Family Plan Agreement**
The owner of an Apple Music Family Plan understands that access to certain explicit content can be granted to account members, including minors. The account holder agrees to oversee and restrict access to any content deemed inappropriate and adheres to Apple’s policies regarding content suitability for different age groups.

---

**Contract for Question d:**
**Microsoft Xbox Live Family Policy**
By holding a US Xbox Live Family Account, the account owner acknowledges that minors in the family group may gain access to age-restricted games. The holder agrees to monitor usage, apply parental controls, and ensure compliance with Microsoft’s age-related content policies to safeguard the gaming experience for younger users.

**Fee-Based Services and Billing**

Unless otherwise specified in the additional terms that apply to the Services you are using, the terms in this Section 11 apply to you.

We offer products and subscriptions for a fee (fee-based Services). These fee-based Services are governed by the additional terms you agree to when you register for the fee-based Service and these Terms. If you register for a fee-based Service, you must designate a payment method and provide us with accurate billing and payment information, and you have the continuing obligation to keep it up to date. Many fee-based Services require you to have, or register for, an account or identification method. If you are a specific type of customer (e.g., Dial-Up customer), please see additional terms.

The following important provisions apply to all of our fee-based services:

**Third-Party Products:** If the fee-based Service includes a third-party product, you agree that your purchase and use of the Service is also subject to the third party's terms of service and privacy policy, which you should read thoroughly before agreeing to them.

**Payments:** You represent that you are at least the minimum age required to enter into a legal agreement. You agree to pay us for any fee-based Services you purchase from us, as well as all other charges incurred under your account, including applicable taxes and fees. You are responsible for all charges incurred under your account, including purchases made by you or anyone you allow to use your account or any sub- or linked accounts (including any person with implied, actual, or apparent authority) or anyone who gains access to your account as a result of your failure to safeguard your authentication credentials.

**Payment Methods:** You authorize and direct us to charge your designated payment method for these charges or, if it fails, to charge any other payment method you have on file with us, even if we received it in association with other fee-based services. You are responsible for all charges even if your payment method fails or is denied. You authorize and direct us to retain all information about any payment method(s) associated with your account. We may import payment information from prior purchases and provide you the option to use that information during a new purchase. You permit us to obtain and use updated information from the issuer of your payment method in accordance with the policies of any applicable card brands. We may, in some instances, continue charging a payment method past its expiration date at our discretion and subject to the payment processors' or issuing bank's approval.

**Payment Terms:** We may charge for fee-based Services in advance and on a daily, monthly, yearly, lump sum, or other basis in accordance with the stated terms, as long as your subscription remains active, even if you have not downloaded or used the Service or accessed your online account.

**Auto-Renewal:** We use auto-renewal for many of our fee-based Services. At the expiration of each subscription term for such fee-based Services, we will automatically renew your subscription and charge the designated payment method you provided, unless you cancel your subscription at least 48 hours before the end of the current period. Your subscription will be automatically renewed at the then-current price, excluding promotional and discount pricing. We may, in our sole discretion, post charges to your payment method individually or aggregate charges for some or all of your fee-based Services.

**Fraud Protection:** We may take steps to verify the validity of your credit card information, including debiting amounts less than $1.00 from your credit card and then immediately crediting it back. You authorize us to do so for verification and anti-fraud purposes.

**Free Trials:** We may offer you free trials to try a fee-based Service subscription without charge or obligation. Unless otherwise stated, and unless you cancel your subscription prior to the expiration of the Free Trial, periodic subscription fees will be charged at the then-applicable rate upon expiration.

**No Refunds:** All charges are nonrefundable unless provided otherwise in the terms you agree to when you register for a fee-based Service.

**Termination:** We may change, discontinue, or terminate any or all aspects of a fee-based Service without notice, subject to providing an appropriate refund for any portions of a specified but no longer available term. You may cancel a fee-based Service at any time by logging into your account.

**Change in Fees and Billing Method:** We may change our fees and billing methods at any time. We will notify you of any price increase at least thirty days in advance.

**Delinquency:** After 30 days from the date of any unpaid charges, your fee-based Service will be deemed delinquent and we may suspend your account and fee-based Service for nonpayment.

**90-Day Notice Period:** You must notify us about any billing problems or discrepancies within 90 days after they first appear on your billing statement. If you do not bring them to our attention within 90 days, you waive your right to dispute such problems or discrepancies.

3. USE OF SERVICES AND YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES. You may only utilize the Services under the terms outlined in this Agreement. You are solely accountable for your use of the Services and must comply with all applicable Laws regarding your use of the Services, including, but not limited to, data privacy, intellectual property, and online communication laws. Use of the Services is null and void where prohibited.
a. Registration Information. You may be required to submit information about yourself to register for or use some Services. You agree that any such information shall be accurate. You will also be prompted to select a username and password. You are completely responsible for preserving the confidentiality of your username and password and agree not to disclose them to any third party.

You affirm that you hold the rights to upload such content to the platform without infringing on third-party rights. The platform will not be liable for any issues arising from content, including errors or omissions, or for any losses incurred as a result of content use. While the platform is not liable for your content, it has the right to remove any content that contravenes this Agreement or any applicable laws, at its discretion and without notice.
c. Recordings. You are responsible for adhering to all laws regarding recordings. Should you record sessions using the Services, you provide your consent for the platform to retain those recordings. A notification will be provided when recording features are enabled. If you do not consent to being recorded, you can leave the session.
d. Prohibited Use. You agree not to use or permit any end user to use the Services to: (i) break down, decompile, reverse engineer, or otherwise seek access to the underlying code of the Services; (ii) misuse the Services in any manner that disrupts the platform or interferes with other users; (iii) engage in illegal or fraudulent activity; (iv) transmit content that could infringe on third-party rights; (v) create products that compete with the Services; (vi) distribute any content that is harassing, threatening, or otherwise illegal; (vii) upload or share harmful software or content; (viii) engage in practices that compromise the functionality or security of the Services; (ix) operate in violation of applicable laws or platform policies.

d. "If an arbitration clause in a contract is struck down by a court, are the other terms of the contract still binding?"

Contracts Corresponding to New Questions:
a. 20.3 Waiver and Severability. In the event a court determines any part of this contract is unenforceable, the remaining provisions shall continue in full effect.
b. 20.3 Waiver and Severability. If any term of this lease is found to be invalid by a court, such determination shall not affect the validity of the remaining terms of the lease agreement.
c. 20.3 Waiver and Severability. Should any part of this partnership agreement be held illegal, the unaffected provisions of the agreement will remain in force and effect.
d. 20.3 Waiver and Severability. A court's rejection of an arbitration clause does not invalidate the remaining terms of the contract, which will still be enforceable.



43
Original Question: "Can I sue Zoom in a small claims court?"

New Questions:
a. "Is it possible for me to file a claim against a local gym in small claims court?"
b. "Can I take my internet service provider to small claims court for service interruptions?"
c. "Am I allowed to pursue a case against my landlord in small claims court for a security deposit dispute?"
d. "Is it feasible for me to bring a lawsuit against a car dealership in small claims court over a refund issue?"

Contracts for New Questions:

a. Contract for Question a:
A. Dispute Resolution. A dispute arises when there is any disagreement between You and [Gym Name] regarding services provided, pricing, or any terms of this Agreement under any legal theory including contract, warranty, tort, statute, or regulation. Prior to initiating any legal proceedings, both parties must notify each other of the dispute, outlining the issue, attempts made to resolve it, and the desired resolution.

B. Small Claims Court Availability. You may bring a claim in your local Small Claims Court if you meet the court's requirements. However, if an action is later moved to a different court, [Gym Name] reserves the right to request mediation.

C. Procedure for Mediation. Unresolved disputes shall be mediated through a mutually agreed mediator. The mediation session will occur in a location determined by the primary location of your purchases.

B. Mediation Costs. If You cannot afford the mediation costs, [Gym Name] will advance those costs, with terms to be determined based on the mediator's decision.

F. Claim Filing Deadline. Any claim or dispute arising under this Agreement must be filed in Small Claims Court or referred for mediation within one year of becoming eligible, or the claim will be permanently barred.

b. Contract for Question b:
A. Dispute Resolution. Any dispute between You and [Internet Service Provider] regarding service quality, pricing, account management, or terms of this Agreement will be raised as a controversy under applicable laws. Prior to pursuing other options, each party must provide notice of the dispute along with a description and efforts made to resolve it.

B. Small Claims Court Availability. You are entitled to initiate a claim in your local Small Claims Court if You satisfy the court's eligibility criteria. In the event of transfer or appeal, [Internet Service Provider] has the right to seek resolution through mediation.

C. Mediation Procedure. Any unresolved disputes not addressed through Section A or B will be mediated by a volunteer mediator in a mutually agreed location.

F. Time Limit for Claims. Claims or disputes under this Agreement must be initiated in Small Claims Court or referred for mediation within one year of the event that led to the dispute; otherwise, they will be barred.

c. Contract for Question c:
A. Dispute Resolution. A dispute refers to any disagreement between You and [Landlord Name] concerning the rental property, security deposit, or any terms of this Agreement. Each party must notify the other of the dispute before pursuing legal action.

B. Small Claims Court Availability. You can pursue a claim in your local Small Claims Court if you meet the court's qualifications. If transferred or appealed, [Landlord Name] may choose to require resolution through mediation.

C. Mediation Process. Any disputes not resolved through Section A or B will proceed to mediation, organized by a neutral third party in the vicinity of the rental property.

D. Mediation Costs. Should You be unable to cover the mediation costs, [Landlord Name] will front those costs, contingent upon a ruling on reimbursement if [Landlord Name] prevails.

F. Filing Requirements. Claims or disputes arising from this Agreement must be reported in Small Claims Court or notified for mediation within one year of occurrence to avoid being permanently barred.

d. Contract for Question d:
A. Dispute Resolution. A dispute is any disagreement between You and [Dealership Name] regarding vehicle purchases, refunds, or related terms in this Agreement. Prior to legal action, both parties must communicate the details of the dispute.

B. Small Claims Court Option. You may pursue a matter in Small Claims Court if you meet the court's criteria. If the claim is subsequently moved to another court, [Dealership Name] reserves its mediation rights.

C. Mediation Procedure. Disputes unresolved per Section A or B will be submitted to mediation, conducted by a qualified mediator at a location decided based on the dealership's address.

F. Claim Filing Limit. A claim related to this Agreement must be filed in Small Claims Court or referred for mediation within one year of its occurrence, or it will be forfeited.

Original Question: "Does Reddit permit children above age 13 to use its services?"

c. "Can users younger than 16 register for accounts on TikTok according to their policies?"
d. "Does Facebook allow members who are 15 years old to utilize its platform?" 

Contracts Corresponding to New Questions:

a. **Instagram Use Policy**: Children under the age of 13 are not permitted to create an account or use Instagram’s services. If you are 13 or older, you may create an account; however, you must comply with all applicable laws. Additionally, we require verifiable parental consent for users under the age of 18. By creating an account, you affirm that you have the necessary legal authority to agree to these terms.

b. **Steam Usage Agreement**: Users under the age of 13 may not create an account or access Steam’s services. If you are 14 or older, please ensure that your use of Steam complies with local laws. Users between 14 and 18 must obtain consent from a parent or legal guardian to sign up.

c. **TikTok Account Policy**: Users under the age of 13 are strictly prohibited from creating TikTok accounts. If you are aged 16 or older, you can register for an account as long as you adhere to our guidelines. Users under 18 must have consent from a parent or legal guardian to create an account.

d. **Facebook Age Restrictions**: Facebook does not allow users under the age of 13 to create personal accounts. For those aged 15 and older, registration is allowed, but users under 18 must provide parental consent to use the platform in accordance with local regulations and our terms.

### Contract Correspondence:

**Contract for Netflix Example**  
9. Paid Services and Payment Information  
Many features of Netflix are available without additional costs to all subscribers. However, certain features, including 4K streaming and additional user profiles, may be available for an increased subscription fee (Paid Services). By subscribing to these options, you further agree to the Netflix Premium Features Agreement.

Netflix may change the subscription fees or benefits associated with the Paid Services from time to time with reasonable advance notice of material changes; however, no advance notice will be required for temporary promotional offers, including temporary reductions in fees for the Paid Services.

Subscribers may provide their debit card, credit card, or other payment information (Payment Information) via our platform to access Paid Services. We use third-party service providers to process your Payment Information. By submitting your Payment Information, you agree to pay all associated costs, and you give us permission to charge you when payment is due for an amount that includes these costs and any applicable taxes and fees.

**Contract for Spotify Example**  
9. Paid Services and Payment Information  
Many aspects of Spotify are free to access. However, certain features, including ad-free listening and offline downloads, require a premium subscription (Paid Services). By purchasing or using a premium subscription, you further agree to the Spotify Premium Subscription Agreement.

Spotify may modify the fees or benefits connected to the Paid Services from time to time with reasonable advance notice of material changes; nonetheless, no prior notice will be necessary for temporary promotional offers, including temporary fee reductions for the Paid Services.

You may submit your debit card, credit card, or other payment information (Payment Information) via our services to purchase the Paid Services. We use third-party service providers to process your Payment Information. By providing your Payment Information, you agree to pay all incurred charges, and you grant us permission to charge you at the time of payment for all applicable costs and taxes.

**Contract for Adobe Creative Cloud Example**  
9. Paid Services and Payment Information  
Various features of Adobe Creative Cloud are available without charge, but some services, including additional storage and premium software licenses, are available for a fee (Paid Services). By subscribing or purchasing these services, you further agree to the Adobe Creative Cloud Subscription Agreement.

Adobe maintains the right to alter the fees or benefits regarding the Paid Services with reasonable advance notice of substantial changes; however, notice will not be required for temporary promotions, including temporary discounts on fees related to the Paid Services.

You may provide your debit card, credit card, or other payment information (Payment Information) through our services to access Paid Services. We engage third-party service providers to handle your Payment Information. By submitting this information, you agree to bear all associated costs, granting us permission to charge the relevant fees, taxes, and additional charges as they arise.

**Contract for Amazon Prime Example**  
9. Paid Services and Payment Information  
Many services offered through Amazon Prime do not incur additional charges. However, certain services, such as video rentals or purchases, may require an extra fee (Paid Services). In addition to these terms, by renting or purchasing these services, you agree to the Amazon Prime Agreement.

Amazon may adjust the service fees or benefits related to the Paid Services with reasonable advance notice of significant changes, but no notice will be given for temporary deals, including limited-time reductions in Paid Services fees.

You may provide payment details such as debit card, credit card, or other payment information (Payment Information) through our platform to purchase Paid Services. We utilize third-party service providers to manage your Payment Information. By submitting this information, you consent to pay all related expenses and grant us permission to charge your payment method for due amounts, including any applicable taxes or fees.

Original Question: "Does Reddit charge fees in respect of certain services that it provides?"

Contracts corresponding to the new questions:

a. Paid Services and Payment Information (Spotify):
There are generally no fees for basic access to Spotify; however, Spotify Premium and other features may incur charges (Paid Services). By subscribing to Spotify Premium, you further agree to the Spotify Premium Agreement.

Spotify may alter the fees or perks associated with Paid Services occasionally with reasonable prior notification of significant changes; however, no advance notice will be necessary for limited-time promotional offers, including temporary reductions in charges.

You may provide your debit card, credit card, or other payment details via our platform to purchase Paid Services. Third-party service providers handle your Payment Information. By submitting your Payment Information, you agree to cover all expenses you incur, granting us permission to charge you when payment is due, including all applicable taxes and fees.

b. Paid Services and Payment Information (Netflix):
While Netflix offers many features for free, certain subscription options may come with fees (Paid Services). By subscribing to these services, you further agree to the Netflix Subscription Agreement.

Netflix reserves the right to change the fees or benefits linked to Paid Services with reasonable prior notice for significant alterations; no advance notice is needed for temporary promotions or fee reductions.

You may enter your debit card, credit card, or other payment information through our platform to subscribe to Paid Services. We use external providers for processing your Payment Information. By submitting your Payment Information, you consent to pay any costs you incur and authorize us to charge you when payment becomes due, which includes all applicable taxes and fees.

c. Paid Services and Payment Information (Amazon):
Certain services provided by Amazon, such as Prime subscriptions and express shipping options, may involve fees (Paid Services). By opting to use these services, you also agree to the Amazon Payment Agreement.

Amazon may modify the fees or benefits of Paid Services from time to time with reasonable advance notice regarding substantial changes; however, no advance notice is necessary for temporary promotional rates or fee adjustments.

You are allowed to provide debit card, credit card, or other payment details through our services to access Paid Services. We coordinate with third-party providers to manage your Payment Information. Submitting your Payment Information indicates your agreement to pay associated costs and authorizes us to charge you when payment is due, including all relevant taxes and fees.

d. Paid Services and Payment Information (Mobile Gaming Application):
While many features of our mobile gaming application are available for free, some options, such as premium gameplay and virtual goods, may come with fees (Paid Services). By purchasing or utilizing these premium features, you agree to the Mobile Gaming Agreement.

Our company may adjust the fees or advantages related to Paid Services, with sufficient advance notice for significant changes; however, no advance notice will be required for short-term promotional offers, including temporary discounts.

You may provide debit card, credit card, or other payment information in our app to buy Paid Services. We engage third-party service providers to handle your Payment Information. By entering your Payment Information, you consent to cover all costs you incur, and you give us permission to charge you when payment is due, including taxes and applicable fees.

a. Privacy Policy
We encourage you to familiarize yourself with the terms outlined in our Privacy Policy, which details our methods of collecting and utilizing your information. As our services cater to users globally, the personal data we collect may be processed and stored in different jurisdictions, including but not limited to the United States. By interacting with our services, you agree to the potential transfer of your information across borders.

Content Disclaimer
a. You may encounter content that may not align with your opinions or expectations: Given that our platform hosts a variety of user-generated content, you may come across materials that could be deemed offensive or inaccurate. We recommend users employ discretion and sound judgment while navigating our services.
b. Our content serves general informational purposes only: While we provide a wealth of information across professional topics, including health, finance, and law, it is presented purely for informative purposes. It should not be interpreted as professional counsel. We advise users to seek advice from licensed professionals for any issues akin to those discussed on our platform.

b. Privacy Policy
Please take a moment to review our Privacy Policy, which illuminates how we collect and process your information. Since our services attract a diverse global audience, your personal data may be processed in various locations worldwide, including the United States. By using our platform, you consent to the international transfer of your information.

Content Disclaimer
a. You may find some material objectionable or misleading: Our platform features a broad range of user-generated content; thus, it’s likely that you may encounter content that you perceive as offensive or incorrect. We urge users to approach our services with discernment and careful consideration.
b. Our information is meant for general purposes only: Although we deliver content addressing various professional sectors, including finance and health, it should not be considered professional advice. Users are urged to consult with certified professionals for guidance pertaining to financial or health-related matters.

c. Privacy Policy
We ask that you read our Privacy Policy, which clarifies how we collect and manage your information. As our services are utilized by individuals around the world, the personal data we obtain may be stored and processed in different countries, including the United States. Your use of our services implies consent to this transfer of information.

Content Disclaimer
a. You may stumble upon content that could be contentious or incorrect: Our platform offers a wide range of material generated by users; thus, you may face content that some may view as questionable or misleading. We suggest that users maintain reason and caution while using our services.
b. Our content is not a substitute for professional consultation: We host a considerable amount of information relating to various professional fields, including health and finance, primarily for informative purposes. This should not be misconstrued as professional advice. We recommend seeking independent, professional counsel regarding personal or financial matters.

d. Privacy Policy
We encourage you to review our Privacy Policy which outlines our practices in collecting and utilizing your personal information. Because our services cater to users from around the world, any personal data we gather may be processed in several different regions, including the United States. By utilizing our platform, you consent to this potential international transfer of your data.

Content Disclaimer
a. Users may find some content objectionable: The nature of our user-generated content means that you might encounter articles that you find to be inappropriate or misleading. We advise you to exercise your judgment and discretion when engaging with our services.
b. Our content is informational and not a professional recommendation: While we maintain a variety of information on professional matters, including mental health and financial topics, it is offered solely for informational use. We recommend that users seek professional advice from qualified individuals in relevant fields instead of relying solely on our content.



56
Original Question: "Do the terms provide that the content shall not be used as legal or medical advice?"
New Questions:
a. "Do the guidelines specify that the information should not be considered as professional financial advice?"
b. "Is it stated in the policy that the content is not intended for use as personal health recommendations?"
c. "Do the conditions mention that the hosted materials are not to be regarded as expert legal counsel?"
d. "Are there indications in the agreement that the information provided is not to be utilized as medical guidance?" 

Contracts Corresponding to New Questions:

a. **Finance Disclaimer**
   This document specifies that the information provided within our services regarding financial topics is for general informational purposes only. It is not intended to be used as professional financial advice. We recommend seeking independent financial consultation from licensed professionals before acting based on any information or opinions contained on any of our project websites.

b. **Health Advisory**
   This section of the agreement indicates that any health-related information hosted by our services is intended for general informational purposes only. This content should not be interpreted as medical advice. We advise users to consult qualified healthcare professionals for any medical inquiries before making health-related decisions based on information found on our site.

c. **Legal Guidance Disclaimer**
   This clause outlines that any content provided regarding legal matters is meant for informational purposes solely. It is strictly not meant to serve as expert legal advice. Users are encouraged to seek independent legal counsel from qualified attorneys for any legal concerns or actions.

d. **Medical Advice Limitation**
   The terms included in this contract explicitly state that any medical information or guidance hosted on our platform is not to be utilized as a substitute for professional medical advice. Individuals should consult healthcare providers for personalized medical counsel and not rely solely on the information shared through our services.

b. "Is it permissible to accept payment for contributing to an online forum, provided that I disclose my financial backer?"
c. "Am I allowed to get paid for editing entries on a collaborative encyclopedia if I declare the organization funding my work?"
d. "Can I be compensated for writing product reviews on a website, assuming I transparently reveal the company that is paying me?"

Contracts corresponding to the new questions:

a. Contract for Sponsored Content Creation
- The Contributor agrees to inform readers about sponsorship for any content created on the community blog. 
- It is the Contributor's responsibility to provide clarity about the nature of the sponsorship to avoid any conflicts of interest.

b. Contract for Online Forum Contributions
- The Contributor must disclose any payments received for contributions to the online forum.
- Failure to disclose sponsorship may result in removal of contributions and potential banning from the forum.

c. Contract for Collaborative Encyclopedia Edits
- The Contributor acknowledges that compensation for editing content must be openly declared regarding the sponsoring organization.
- All edits made under the auspices of compensated work must provide clear attribution regarding sponsorship.

d. Contract for Product Review Writing
- The Contributor agrees to fully disclose any financial compensation received for product reviews posted on the website.
- The Contributor must include a statement regarding sponsorship in each review to comply with transparency guidelines.



58
Original Question: "Are Wikipedia contributors permitted to receive payment in respect of their contributions, provided they disclose the identity of the person or institution providing such payment?"

New Questions:
a. "Can contributors to an online knowledge-sharing platform accept compensation for their work, as long as they reveal the source of that compensation?"
b. "Is it acceptable for individuals who write articles for a blogging site to be paid for their contributions if they inform readers about who is paying them?"
c. "Are authors of content on a community-driven educational website allowed to earn money for their contributions, provided they disclose the name of the benefactor funding them?"
d. "May participants in a collaborative research project receive funding for their submissions if they openly share the identity of the organization providing the funds?"

Corresponding Contract for New Questions:
The Projects hosted by the [Online Platform Name] only exist because of the vibrant community of users like you who collaborate together to write, edit, and curate the content. We happily welcome your participation in this community. We encourage you to be civil and polite in your interactions with others in the community, to act in good faith, and to make edits and contributions aimed at furthering the mission of the shared Project.

Certain activities, whether legal or illegal, may be harmful to other users and violate our rules, and some activities may also subject you to liability. Therefore, for your own protection and for that of other users, you may not engage in such activities on our site. These activities include:

- Harassing and Abusing Others
  - Engaging in harassment, threats, stalking, spamming, or vandalism; and
  - Transmitting chain mail, junk mail, or spam to other users.

- Violating the Privacy of Others
  - Infringing the privacy rights of others under applicable laws;
  - Soliciting personally identifiable information for purposes of harassment, exploitation, or other non-approved purposes; and
  - Soliciting personally identifiable information from anyone under the age of 18 for an illegal purpose.

- Engaging in False Statements, Impersonation, or Fraud
  - Intentionally posting content that is libelous or defamatory;
  - Posting false or inaccurate content with intent to deceive;
  - Attempting to impersonate another user or individual; and
  - Engaging in fraud.

- Committing Infringement
  - Infringing copyrights, trademarks, patents, or other proprietary rights.

- Misusing Our Services for Other Illegal Purposes
  - Posting child pornography or any other unlawful content;
  - Posting or trafficking in obscene material; and
  - Using the services for illegal purposes inconsistent with applicable law.

Paid contributions without disclosure
These Terms of Use prohibit engaging in deceptive activities, including misrepresentation of affiliation, impersonation, and fraud. As part of these obligations, contributors are required to disclose their employers, clients, or affiliations regarding any compensated contributions. Disclosure must occur as follows:
- A statement on their user page,
- A statement on the talk page accompanying any paid contributions, or
- A statement in the edit summary accompanying any paid contributions.
Applicable law, or community and platform policies, may further limit paid contributions or require more detailed disclosure.
We reserve the right to exercise our enforcement discretion with respect to the above terms.



59
Original Question: "Is it sufficient for me to disclose in the edit summary the compensation I received for the edits I made?"

New Questions:
a. "Is it adequate for me to mention on my user page the sponsorship I received for my contributions to the forum?"
b. "Does stating my affiliation on the discussion page suffice for the paid work I did on the website?"
c. "Is it enough for me to include in my comment that I received payment for the article I edited on the platform?"
d. "Am I required to disclose only in the post itself the fees I earned for the content I contributed to the blog?"

Contract for Generated Questions:
The Projects operated by the Wikimedia Foundation value transparency and integrity in contributions made by users. As a participant in our collaborative community, we appreciate your openness about any compensation received for your edits or contributions. While we encourage you to disclose such information, please note that following the guidelines is essential for maintaining trust and compliance with our policies.

You are required to inform others about any financial support or compensation received in connection with your contributions. This disclosure can be made through one of the following channels:
- A statement on your user page;
- A comment on the discussion page accompanying your contributions;
- An annotation in the summary of edits you make.

Please remember that failure to comply with these disclosure requirements may violate our community and foundation policies. If you engage in paid contributions, ensure that you comply with any additional disclosure policies adopted by specific Wikimedia Project communities.

For a more detailed understanding of these obligations and for information regarding alternative disclosure policies, refer to our FAQ on paid contributions disclosure.

We maintain the right to enforce these terms and protect the integrity of our community.



60
Original Question: "Can things I write for Wikipedia be used by other people or organizations for commercial purposes?"

New Questions:
a. "Is content I contribute to a community blog eligible for use by others in commercial projects?"
b. "If I publish an article on an open-source platform, can others use it for business-related endeavors?"
c. "Are the recipes I post on a collaborative cooking website available for companies to use in their products?"
d. "Can essays I submit to an educational resource be utilized by other educational institutions for profit?"

Contract for New Questions:

a. **Commercial Use of Contributions**: If you submit content to the community blog, you agree to allow others to use that content for commercial purposes as long as proper attribution is provided and the same freedoms for reuse and redistribution are granted for any derivatives.

b. **Licensing Requirements**: Content that you publish on an open-source platform will be licensed under appropriate terms that permit commercial usage, provided that credit is given to you as the original author.

c. **Recipe Contributions**: By sharing recipes on the collaborative cooking website, you license those recipes for commercial use with the requirement that the original authors are credited appropriately.

d. **Educational Essays**: Contributions you make to the educational resource may be used by other institutions for commercial gain, under the condition that you are attributed as the original author and the same rights to reuse and redistribute are offered for derivative works.



61
Original Question: "Pursuant to the terms, can contributions to Wikipedia be put to commercial use?"

New Questions:  
a. "According to the policy, are submissions to an open-source project allowed to be utilized for commercial purposes?"  
b. "In line with the guidelines, is it permissible to use content from a creative commons database for commercial activities?"  
c. "Based on the agreements, can user-generated content on a collaborative platform be leveraged for profit-driven projects?"  
d. "Under the stated regulations, are contributions made to a public knowledge repository eligible for commercial exploitation?"  

New Contracts corresponding to the new questions:  
a. To support broader access to knowledge and information, all contributors to the open-source project are required to permit their contributions to be used freely by the public, including for commercial purposes, provided that appropriate attribution is given and similar rights are granted for derivative works. Contributors thereby agree to license their submissions in a manner compliant with these requirements.  

b. As a contributor, you grant the organization a non-exclusive, worldwide license to use your submitted content for commercial purposes under the terms of the Creative Commons licenses, provided that you are given proper credit and that any modifications or derivatives also comply with these terms.  

c. By submitting your content to this collaborative platform, you acknowledge and agree that the content may be used for commercial gain by others, under the condition that it is attributed appropriately, and that re-users follow the same licensing requirements for any derived works.  

d. You understand that contributions to the public knowledge repository may be utilized in commercial formats, with the stipulation that all contributions are attributed to their respective authors and that they license any adaptations or derivatives under the same licensing terms.



62
Original Question: "Does Wikimedia try to avoid taking responsibility for the safety of its services?"

New Questions:
a. "Does the library attempt to minimize its responsibility for the security of its collections?"
b. "Is the online marketplace making efforts to reduce its accountability for the quality of its products?"
c. "Does the streaming service seek to limit its liability regarding the privacy of its user data?"
d. "Is the educational platform working to disclaim responsibility for the accuracy of its course material?"

Contracts for New Questions:

a. **Contract for Question a:**
   "The library shall make reasonable efforts to ensure the security and preservation of its collections, but it disclaims any responsibility for loss or damage to items that are not securely stored or handled by users. Users agree that they access the collections at their own risk and that the library is not liable for any damages resulting from such access."

b. **Contract for Question b:**
   "The online marketplace will provide product descriptions and information to the best of its ability; however, it denies responsibility for discrepancies in product quality or safety. Buyers acknowledge that they assume all risk associated with their purchases, and the marketplace's liability is limited to the purchase price of the item."

c. **Contract for Question c:**
   "The streaming service is committed to protecting user privacy; however, it states that it cannot guarantee the complete safety of personal data under all circumstances. Users agree that any breaches or data losses shall not be grounds for claims against the service."

d. **Contract for Question d:**
   "The educational platform strives to ensure the accuracy of course material but expressly disclaims liability for errors or omissions in content provided. Students recognize that they are responsible for verifying the information before relying on it for academic or professional purposes."



63
Original Question: "Does Wikimedia purport to disclaim any liability for its services not being safe?"

New Questions:
a. "Does the e-commerce platform assert that it is not responsible for any issues relating to the security of transactions?"
b. "Does the online educational resource claim to deny any responsibility for the accuracy of the information it provides?"
c. "Does the streaming service indicate that it disclaims liability for any interruptions in service availability?"
d. "Does the social media network suggest that it is not liable for any harmful content posted by users?"

Contracts corresponding to the new questions:

a. E-Commerce Platform Liability Disclaimer:
"While we strive to offer a secure shopping experience, you acknowledge that your use of our services and any transactions made through our platform are at your own risk. We explicitly disclaim all warranties regarding the safety and security of your transaction data. In the event of any dispute regarding transactions or purchases, you agree to resolve the matter through the designated dispute resolution procedures we provide."

b. Online Educational Resource Accuracy Disclaimer:
"Our online educational resource aims to provide informative and accurate content; however, we cannot guarantee that all information is current or free from error. By using our services, you accept that we disclaim any liability related to the accuracy of the provided resources and you agree to resolve any claims through our established procedures."

c. Streaming Service Availability Disclaimer:
"We strive for high availability of our streaming services, but you understand and accept that interruptions and service outages may occur. By using our services, you acknowledge that we disclaim any liability for such service disruptions and agree to handle any resulting disputes through our outlined conflict resolution mechanisms."

d. Social Media Network Content Liability Disclaimer:
"Our social media platform promotes open and free expression, but we do not take responsibility for the content shared by users. You acknowledge that any disputes regarding harmful content posted by users must be directed through our content moderation policies, and we disclaim liability for any resultant damages."

Original Question: "Am I able to create multiple Shopify staff accounts?"

New Questions:
a. "Can I set up several employee accounts in my e-commerce platform?"
b. "Is it permissible to create multiple user accounts for team members in my online store system?"
c. "Am I allowed to register various accounts for staff access on my retail management software?"
d. "Can I establish numerous administrative accounts for different users on my merchandise website?"

---

**New Contract Corresponding to the New Questions:**

2.2 Staff Accounts (Revised)
1. Depending on your e-commerce pricing plan, you are permitted to create multiple employee accounts (Employee Accounts) that allow various individuals to access your Account. With Employee Accounts, the Store Owner can define permissions and delegate tasks to others while controlling the level of access each Employee Account has to specific business information (for example, you can restrict Employee Account access to sales data or prevent them from modifying general store configuration).
2. The Store Owner is accountable for the actions and omissions resulting from the use of Employee Accounts in fulfilling obligations under these Terms of Service as if they were the Store Owner’s own actions or omissions.
3. Both the Store Owner and the users under Employee Accounts are each termed as an Online Store User.



65
Original Question: "Does Shopify permit Shopify accountholders to create more than one staff account each?"

New Questions:
a. "Does the platform allow restaurant owners to set up multiple staff accounts for their online ordering system?"
b. "Can a content creator use a single account to create several editorial access accounts for their team members on a blogging platform?"
c. "Is it possible for an educator to generate multiple teaching assistant accounts through their online classroom management software?"
d. "Are business owners allowed to establish more than one administrative user account on their e-commerce website?"

### New Contracts Corresponding to Generated Questions:

**Contract: 2.1 Account Creation for Restaurant Owners**
2.1 Restaurant Owner  
1. The individual establishing an account for the online ordering system will be recognized as the contracting party (Restaurant Owner) for our Terms of Service, being the authorized individual to operate any related accounts linked to the service. It is the Restaurant Owner's responsibility to ensure that their name (including the legal name of the business, if applicable) is clearly presented on the restaurant’s website.  
2. If the individual registering for services does so on behalf of their employer, the employer will be considered the Restaurant Owner. In such a case, the individual must use their employer-issued email and confirm they possess the authority to bind their employer to our Terms of Service.  
3. Each restaurant can only be linked to one primary Restaurant Owner. However, a Restaurant Owner may have multiple restaurant accounts.

**Contract: 2.2 Editorial Access for Content Creators**
2.2 Editorial Accounts  
1. Based on your subscription plan, you may establish one or more editorial accounts (Editorial Accounts), allowing additional team members access to your blogging platform account. You can assign permissions for each Editorial Account, enabling team members to work collaboratively and limiting their access to certain content areas.  
2. The primary account holder is responsible for actions taken by users under Editorial Accounts as if those actions were their own.  
3. Both the primary account holder and Editorial Account users will be referred to as Blog Users.

**Contract: 2.3 Teaching Assistant Accounts for Educators**
2.3 Teaching Assistant Accounts  
1. Upon signing up for the classroom management software, an account will be created for the educator. Depending on the selected plan, educators may have the option to create a number of teaching assistant accounts (Teaching Assistant Accounts).  
2. The educator is responsible for managing permissions and ensuring Teaching Assistant Accounts have the appropriate access to course materials and student information while maintaining overall control of the main account.  
3. The primary educator and their Teaching Assistant Account holders will collectively be identified as Education Users.

**Contract: 2.4 Administrative User Accounts for Business Owners**
2.4 Administrative User Accounts  
1. Upon completion of sign up for the e-commerce website service, the account holder can establish multiple administrative user accounts (Admin User Accounts) for their team.  
2. The account holder retains the authority to manage these Admin User Accounts, including designating access levels to specific business functionalities and reports.  
3. The primary account holder and users with Admin User Accounts will be collectively referred to as E-commerce Users.

Original Question: "Can marketing information be considered confidential according to the terms?"

New Questions:
a. "Is technical process documentation classified as confidential based on the conditions outlined in the agreement?"
b. "Can customer lists be deemed confidential under the stipulations provided in the contract?"
c. "Is unpublished financial information regarded as confidential according to the provisions of the terms of service?"
d. "Does proprietary software code fall under the definition of confidential information as outlined in the agreement?" 

Contract for New Questions:

1. Confidential Information shall include, but shall not be limited to, any and all information related to a party's business activities that is not publicly available, which encompasses specific technical documents, sales strategies, proprietary software, customer databases, financial records, and any other unpublished sensitive information. Specifically, the confidential information of Company XYZ includes all knowledge pertaining to its operations and the services it provides that is not accessible to the general population, including aspects related to its security measures and methodologies.

2. Each party acknowledges that it will utilize the confidential information of the other party exclusively for fulfilling its responsibilities as stated in these Terms of Service, adhering to all obligations outlined herein, especially this Section 6. Each party commits to implementing all necessary measures, equivalent to the protections applied to its own proprietary data, to inhibit unauthorized replication, disclosure, or use of any confidential information outside the exceptions provided; which include, (i) access to employees, representatives, or subcontractors that require such information to fulfill obligations hereunder, provided they maintain strict confidentiality; or (ii) compliance with any legal obligation, regulation, or judicial order, ensuring, if legally permissible, that the disclosing party receives prompt written notification and efforts made to maintain confidentiality. Confidential Information shall not encompass data that can be proven by the receiving party as: (A) previously available to the public, or as known by or possessed by the receiving party before disclosure; (B) independently produced by the receiving party without reference to or use of the other party's confidential information, not contravening these Terms of Service; or (C) later lawfully acquired from a third party, without breaching any provision of these Terms.

Original Question: "Do the terms deem certain marketing information Confidential Information?"

Contracts for New Questions:
a. "1. Confidential Information shall include, but shall not be limited to, any and all financial projections associated with a party's business and not publicly known, including projected revenues, budget forecasts, and expense estimates."
   
b. "1. Confidential Information shall encompass specific customer feedback received by either party that is not known to the public, including suggestions, complaints, testimonials, and other forms of client communication."

c. "1. Confidential Information includes proprietary software code that has not been disclosed to the public, encompassing source code, object code, and accompanying documentation."

d. "1. Confidential Information is defined to include trade secrets of either party, which consist of any information that derives independent economic value from not being generally known or readily ascertainable."

Such Beta Features and all associated conversations and materials relating thereto will be considered Company Confidential Information and subject to the confidentiality provisions in this agreement. Without limiting the generality of the foregoing, you agree that you will not make any public statements or otherwise disclose your participation in the Beta Features without the Company’s prior written consent. The Company makes no representations or warranties that the Beta Features will function. The Company may discontinue the Beta Features at any time in its sole discretion. The Company will have no liability for any harm or damage arising out of or in connection with a Beta Feature. The Beta Features may not work in the same way as a final version. The Company may change or not release a final or commercial version of a Beta Feature in its sole discretion."

Original Question: "Does Shopify preclude users of Beta Services from disclosing their participation in such services?"

Contracts corresponding to the new questions:

a. **Contract for Generated Question 1**: 
"From time to time, the Company may, at its discretion, invite you to participate in trial features that are under development and not fully available to all users (Trial Features). Participation in Trial Features may be conditional upon additional agreements, which the Company will provide you prior to your engagement. All materials and discussions related to Trial Features will be regarded as Company Confidential Information and are subject to the confidentiality terms outlined in this agreement. Specifically, you acknowledge that you shall not publicly disclose or discuss your involvement with the Trial Features without obtaining prior written approval from the Company. The Company makes no guarantees or warranties that the Trial Features will perform as intended. The Company reserves the right to terminate the Trial Features at any time at its discretion."

b. **Contract for Generated Question 2**: 
"At times, the Organization may invite users to access early access programs that are currently being tested and are not available to the general public (Early Access Programs). Participants in these programs may be subject to further contractual obligations, which will be disclosed prior to your participation. All discussions and documents pertaining to such programs will be considered Organization's Confidential Information and will be bound by the confidentiality clauses in this contract. You agree not to share or disclose your experiences in the Early Access Programs without receiving express written consent from the Organization beforehand. The Organization does not guarantee that the Early Access Programs will operate as their final versions. The Organization reserves the right to alter or cancel these programs at its own discretion."

c. **Contract for Generated Question 3**: 
"The Provider may relatively frequently allow users to engage with pre-release software that is still in development and not available for public use (Pre-release Software). Users wishing to participate will face additional terms, which will be communicated before any usage. All conversations and related materials linked to this software will be deemed the Provider’s Confidential Information and governed by this confidentiality agreement. You agree that you will not make any public disclosures about your experiences with the Pre-release Software without receiving prior authorization from the Provider in writing. The Provider disclaims any warranties regarding the performance of the Pre-release Software and retains the discretion to withdraw access to it at any time."

d. **Contract for Generated Question 4**: 
"Occasionally, the Firm may solicit beta testers to evaluate beta programs that are still being developed and are not available to all users (Beta Programs). Participation in these Beta Programs may entail accepting additional terms, which will be provided before use. All related discussions and materials will be treated as Firm's Confidential Information and are subject to the confidentiality obligations within this agreement. You agree to refrain from making any public statements about your participation in the Beta Programs without the prior written permission from the Firm. The Firm does not guarantee any specific result from the Beta Programs and may suspend or modify these offerings at its discretion."

Original Question: By default, does eBay prohibit transfers of eBay accounts?

New Questions:
a. By default, does Etsy allow the transfer of seller accounts to another user?
b. By default, does Amazon restrict the sharing of Prime membership accounts between users?
c. By default, does PayPal permit users to transfer their accounts to different individuals?
d. By default, does Facebook allow users to sell or transfer their personal profiles to someone else?

Contract for New Questions:
1. **Etsy Account Transfer Policy**: In connection with using or accessing our Services, you will not:
   - transfer your Etsy seller account, including any associated shop name and profile information, to any other party without our explicit written consent;
   - share account login details or access credentials with anyone else;
   - engage in unauthorized account sharing, which may result in penalties including suspension or termination of your account.

2. **Amazon Prime Membership Policy**: In connection with using or accessing Amazon Prime, you will not:
   - share or sell your Prime membership to anyone else;
   - attempt to transfer your Prime account to another person without our prior approval;
   - use your Prime benefits to benefit another user outside of the family sharing allowances, which may lead to account restrictions.

3. **PayPal Account Transfer Policy**: In connection with using or accessing our Services, you will not:
   - assign or transfer your PayPal account, including its balance or transaction history, to anyone else without our permission;
   - share your account login credentials with third parties;
   - violate our policies against unauthorized account sharing, which can result in account limitations or suspension.

4. **Facebook Profile Transfer Policy**: In connection with using or accessing our Services, you will not:
   - transfer your Facebook personal profile to another individual;
   - share your login information for the purpose of allowing others to use your account;
   - attempt to sell or otherwise convey your account ownership, which may lead to permanent account deactivation.

Generated Contracts:
1. "The subscription fees for our streaming service are outlined in our pricing pages. We may modify our subscription rates from time to time by notifying subscribers 14 days in advance, but no advance notice is required for temporary offers or any changes that lower fees.

If you are a subscriber, you are responsible for any transaction fees incurred during your subscription, even if the payment is processed outside of our platform. Specifically, if you provide or seek your contact details for the purpose of obtaining services outside of our platform, you may be liable to pay associated fees.

You must maintain valid payment information while subscribed to our services and pay all charges and applicable taxes by the due date. Should your payment method fail or your account become overdue, we may recover amounts owed by charging alternate payment methods on file, engaging collection agencies, or suspending services. For accounts that are overdue by more than 60 days, we may request the payment processor to withdraw sums owed from your account. Additionally, late fees may be imposed. The subscription service and any collection agencies utilized may report your account status to credit bureaus, potentially affecting your credit profile. If you want to dispute any information reported to a credit bureau about your account, please get in touch with us. Should you wish to contest any data a collection agency supplied to a credit bureau, direct your inquiries to the collection agency.

In jurisdictions where we are required to collect sales taxes for services rendered, we may gather such taxes from you through the payment method you provided in the Billing Agreement or through other available means.

Subscription fees do not grant exclusive rights to service access. We may display advertisements (including links and references) or other promotional content on our service at our discretion, without needing seller approval or compensation."



72
Original Question: "Is eBay entitled to suspend an account in the event that the credit card registered with such account is rejected?"

New Questions:
a. "Can an online marketplace revoke a seller's access if the payment method linked to their account fails to process transactions?"
b. "Is a subscription service allowed to terminate a user's membership if their billing information is outdated and can't be charged?"
c. "May a digital platform disable a user's account when the debit card associated with it has insufficient funds?"
d. "Can a transaction service block a client's account if their linked checking account doesn't cover a scheduled payment?"

Contract Corresponding to New Questions:
The fees we charge for utilizing our Services are detailed on our Fee Structure pages. We may modify our seller fees periodically by updating the changes on our website 14 days in advance; however, no prior notice is required for temporary promotions or any adjustments leading to reduced fees.

If you are a seller, you are responsible for any transaction fees incurred from sales executed using any of our Services, even if the sales agreement is reached or the payment occurs outside of our platform. Particularly, if you provide or ask for personal contact information in relation to transactions outside of our Services, you could be subject to pay a final value fee linked to that item, regardless of whether the item is sold, given your engagement of our Services for connecting with a buyer.

You must have a valid payment method registered while using our Services and settle all fees and applicable taxes related to our Services by the designated due date. If your payment method encounters issues or your account is overdue, we may recover amounts owed by charging alternative payment methods you have on file with us, employ collections agencies and legal representation, suspend or restrict Services, and for accounts exceeding 60 days overdue, request that your payment service deduct the amount owed from your account balance. Additionally, you may incur late fees. Our company, or the collections agencies we engage, may also relay information concerning your account to credit bureaus, resulting in late payments, missed payments, or defaults potentially being reflected in your credit report. If you wish to dispute the information reported to a credit bureau (i.e., Experian, Equifax, or TransUnion), please reach out to us at [Company Name], C/O Collections Department, [Address Line], [City, Zip]. To dispute any information that a collection agency reported about your account, you should contact that collection agency directly.

In regions where we are mandated to collect sales taxes on transactions you conduct through our Services, we may retrieve these sales taxes from you using the payment methods you have on file under the terms set in the Billing Agreement or via other operational means available.

Seller fees do not guarantee exclusive rights to item visibility on our Services. We retain the right to display third-party advertisements (including links and references) or other content throughout our Services, at our sole discretion and without requiring consent from, or providing any compensation, fee reductions, or credits to sellers.



73
Original Question: "If I win an eBay bid, am I actually obligated to purchase the item?"
New Questions:
a. "If I successfully place a winning bid on an auction site for a collectible, is there a legal obligation for me to complete the purchase?"
b. "Once I win a bid on a car auction platform, am I required by law to follow through with the payment?"
c. "If I secure the highest bid for a piece of artwork on an online platform, do I have to finalize the transaction?"
d. "If I win an auction for a vintage item on a bidding website, am I legally bound to buy the item?"

Contracts corresponding to the new questions:
a. When buying an item on our Services, you agree to the Rules and policies for buyers and that:
You are responsible for reading the full item listing before making a bid or committing to buy,
You enter into a legally binding contract to purchase an item when you commit to buy an item, your offer for an item is accepted, or if you have the winning bid (or your bid is otherwise accepted),
For collectible items sold through auction, a bid or offer initiates a binding obligation to complete the purchase upon winning,
We do not transfer legal ownership of items from the seller to the buyer,
Applicable state laws govern the transfer of ownership between the buyer and the seller, unless otherwise agreed.

b. When buying an item on our Services, you agree to the Rules and policies for buyers and that:
You are responsible for reading the full item listing before making a bid or committing to buy,
You enter into a legally binding contract to purchase an item when you commit to buy an item, your offer for an item is accepted, or if you have the winning bid (or your bid is otherwise accepted),
For motor vehicles sold through auction, a winning bid represents an obligation to purchase the vehicle,
We do not transfer legal ownership of items from the seller to the buyer,
Applicable state laws govern the transfer of ownership between the buyer and the seller, unless otherwise agreed.

c. When buying an item on our Services, you agree to the Rules and policies for buyers and that:
You are responsible for reading the full item listing before making a bid or committing to buy,
You enter into a legally binding contract to purchase an item when you commit to buy an item, your offer for an item is accepted, or if you have the winning bid (or your bid is otherwise accepted),
Winning a bid for an artwork on our platform constitutes a binding agreement to purchase the item,
We do not transfer legal ownership of items from the seller to the buyer,
Applicable state laws govern the transfer of ownership between the buyer and the seller, unless otherwise agreed.

d. When buying an item on our Services, you agree to the Rules and policies for buyers and that:
You are responsible for reading the full item listing before making a bid or committing to buy,
You enter into a legally binding contract to purchase an item when you commit to buy an item, your offer for an item is accepted, or if you have the winning bid (or your bid is otherwise accepted),
A bid won for a vintage item on our site results in a legal obligation to buy that item,
We do not transfer legal ownership of items from the seller to the buyer,
Applicable state laws govern the transfer of ownership between the buyer and the seller, unless otherwise agreed.



74
Original Question: "Do winning bids on eBay entail a legal obligation on the part of the bidder to purchase the applicable item?"

New Questions:
a. "In a live auction, does winning a bid create a contractual obligation for the winning bidder to buy the auctioned artwork?"
b. "If someone wins a bid on an online marketplace for a vintage car, are they legally required to complete the purchase?"
c. "When a participant successfully bids for a rare antique at a silent auction, do they have a legal obligation to pay for the item?"
d. "Does winning a silent bid at a charity auction mean the bidder must legally purchase the donated item?"

Contracts for New Questions:
a. **Contract for Question a**: 
"When participating in our live auction, you agree to the terms and conditions, including:
You are responsible for thoroughly reviewing the artwork listing before placing a bid,
Winning a bid creates a legally binding obligation to purchase the artwork,
The winning bidder must fulfill payment in accordance with the auction rules,
All sales are final upon the acceptance of the winning bid, and any disputes will be resolved according to the state’s auction laws."

b. **Contract for Question b**: 
"By placing a bid on our online marketplace for motor vehicles, you accept our buyer policies which stipulate:
You are encouraged to read all details of the vintage car listing before committing to purchase,
A successful bid on a vehicle generates a contract requiring the completion of the sale,
The buyer must comply with payment terms as outlined in the listing,
Legal ownership will transfer upon receipt of full payment, per local vehicle sales regulations."

c. **Contract for Question c**: 
"When participating in our silent auction, you agree to the following terms:
You must review the antique’s details thoroughly before submitting a bid,
Winning a bid constitutes a binding agreement to purchase the antique item,
Payment must be completed within the specified timeframe following the auction closing,
This contract is enforceable under the applicable auction laws of the state."

d. **Contract for Question d**: 
"By bidding in our charity auction, you confirm your understanding of the following rules:
Careful review of the donated item description is expected before bidding,
Winning a bid automatically creates a legal obligation to purchase the item,
Bidders must ensure payment is made upon winning, in line with auction guidelines,
All transactions are final and governed by state charity auction laws."

77
Original Question: "Does eBay ever do robocalls?"

New Questions:
a. "Does Amazon ever make automated calls to its customers?"
b. "Will Etsy use prerecorded messages to contact its sellers?"
c. "Does PayPal engage in any automated calling practices for account notifications?"
d. "Is it common for Uber to send text messages using autodialed systems for service updates?"

**Contract Correspondence for New Questions:**

**a. Amazon**
Amazon may contact you using autodialed or prerecorded calls and text messages, at any telephone number that you have provided us, to: (i) notify you regarding your account; (ii) troubleshoot problems with your orders; (iii) resolve a dispute; (iv) collect a debt; (v) poll your opinions through surveys or questionnaires; or (vi) as otherwise necessary to service your account or enforce this User Agreement. Amazon may also contact you using autodialed or prerecorded calls and text messages for marketing purposes (e.g., offers and promotions), if you consent to such communications. 

Our collection, use, disclosure, retention, and protection of your personal information is governed by the User Privacy Notice. Amazon may collect other telephone numbers for you and may place manual non-marketing calls to any of those numbers and autodialed non-marketing calls to any landline. Standard telephone minute and text charges may apply and may include overage fees if you have exceeded your plan limits. If you do not wish to receive such communications, you may change your communications preference at any time.

Amazon may share your telephone number with its authorized service providers as stated in our User Privacy Notice. These service providers may contact you using autodialed or prerecorded calls and text messages, only as authorized by Amazon to carry out the purposes identified above.

Amazon may, without further notice or warning and in its discretion, monitor or record telephone conversations you or anyone acting on your behalf has with Amazon or its agents for quality control and training purposes, or for its own protection.

Amazon's automated systems scan and analyze the contents of messages sent through its platform to detect and prevent fraudulent activity or violations of Amazon's User Agreement, including the incorporated terms, notices, rules, and policies. This scanning and analysis may occur before, during, or after the message is sent, or while in storage, and may result in messages being delayed or withheld. 

---

**b. Etsy**
Etsy may contact you using autodialed or prerecorded calls and text messages, at any telephone number that you have provided us, to: (i) notify you regarding your account; (ii) troubleshoot problems with your orders; (iii) resolve a dispute; (iv) collect a debt; (v) poll your opinions through surveys or questionnaires; or (vi) as otherwise necessary to service your account or enforce this User Agreement. Etsy may also contact you using autodialed or prerecorded calls and text messages for marketing purposes (e.g., offers and promotions), if you consent to such communications.

Our collection, use, disclosure, retention, and protection of your personal information is governed by the User Privacy Notice. Standard telephone minute and text charges may apply and may include overage fees if you have exceeded your plan limits. If you do not wish to receive such communications, you may change your communications preference at any time.

Etsy may share your telephone number with its authorized service providers as stated in our User Privacy Notice. These service providers may contact you using autodialed or prerecorded calls and text messages, only as authorized by Etsy to carry out the purposes identified above.

Etsy may, without further notice or warning and in its discretion, monitor or record telephone conversations you or anyone acting on your behalf has with Etsy or its agents for quality control and training purposes, or for its own protection.

Etsy's automated systems scan and analyze the contents of messages sent through its platform to detect and prevent fraudulent activity or violations of Etsy's User Agreement, including the incorporated terms, notices, rules, and policies. This scanning and analysis may occur before, during, or after the message is sent, or while in storage, and may result in messages being delayed or withheld.

---

**c. PayPal**
PayPal may contact you using autodialed or prerecorded calls and text messages, at any telephone number that you have provided us, to: (i) notify you regarding your account; (ii) troubleshoot problems with processing transactions; (iii) resolve a dispute; (iv) collect a debt; (v) poll your opinions through surveys or questionnaires; or (vi) as otherwise necessary to service your account or enforce this User Agreement. PayPal may also contact you using autodialed or prerecorded calls and text messages for marketing purposes (e.g., offers and promotions), if you consent to such communications.

Our collection, use, disclosure, retention, and protection of your personal information is governed by the User Privacy Notice. PayPal may collect other telephone numbers for you and may place manual non-marketing calls to any of those numbers and autodialed non-marketing calls to any landline. PayPal may, without further notice or warning and in its discretion, monitor or record telephone conversations you or anyone acting on your behalf has with PayPal or its agents for quality control and training purposes, or for its own protection.

PayPal's automated systems scan and analyze the contents of messages sent through its platform to detect and prevent fraudulent activity or violations of PayPal's User Agreement, including the incorporated terms, notices, rules, and policies. This scanning and analysis may occur before, during, or after the message is sent, or while in storage, and may result in messages being delayed or withheld.

**d. Uber**
Uber may contact you using autodialed or prerecorded calls and text messages, at any telephone number that you have provided us, to: (i) notify you regarding your account; (ii) troubleshoot problems with your rides; (iii) resolve a dispute; (iv) collect a fare; (v) poll your opinions through surveys or questionnaires; or (vi) as otherwise necessary to service your account or enforce this User Agreement. Uber may also contact you using autodialed or prerecorded calls and text messages for marketing purposes (e.g., offers and promotions), if you consent to such communications.
