**Hulu Service**

1.1. You must be at least 18 years of age, or the age of majority in your jurisdiction, to become a member of the Hulu service. Minors may only use the service under adult supervision.

1.2. The Hulu service and any content accessed through the service are for your personal, non-commercial use only and may not be shared with individuals outside your household. Your membership grants you a limited, non-exclusive, non-transferable right to access the Hulu service and view Hulu content. Except as outlined above, no ownership rights shall be transferred to you.

1.3. You may view Hulu content primarily within the country where you have registered your account and only in specific geographic locations where we provide services and have licensed the content. Content availability will vary based on your location and may change periodically.

1.4. The Hulu service, including the content library, is continuously updated. We also perform tests on various aspects of our service, including user interfaces and promotional features. You can opt-out of test participation at any time through your account settings.

1.5. Some Hulu content may be downloaded temporarily for offline viewing on supported devices (Offline Titles). Limitations apply, such as the number of Offline Titles per account and maximum devices that can hold Offline Titles. If you travel to a location where that content isn’t streamable, it may not be playable while you are there.

1.6. You agree to use the Hulu service in accordance with all applicable laws and regulations. You agree not to archive, reproduce, distribute, modify, or create derivative works from Hulu content without explicit authorization. Additionally, you agree not to circumvent any content protections and not to interfere with the service in any manner.

1.7. The quality of the Hulu content display may vary based on the device used, bandwidth, and internet connection speed. For optimal viewing, specific speeds are recommended for different quality levels. You are responsible for all internet access charges and should check with your provider regarding possible data usage fees.

1.8. Hulu software is developed for enabling content viewing and may vary across devices. This software may require third-party licenses, and you agree that you may automatically receive updates for Hulu and related third-party software.

Contract for New Questions:
1. Passwords and Account Access. The member who created the Spotify account and whose Payment Method is charged (the "Account Owner") has access and control over the Spotify account and the devices that are used to access our service and is responsible for any activity that occurs through the Spotify account. To maintain control over the account and to prevent anyone from accessing the account (which would include information on listening history for the account), the Account Owner should maintain control over the devices that are used to access the service and not reveal the password or details of the Payment Method associated with the account to anyone. You are responsible for updating and maintaining the accuracy of the information you provide to us relating to your account. We can terminate your account or place your account on hold in order to protect you, Spotify or our partners from identity theft or other fraudulent activity.

2. Passwords and Account Access. The person who manages the Hulu subscription and whose Payment Method is charged (the "Account Owner") has access and control over the Hulu account and the devices that are used to access our service and is responsible for any activity that occurs through the Hulu account. You are responsible for updating and maintaining the accuracy of the information you provide to us relating to your account. We can terminate your account or place your account on hold in order to protect you, Hulu or our partners from identity theft or other fraudulent activity.

3. Passwords and Account Access. The account holder for the Amazon Prime membership and whose Payment Method is charged (the "Account Owner") has access and control over the Amazon Prime account and the devices that are used to access our service and is responsible for any activity that occurs through the Amazon Prime account. To maintain control over the account and to prevent anyone from accessing the account (which would include information on order history for the account), the Account Owner should maintain control over the devices that are used to access the service and not reveal the password or details of the Payment Method associated with the account to anyone. You are responsible for updating and maintaining the accuracy of the information you provide to us relating to your account. We can terminate your account or place your account on hold in order to protect you, Amazon or our partners from identity theft or other fraudulent activity.

4. Passwords and Account Access. You are responsible for updating and maintaining the accuracy of the information you provide to us relating to your account. We can terminate your account or place your account on hold in order to protect you, Disney+ or our partners from identity theft or other fraudulent activity.

Contract corresponding to the new questions:
8. Miscellaneous

8.1. Governing Law. These Terms of Use shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the Netherlands.

8.2. Unsolicited Materials. Apple does not accept unsolicited materials or ideas for Apple content and is not responsible for the similarity of any of its content or programming in any media to materials or ideas transmitted to Apple.

8.3. Customer Support. To find more information about our service and its features or if you need assistance with your account, please visit the Apple Help Center on our website. In certain instances, Customer Service may best be able to assist you by using a remote access support tool through which we have full access to your computer. If you do not want us to have this access, you should not consent to support through the remote access tool, and we will assist you through other means. In the event of any conflict between these Terms of Use and information provided by Customer Support or other portions of our website, these Terms of Use will control.

8.4. Survival. If any provision or provisions of these Terms of Use shall be held to be invalid, illegal, or unenforceable, the validity, legality and enforceability of the remaining provisions shall remain in full force and effect.

8.5. Changes to Terms of Use and Assignment. Apple may, from time to time, change these Terms of Use. We will notify you at least 30 days before such changes apply to you. We may assign or transfer our agreement with you including our associated rights and obligations at any time and you agree to cooperate with us in connection with such an assignment or transfer.

8.6. Electronic Communications. We will send you information relating to your account (e.g. payment authorizations, invoices, changes in password or Payment Method, confirmation messages, notices) in electronic form only, for example via emails to your email address provided during registration. 

(Note: The same structure and clauses can be altered to fit the new tech company being referenced, such as Amazon and Google, while keeping the original content's essence.)

8.2. Unsolicited Materials. [Software Name] does not accept unsolicited materials from users and cannot be held accountable for similarities found in its offerings.
8.3. Customer Support. Users requesting customer support are provided with alternatives, including chat and email, that do not necessitate granting remote access to their device. 

d. 
**Contract for Generated Question 4:**
8.1. Governing Law. The laws governing these Terms of Use will be those of the user's country of residence.
8.2. Unsolicited Materials. [Bank Name] does not accept unsolicited materials from customers and is not liable for any content similarities.
8.3. Customer Support. Customers are assured that assistance for account issues can be accessed through secure methods that do not require granting remote access to their bank account.

Original Question: "Can I download copyrighted videos to watch at home?"
New Questions:
a. "Is it permissible for me to save copyrighted music for offline listening?"
b. "Am I allowed to download copyrighted eBooks for personal use on my device?"
c. "Can I legally download copyrighted software for personal use?"
d. "Is it acceptable to download copyrighted photographs for my personal collection?" 

Contracts:
1. The Site contains copyrighted material, trademarks, and other proprietary information, including text, software, photos, video, graphics, music, and sound. All content on the Site is protected under applicable copyright laws. You may not save, share, or redistribute copyrighted videos without express permission from the copyright holder. Downloading of copyrighted materials is only allowed for personal, non-commercial use. Unauthorized copying, redistribution, or alteration of these materials is strictly prohibited and may result in legal consequences. You acknowledge that no ownership rights are transferred to you upon downloading copyrighted videos.

2. The Site includes various types of copyrighted content such as music and audio files. You may only download copyrighted music for personal enjoyment, provided that you do not use it for commercial purposes. No alterations, distributions, or public performances are allowed without prior consent from the copyright owner. By downloading music, you agree that you do not gain any ownership rights to the material.

3. The Site comprises copyrighted resources such as eBooks and digital publications. Downloading these resources is permitted solely for personal reading, and you may not share, sell, or distribute the eBooks. Any alteration or unauthorized distribution is forbidden. You understand that your rights are limited to personal use only.

4. The Site offers a variety of proprietary images and photographs, all of which are subject to copyright law. You can download these photographs only for personal use; commercial use or distribution is not allowed unless you receive explicit permission from the copyright holder. By downloading, you affirm that you do not acquire any ownership or rights to the images themselves.

c. "A cooking blog grants permission for its recipes to be used for educational demonstrations in cooking classes. The blog, however, is not responsible for any outcomes that may arise from following its recipes without additional guidance or support."

7. Indemnification.
You agree to defend, indemnify and hold harmless XYZ Corp., its affiliates and their respective directors, officers, employees and agents from and against all claims and expenses, including attorneys' fees, arising out of the use of the Site by you or your Account. XYZ Corp. reserves the right to take over the exclusive defense of any claim for which we are entitled to indemnification under this Section. In such event, you shall provide XYZ Corp. with such cooperation as is reasonably requested by XYZ Corp.

8. Termination.
XYZ Corp. may terminate or suspend these Terms of Use at any time without notice to you. Without limiting the foregoing, XYZ Corp. shall have the right to immediately terminate Your Account in the event of any conduct by you which XYZ Corp., in its sole discretion, considers to be unacceptable, or in the event of any breach by you of these Terms of Use. The provisions of Sections 1 - 13 shall survive termination of these Terms of Use.

XYZ Corp., its parent, subsidiaries and affiliates, own all rights to their logos and trademarks used in connection with the Site. All other logos and trademarks appearing on the Site are the property of their respective owners.

DEF Inc. reserves the right to take over the exclusive defense of any claim for which we are entitled to indemnification under this Section. GHI Corporation reserves the right to take over the exclusive defense of any claim for which we are entitled to indemnification under this Section. Contract for New Questions:
1. Governing Law and Venue.
The content, data, agreements, and all other material and features in the Lease are presented for the purpose of establishing terms and conditions for the rental of property in the State of California and shall include specifications relevant to parties involved in real estate transactions within that jurisdiction. Any disputes, claims, and controversies arising out of or in connection with the lease agreement shall be governed by and construed exclusively in accordance with the laws of the State of California, without giving effect to its conflict of law provisions. To the extent that a dispute is not subject to arbitration under a separate Dispute Resolution section of this Lease, that action shall be brought in the appropriate state or federal court located in Los Angeles County, California; and both parties irrevocably consent to the exclusive jurisdiction and venue of the state or federal courts in Los Angeles County, California for the adjudication of all non-arbitral claims.

2. Severability.
Except as specified in the Dispute Resolution section, if any provision of this Lease shall be unlawful, void, or for any reason unenforceable, then that provision shall be deemed severable from this Lease and shall not affect the validity and enforceability of any remaining provisions. This Lease constitutes the entire agreement between the parties relating to the matters contained herein.

If one clause in a rental agreement is deemed unenforceable, does that affect the enforceability of the other clauses?

For Question b:

For Question c: 
If a confidentiality term in an employment contract is ruled void, do the remaining terms of the contract still hold?

For Question d:

**10. Governing Law and Venue**
The contents, materials, and features provided on this platform are intended solely for entertainment, news dissemination, and the promotion of upcoming programs, films, music, games, and other products and services that may be available in Canada and its territories. 

All disputes, claims, and controversies relating to your access to, use of the Site, or the content and services offered therein shall be governed exclusively by the laws of the Province of Ontario. Any legal actions not subject to arbitration under Section 12 (Dispute Resolution) of this contract shall be brought in the competent courts located in Toronto, Ontario, and both parties submit to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts in Toronto for any claims that are not arbitrated.

**11. Severability**
Unless stated otherwise in Section 12 (Dispute Resolution), if any part of this Agreement is found to be unlawful, void, or unenforceable, that specific provision will be severed without affecting the validity and enforceability of the remaining terms. This document constitutes the complete agreement between the parties concerning the subjects addressed herein.

Original Question: "If I think my writing has been illegally copied onto CNN, does CNN have a process for dealing with this?"

New Questions:
a. "If I believe my artwork has been wrongfully used by a local gallery, does the gallery have a procedure for addressing this?"
b. "If I suspect that my music has been plagiarized on a streaming platform, does that platform have a policy to handle such claims?"
c. "If I feel that my video content has been unfairly utilized on a social media site, does the site provide a method for resolving such issues?"
d. "If I think my photograph has been unlawfully used by an online publication, does the publication have a system for responding to these types of concerns?"

New Contracts:
1. "The local gallery respects the intellectual property rights of all creators and has established a policy for addressing claims of unauthorized use of copyrighted works. If you believe your artwork has been misused, please provide the gallery with the following information:
   a. A physical or electronic signature of a person authorized to act on behalf of the owner of the artwork;
   b. Identification of the artwork claimed to have been infringed, or, if multiple artworks at a single venue are covered by a single notification, a representative list of such artworks;
   c. Identification of the material that is claimed to be infringing and that is to be removed or disabled, along with sufficient information to locate the material;
   d. Information allowing the gallery to contact the complainant;
   e. A statement that the complainant has a good-faith belief that the use of the material is not authorized by the owner or the law; and
   f. A statement that the information is accurate and that the complainant is authorized to act on behalf of the rights owner."

2. "The streaming platform respects the rights of all content creators and has a process in place to address claims of copyright infringement. If you believe your music has been used without permission, please submit the following details to the platform's Copyright Agent:
   a. A signature from an authorized person representing the rights holder;
   b. Identification of the music work claimed to be infringed, or if multiple works, a representative list of those works;
   c. Identification of the allegedly infringing material and information sufficient to locate it;
   d. Contact information for the complainant;
   e. A statement that the complainant believes in good faith that the use is unauthorized; and
   f. A declaration that the information is accurate and the complainant is authorized to act on behalf of the rights holder."

3. "The social media site values the rights of content creators and has procedures in place to manage copyright infringement claims effectively. If you suspect your video has been used unlawfully, please provide the following information to the site:
   a. A signature from someone authorized to act on behalf of the rights holder;
   b. Identification of the video content claimed to be infringed, or a representative list if multiple videos are involved;
   c. Identification of the infringing material and sufficient information to locate it;
   d. Contact details for the complainant;
   e. A statement affirming that the complainant has a good-faith belief the use is unauthorized; and
   f. A statement confirming the accuracy of the information and that the complainant is authorized to act for the rights holder."

4. "The online publication takes intellectual property rights seriously and has implemented a policy to address claims of copyright violations. If you think your photograph has been used without consent, please submit the following information:
   a. A signature of a representative of the rights holder;
   b. Identification of the photograph claimed to have been infringed, or a list if there are multiple works;
   c. Detailed identification of the material claimed to be infringing with the means to locate it;
   d. Relevant contact information for the complainant;
   e. A statement indicating that the complainant has a good-faith belief that the use of the photograph is not authorized; and
   f. A confirmation of the accuracy of the information and that the complainant is authorized to act on behalf of the rights holder."



121
Original Question: "Does CNN have in place procedures to address alleged copyright infringements pertaining to written content published in CNN products and services?"

New Questions:
a. "Does National Geographic have protocols to handle claims of copyright violations regarding photographs used in their publications and online content?"
b. "Are there procedures at Spotify to manage reports of copyright infringement related to music tracks available on their platform?"
c. "Does Amazon have systems in place to respond to allegations of copyright infringement concerning e-books sold through its Kindle service?"
d. "Is there a policy at YouTube for addressing complaints related to copyright breaches involving videos uploaded by users on the site?"

Contracts corresponding to the new questions:

a. **Contract for National Geographic:**
   National Geographic respects the rights of all copyright holders and has implemented a policy to address claims of copyright infringement. If you believe that your work has been copied in a way that constitutes copyright infringement, please provide National Geographic's Copyright Agent with the following information:
   1. A physical or electronic signature of the authorized person representing the copyright owner;
   2. Identification of the copyrighted work claimed to have been infringed;
   3. Identification of the infringing material and details to locate it;
   4. Information to contact the complaining party;
   5. A statement of good faith belief that the allegedly infringing use is unauthorized;
   6. A statement that the information provided is accurate and the person is authorized to act on behalf of the copyright owner.

b. **Contract for Spotify:**
   Spotify values the intellectual property rights of all content creators and has established procedures for addressing claims of copyright infringement. If you believe your work has been infringed, please submit the following to Spotify’s Copyright Agent:
   1. Signature of the authorized representative of the copyright owner;
   2. Identification of the copyright work in question;
   3. Identification of the infringing material on the platform;
   4. Contact information for the complainant;
   5. Statement of good faith regarding the unauthorized usage;
   6. Verification of accuracy in the notification submitted.

c. **Contract for Amazon:**
   Amazon is committed to respecting the rights of copyright holders and has a policy to address alleged infringements regarding e-books. If you suspect your work has been copied, please provide the following information to Amazon's Copyright Agent:
   1. An authorized signature from the copyright owner;
   2. Identification of the copyright work that you allege has been infringed;
   3. Identification and location of the infringing material;
   4. Contact details for the party complaining;
   5. A declaration of good faith belief regarding the unauthorized use;
   6. A statement confirming the accuracy and authority to act on behalf of the copyright owner.

d. **Contract for YouTube:**
   YouTube ensures the protection of copyright holders' rights and has implemented a policy for addressing copyright infringement complaints. If you believe your work has been infringed, please provide YouTube's Copyright Agent with the following:
   1. Signature of the individual authorized to act for the copyright owner;
   2. Description of the work claimed to be infringed;
   3. Identification of the material claimed to be infringing and its location;
   4. Sufficient contact information for the complainant;
   5. A statement that the complainant has a good faith belief that the use is unauthorized;
   6. A confirmation that the provided information is accurate and that the individual is authorized to represent the copyright owner.

Original Question: "Could my university potentially monitor what I do in Microsoft programs that I use through my university account?"

New Questions:
a. "Is it possible for my employer to track my activities in Google Workspace applications that I access through my work email?"

d. "Is there a chance that my college may audit my performance in online courses I access through my student account?"

Contract for New Questions:
1. Work or School Accounts. You can sign into certain Google services with a work email address. If you do, you agree that the owner of the domain associated with your email address may be notified of the existence of your Google account and its associated subscriptions, control and administer your account, and access and process your Data, including the contents of your communications and files, and that Google may notify the owner of the domain if the account or Data is compromised. You further agree that your use of the Google services may be subject to the agreements Google has with you or your organization and these Terms may not apply. If you already have a Google account and you use a separate work email address to access Services covered under these Terms, you may be prompted to update the email address associated with your Google account in order to continue accessing such Services.

2. Work or School Accounts. You can sign into certain educational platforms with a school email address. If you do, you agree that the owner of the domain associated with your email address may be notified of the existence of your educational account and its associated subscriptions, control and administer your account, and access and process your Data, including the contents of your communications and files, and that the educational platform may notify the owner of the domain if the account or Data is compromised. You further agree that your use of the educational services may be subject to the agreements the platform has with you or your institution and these Terms may not apply. If you already have an educational account and you use a separate school email address to access Services covered under these Terms, you may be prompted to update the email address associated with your educational account in order to continue accessing such Services.

3. Work or School Accounts. You can sign into certain file storage services with a work email address. If you do, you agree that the owner of the domain associated with your email address may be notified of the existence of your account and its associated subscriptions, control and administer your account, and access and process your Data, including the contents of your communications and files, and that the file storage service may notify the owner of the domain if the account or Data is compromised. You further agree that your use of the file storage services may be subject to the agreements the service has with you or your organization and these Terms may not apply. If you already have an account and you use a separate work email address to access Services covered under these Terms, you may be prompted to update the email address associated with your account in order to continue accessing such Services.

4. Work or School Accounts. You can sign into certain online course platforms with a student email address. If you do, you agree that the owner of the domain associated with your email address may be notified of the existence of your account and its associated subscriptions, control and administer your account, and access and process your Data, including the contents of your communications and files, and that the online course platform may notify the owner of the domain if the account or Data is compromised. You further agree that your use of the online services may be subject to the agreements the platform has with you or your college and these Terms may not apply. If you already have an account and you use a separate student email address to access Services covered under these Terms, you may be prompted to update the email address associated with your account in order to continue accessing such Services.

Original Question: "Does Microsoft sometimes enable educational institutions that provide their students with access to Microsoft services to monitor students' activities on such services?"

b. "Are companies offering cloud storage solutions able to empower businesses that provide their employees with access to their services to oversee employee usage on those services?"
c. "Is it common for software companies to allow non-profit organizations that give their members access to their systems to audit user activities on their platforms?"
d. "Can video conferencing tools enable educational organizations that offer their users access to their solutions to review participant activities during meetings?"

Contract for New Questions:
1. Contract: Online Learning Platforms. When you use an online learning platform, you agree that the institution providing you access may monitor your activities on the platform. This includes tracking your interactions, progress, and resources accessed. The institution may use this information to enhance your learning experience and ensure compliance with academic policies. Additionally, you acknowledge that the platform may inform the institution if your account or performance falls under any security alerts. Your continued usage signifies acceptance of these terms.

2. Contract: Cloud Storage Services. By utilizing a cloud storage solution provided by a company, you agree that the employer granting you access may oversee your activities on the platform. This is for maintaining data integrity and ensuring compliance with company policies. You further agree that the service provider may notify your employer regarding any concerning activities on your account. Your ongoing use of the service indicates your acceptance of these terms.

3. Contract: Non-Profit Organization Systems. When accessing systems provided by a non-profit organization, you consent to the organization monitoring your user activities for the purpose of program improvement and policy compliance. This includes tracking your usage patterns and engagement metrics. You acknowledge that the service provider may communicate any relevant security concerns to the organization. Your use of the system signifies your agreement to these terms.

4. Contract: Video Conferencing Services. By joining a video conferencing solution, you agree that the hosting organization has the right to review participant interactions during the meeting. This is for quality assurance and adherence to meeting guidelines. You understand that the service provider may report any unusual activities or breaches of conduct to the hosting organization. Continued participation in the meetings indicates your acceptance of these terms.



126
Original Question: "Might there be some services that I don't need internet access for?"

New Questions:
a. "Are there any applications that can function offline without needing a data connection?"
b. "Can I use certain features of a software program without being connected to the internet?"
c. "Do any tools or devices operate effectively without requiring a Wi-Fi connection?"
d. "Are there any types of media content I can access or play without an internet connection?"

Contract for New Questions:

a. Offline Functionality. Certain applications or tools may offer features that do not require an active internet connection. You are responsible for ensuring that you have the necessary software versions compatible with offline usage. While offline use may not incur additional fees from us, it is your responsibility to check any applicable fees from external providers or software vendors.

b. Software Accessibility. Some features of our software programs can be accessed without the need for an internet connection. You should verify with the software documentation or support resources whether specific functionalities are available offline prior to use.

c. Device Operation. Many tools or devices may have offline capabilities that allow them to operate without a Wi-Fi connection. Please consult the product specifications or user manual to understand their functionality without internet requirements.

d. Media Access. Various types of media content can be accessed or played without an internet connection. It is advisable to download or store your media content prior to disconnection from the internet to ensure uninterrupted access.

1. Additional Equipment/Data Plans. To utilize specific functionalities, you may not require a mobile data plan or internet connection. However, please note that to optimize your experience, a data plan or internet connection is recommended for certain features.

2. Service Notifications. If important updates about applications or tools arise, you may receive notifications via messages or emails, but a data plan may not be needed if the application can operate offline.

3. Support. Customer support for specific tools is available via predetermined channels. Some features may provide limited support without an internet connection, subject to existing terms.

4. Ending your Services. If your access to tools or functionalities is terminated (by you or by the provider), you may still retain access to certain offline features, and if an offline mode is available, you should consider implementing a regular backup plan for your data.

9. Payment Terms. If you purchase a Service, then these payment terms apply to your purchase and you agree to them.
a. Charges. If there is a charge associated with a portion of the Services, you agree to pay that charge. The price stated for these Services excludes all applicable taxes and fees, unless stated otherwise. You are solely responsible for paying such taxes or other charges, which could be affected by your method of access to the Service. Charges may vary based on your actual location as determined by your connection method. We may suspend or cancel the Services if we do not receive on-time, full payment from you. Suspension or cancellation of the Services for non-payment could result in a loss of access to your account and its content, regardless of how you accessed the Service.
b. Your Billing Account. To pay the charges for a Service, you will be asked to provide a payment method at the time you sign up for that Service. You can access and change your billing information and payment method on the respective account management website. You agree to permit the provider to use any updated account information regarding your selected payment method. Changes made to your billing account will not affect charges submitted to your billing account before we could reasonably act on your changes.
c. Billing. By providing a payment method, you represent that you are authorized to use that method and that any information you provide is true and accurate. You authorize us to charge you for the Services or available content using your payment method. We may bill you at various times; for example, in advance, at the time of purchase, or on a recurring basis. Any adjustments to charges for subscription services will be communicated in advance.
d. Recurring Payments. When you purchase Services on a subscription basis, you authorize recurring payments to be made at the intervals agreed upon until the subscription is terminated by you or by the provider. You must cancel your Services before the next billing date to stop being charged. By authorizing recurring payments, you are permitting the provider to process payments as electronic drafts from your designated account, or similar payment methods.
e. Online Statement and Errors. We will provide you with an online billing statement on our respective account management website, where you can view and print your statement. This is the only billing statement we provide. If we make an error, you must notify us within 90 days after the error appears on your bill, or you release us from liability for corrections or refunds. Any identified errors will be corrected promptly within the same time frame.



132
Original Question: "Does Microsoft download updates for my apps even if I'm not logged into them?"

New Questions:
a. "Does Apple install updates for my apps automatically even if I am not signed into the App Store?"
b. "Will Google automatically update my applications even if I'm not logged into the Play Store?"

### New Contracts Corresponding to Generated Questions:

a. **Contract for Apple App Store**: 
"Store" refers to a Service that allows you to browse, download, purchase, and rate and review applications available through Apple's App Store. These Terms cover the use of apps available on devices including iPhone, iPad, and Mac. "App Store" means the digital marketplace to access applications, games, and other digital content. Apple will check for and download updates to your applications, even if you are not signed into your Apple ID during that time. You can adjust your device settings if you prefer not to receive automatic updates to apps.

b. **Contract for Google Play Store**:
"Store" refers to a Service that allows you to download, purchase, and manage applications via the Google Play Store. These Terms encompass the use of the Play Store on various devices such as smartphones and tablets. Google will automatically check for and download updates for your apps, regardless of your sign-in status to Google Play. You may change application settings on your device if you do not wish to receive automatic updates.

c. **Contract for PlayStation Store**:
"Store" refers to a Service that allows you to access downloadable games and applications via the PlayStation Store. These Terms cover the use of games and applications on PlayStation consoles such as PlayStation 4 and PlayStation 5. Sony will automatically download game updates even if you are not logged into your PlayStation Network account. You can manage your system settings to disable automatic downloads if preferred.

d. **Contract for Amazon Kindle Store**:
"Store" refers to a Service that allows users to purchase and download eBooks and applications through the Amazon Kindle Store. These Terms cover the use of Kindle devices and applications. Amazon will automatically check and download updates for your Kindle apps, even if you are not logged into your Amazon account at the time. Users can modify their device settings if they wish to opt-out of automatic updates.

3. USER GENERATED CONTENT: SUBMISSIONS INCLUDING COMMENTS, REVIEWS, IMAGES, AND MORE

You shall not upload to, or distribute or otherwise publish onto the Services any libelous, defamatory, obscene, pornographic, abusive, or otherwise illegal material. You shall not upload to, or distribute or otherwise publish onto the Services any malware, viruses, spyware, or other malicious software or files to the Services. You shall not use automated means to upload to, or distribute or otherwise publish onto the Services any content.

Be courteous. You agree that you will not threaten or verbally abuse other members, use defamatory language, or deliberately disrupt discussions with repetitive messages, meaningless messages, or "spam."

Use respectful language. Like any community, the online conversation flourishes only when our members feel welcome and safe. You agree not to use language that abuses or discriminates on the basis of race, religion, nationality, gender, sexual preference, age, region, disability, etc. Hate speech of any kind is grounds for immediate and permanent suspension of access to all or part of the Services.

Debate, but don't attack. In a community full of opinions and preferences, people always disagree. The Service encourages active discussions and welcomes heated debate, but personal attacks are a direct violation of these Terms of Service and are grounds for immediate and permanent suspension of access to all or part of the Service.

3.2 The Services shall be used only in a noncommercial manner. You shall not, without the express approval of the Service, distribute or otherwise publish any material containing any solicitation of funds, advertising, or solicitation for goods or services.

3.3 You acknowledge that any submissions you make to the Services (i.e., user-generated content including but not limited to: comments, forum messages, reviews, images, audio, and video, as well as computer code and applications) (each, a "Submission") may be edited, removed, modified, published, transmitted, and displayed by the Service, and you waive any rights you may have in having the material altered or changed in a manner not agreeable to you. Submissions made to the Services may also be included in our feeds and made available for republishing through other formats.

3.4 You grant the Service a perpetual, nonexclusive, worldwide, royalty-free, sub-licensable license to the Submissions, which includes without limitation the right for the Service, or any third party it designates, to use, copy, transmit, excerpt, publish, distribute, publicly display, publicly perform, communicate to the public, create derivative works of, host, index, cache, tag, encode, modify and adapt (including without limitation the right to adapt to streaming, downloading, broadcast, mobile, digital, thumbnail, scanning, or other technologies) in any form or media now known or hereinafter developed, any Submission posted by you on or to the Services or on any other site owned by the Service.

3.5 You are solely responsible for the content of your Submissions. However, while the Service does not and cannot review every Submission and is not responsible for the content of these messages, the Service reserves the right to delete, move, or edit Submissions that it, in its sole discretion, deems abusive, defamatory, obscene, in violation of copyright or trademark laws, in violation of these Terms of Service, or otherwise unacceptable.

**Contract for TechDaily:**

6. REGISTRATION AND SECURITY

6.1 As part of the registration or account creation process, you will create login credentials by selecting a password and providing an e-mail address or by linking another account, such as your Facebook or Google accounts. You may also be requested to provide certain registration information, which must be accurate and updated.

Each registration is for a single user only. You are not allowed to share your registration login credentials or give your login credentials to anyone else. We may cancel or suspend your access to the Services if you share your login credentials. You are responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of your password, which you will not have to reveal to any representative or agent of TechDaily. You may not (i) select or use the login credentials of another person with the intent to impersonate that person; (ii) use login credentials in which another person has rights without such person's authorization; or (iii) use login credentials that we, in our sole discretion, deem offensive. Failure to comply with the foregoing shall constitute a breach of these Terms of Service, which may result in immediate suspension or termination of your account.

6.2 Please notify help@techdaily.com of any known or suspected unauthorized use(s) of your account, or any known or suspected breach of security, including loss, theft, or unauthorized disclosure of your password or credit card information.

6.3 You must be 13 years or older to use any part of the Services in the USA and the UK, and 16 years or older anywhere else. If you are less than 18 years of age and would like to use, subscribe, or register to any part of the Services, please ask your parent or legal guardian to review and agree to these Terms of Service before you use any part of the Services or ask them to complete the purchase and/or registration on your behalf.

6.4 You are responsible for all usage or activity on your account with TechDaily, including use of the account by any third party authorized by you to use your login credentials. Any fraudulent, abusive, or otherwise illegal activity may be grounds for termination of your account, at our sole discretion, and we may refer you to appropriate law enforcement agencies.

6.5 If your access to any Service has been provided by or through a third party (for example, your employer or an educational institution at which you are a student) (each, a Client), the Client may have provided us with information about you to enable us to provide you with access to the Services and distinguish you from other subscribers (such as your IP address, email address, or name).

You may not (i) select or use the login credentials of another person with the intent to impersonate that person; (ii) use login credentials in which another person has rights without such person's authorization; or (iii) use login credentials that we, in our sole discretion, deem offensive. Failure to comply with the foregoing shall constitute a breach of these Terms of Service, which may result in immediate suspension or termination of your account.

6.2 Please notify help@shopease.com of any known or suspected unauthorized use(s) of your account, or any known or suspected breach of security, including loss, theft, or unauthorized disclosure of your password or credit card information.

6.3 You must be 13 years or older to use any part of the Services in the USA and the UK, and 16 years or older anywhere else. If you are less than 18 years of age and would like to use, subscribe, or register to any part of the Services, please ask your parent or legal guardian to review and agree to these Terms of Service before you use any part of the Services or ask them to complete the purchase and/or registration on your behalf.

6.4 You are responsible for all usage or activity on your account with ShopEase, including use of the account by any third party authorized by you to use your login credentials. Any fraudulent, abusive, or otherwise illegal activity may be grounds for termination of your account, at our sole discretion, and we may refer you to appropriate law enforcement agencies.

6.5 If your access to any Service has been provided by or through a third party (for example, your employer or an educational institution at which you are a student) (each, a Client), the Client may have provided us with information about you to enable us to provide you with access to the Services and distinguish you from other subscribers (such as your IP address, email address, or name).

**Contract for MusicHub:**

6. REGISTRATION AND SECURITY

You may also be requested to provide certain registration information, which must be accurate and updated.

Each registration is for a single user only. You are not allowed to share your registration login credentials or give your login credentials to anyone else. We may cancel or suspend your access to the Services if you share your login credentials. You are responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of your password, which you will not have to reveal to any representative or agent of MusicHub. You may not (i) select or use the login credentials of another person with the intent to impersonate that person; (ii) use login credentials in which another person has rights without such person's authorization; or (iii) use login credentials that we, in our sole discretion, deem offensive. Failure to comply with the foregoing shall constitute a breach of these Terms of Service, which may result in immediate suspension or termination of your account.

a. License to Music Platform
(i) If you submit or upload music to the platform and subsequently remove it, you grant the platform a non-exclusive right to use, reproduce, modify, adapt, publish, and perform such music in their advertisements and marketing materials, even after removal.

b. License to Social Media Platform
(i) You acknowledge that if you share photographs on the social media site, even after you delete them, the platform retains a right to use those images for marketing and promotional activities based on the prior consent granted upon uploading.

c. License to Blog Website
(i) Upon posting blog content on the website, you give the platform limited rights to utilize those posts for promotional purposes, valid even if blog posts are later deleted by you.

d. License to Video Streaming Service
(i) By uploading videos to the streaming service, you permit the service to use clips of your content for advertising, with such rights continuing even after you have removed the content from their platform.

Users may promote, administer, or conduct a promotion (e.g., a political fundraising event) on, through, or utilizing the Instagram Services (a Promotion). If you choose to promote, administer, or conduct a Promotion on Instagram, you must adhere to the following rules: (1) You may carry out Promotions to the extent permitted by applicable law, and you are solely responsible for ensuring that any Promotions comply with any and all applicable laws, obligations, and restrictions; (2) You will be classified as the promoter of your Promotion in the applicable jurisdiction(s) and you will be solely responsible for all aspects of and expenses related to your Promotion; (3) Instagram has the right to remove your Promotion from the platform if Instagram reasonably believes that your Promotion does not comply with the Terms of Service or applicable law; (4) Instagram is not responsible for and does not endorse or support any such Promotions, and you cannot claim that Instagram is a sponsor or co-sponsor of the Promotion.

#### b. Endorsements/Testimonials
You agree that your content on Facebook will comply with applicable advertising guidelines concerning endorsements and testimonials. If you have received compensation or products in exchange for discussing a political initiative, you agree to disclose such relationships according to applicable laws. You are solely responsible for any endorsements or testimonials made regarding any political campaign or cause through Facebook.

#### c. Political Activity
Subject to these Terms of Service and the Community Guidelines, you may share political opinions; participate in political activity; provide links to a political committee's official website; and solicit viewers to make contributions directly to a political committee through your YouTube channel. You agree that these activities are entirely your own and that you will abide by all relevant laws and regulations.

#### d. Political Activity
You may share and promote political movements on TikTok, as long as you comply with TikTok's community guidelines and applicable legal requirements. By doing so, you represent and warrant that you are eligible to engage in these activities according to applicable law and that you will follow all relevant laws and regulations during such promotions. You agree not to solicit the use of or use any TikTok monetization tool for political contributions.

Microsoft reserves the right, at its sole discretion, to change, modify, add or remove portions of these Terms of Use, at any time. It is your responsibility to check these Terms of Use periodically for changes...

New Contracts:
**Contract: Accounts, Passwords, and Security (Modified)**

Certain features or services offered on or through the Site may require you to open an account (including setting up a bank account and secure password). You are entirely responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of the information you hold for your account, including your password, and for any and all activity that occurs under your account as a result of your failing to keep this information secure and confidential. You agree to notify your bank immediately of any unauthorized use of your account or password, or any other breach of security. You may be held liable for losses incurred by the bank or any other user of or visitor to the Site due to someone else using your account information, password, or account as a result of your failing to keep your account information secure and confidential.

You may not use anyone else’s banking account, password, or account at any time without the express permission and consent of the holder of that account, password, or account. The bank cannot and will not be liable for any loss or damage arising from your failure to comply with these obligations. 

**Privacy**
The bank's Privacy Policy applies to use of this Site, and its terms are made a part of these Terms of Use by this reference. To view the bank's Privacy Policy, click here. Additionally, by using the Site, you acknowledge and agree that Internet transmissions are never completely private or secure. You understand that any message or information you send to the Site may be read or intercepted by others, even if there is a special notice that a particular transmission (for example, sensitive banking information) is encrypted.

**Links to Other Sites and to the Bank Site**
This Site may contain links to other independent third-party Web sites ("Linked Sites"). These Linked Sites are provided solely as a convenience to our visitors. Such Linked Sites are not under the bank's control, and the bank is not responsible for and does not endorse the content of such Linked Sites, including any information or materials contained on such Linked Sites. You will need to make your own independent judgment regarding your interaction with these Linked Sites.

a. "Is Google allowed to share my personal information if requested by law enforcement agencies?"
b. "Can Amazon release my account details to the authorities if they are investigating a case?"
c. "Will Facebook provide my private data to a government body if they request it for an investigation?"
d. "Is Microsoft obligated to disclose user information to the police when they seek data for a legal inquiry?"

Contracts corresponding to the new questions:

a. **Contract for Google**: "Google may disclose your personal information to law enforcement or government agencies if we believe that such disclosure is necessary to comply with applicable law, regulation, legal process, or government request. This may include sharing information to protect our rights or the rights of others, and to prevent fraud or any harm to individuals or the public. You acknowledge that such disclosures are at the discretion of Google and may occur without prior notice to you."

b. **Contract for Amazon**: "Amazon reserves the right to share your personal data with governmental authorities if requested for the purposes of an investigation. We may disclose relevant information to assist law enforcement in their inquiries, complying with any legal obligations or process. You agree that such disclosure may occur at Amazon's discretion and you will be informed only if legally permissible."

c. **Contract for Facebook**: "Facebook may release your personal information to government officials if we determine that such disclosure is required to comply with legal responsibilities or to respond to claims that this information violates the rights of others. You agree that any such disclosure is necessary to maintain the integrity and security of our platform and comply with legal standards."

d. **Contract for Microsoft**: "Microsoft acknowledges that we may be required to disclose your personal data to law enforcement agencies in response to valid legal requests. Such disclosures are intended to protect our rights, comply with legal processes, and ensure the safety of individuals. You consent to this practice and understand that it may be enacted without prior notice."

Amazon also retains the right to disclose information to protect its legal rights or interests and those of our users.

b. **Google User Data Policy:**
   Google reserves the right to disclose user-related information if required by legal processes or regulatory agencies. This includes responding to requests that are legally binding and intended to protect the integrity of the site and its users.

c. **Microsoft User Privacy Agreement:**
   Microsoft may disclose user information if compelled by law or in response to governmental requests. This action will be taken to comply with legal obligations, protect the rights of Microsoft or third parties, and ensure user safety.

d. **Netflix User Information Handling Policy:**
   Netflix may provide user information to government agencies upon receiving a lawful request or subpoena. This is to ensure compliance with legal standards and protect the rights and safety of its users and stakeholders.

Original Question: "Are there different rules for Americans and Europeans regarding where they can sue Apple?"

New Questions:
a. "Are there different rules for residents of California and those in Texas regarding where they can file a lawsuit against a technology company?"
b. "Do consumers in the European Union have different rights compared to those in Australia when seeking to resolve disputes with a travel agency?"
c. "Are there specific regulations for New Yorkers compared to Floridians regarding the jurisdiction for suing a payment processor?"
d. "Is there a distinction between how residents of London and Edinburgh can approach legal action against a financial institution?"

Corresponding Contracts for New Questions:
a. **Contract: Governing Law; Dispute Resolution (California vs. Texas)**
   You agree that all matters relating to your access to or use of the services provided by the company will be governed by the laws of the State of California, without regard to its conflicts of laws provisions. You consent to personal jurisdiction by and venue in the state and federal courts located in Los Angeles County, California, waiving any objections to such jurisdiction or venue. Similar provisions apply for disputes arising involving constituents residing in the State of Texas, which will be governed by Texas law and resolved in courts located in Travis County, Texas.

b. **Contract: Governing Law; Dispute Resolution (EU vs. Australia)**
   You agree that matters relating to access to or use of the services will be governed by the relevant laws of the European Union for consumers based there, while Australian consumers will be subject to the laws of the Commonwealth of Australia. The European consumers may make a claim in the courts of the country where they reside, while Australian residents must resolve disputes in courts of their locality.

c. **Contract: Governing Law; Dispute Resolution (New York vs. Florida)**
   You agree that all matters related to your interaction with the company will follow the laws of the State of New York, except for legal actions initiated by residents of the State of Florida, which will be governed by Florida law. Any disputes can be pursued in respective state courts pertinent to the place of residence stated above.

d. **Contract: Governing Law; Dispute Resolution (London vs. Edinburgh)**
   You consent that all legal matters arising from your use of services will be governed by the laws of England and Wales for residents of London. Meanwhile, residents of Edinburgh will be governed by the laws of Scotland. Disputes under these agreements can be pursued in the courts of the respective jurisdictions stated.

Original Question: "Do the terms distinguish between US persons and European persons with regard to the applicable jurisdiction for adjudicating disputes between the parties?"

New Questions:
a. "Do the regulations clarify any differences between Canadian residents and Australian residents concerning the governing law for resolving contractual disputes?"
b. "Is there a distinction in the policy regarding the jurisdiction for resolving issues between citizens of New Zealand and those of the United Kingdom?"
c. "Are there specific provisions that differentiate between Asian consumers and North American consumers in terms of the legal venue for handling disputes?"
d. "Do the guidelines outline any variances between residents in South America and those in Africa regarding the applicable courts for enforcement of agreements?" 

Contracts for New Questions:

a. Contract: Governing Law; Dispute Resolution  
You agree that all matters relating to your access to or use of the Site, including all disputes, will be governed by the laws of Canada and by the laws of the Province of Ontario without regard to its conflicts of laws provisions. You agree to the personal jurisdiction by and venue in the provincial and federal courts in Toronto, Ontario, and waive any objection to such jurisdiction or venue. The preceding provision regarding venue does not apply if you are a consumer based in Australia. If you are a consumer based in Australia, you may make a claim in the courts of the country where you reside. Any claim under these Terms of Use must be brought within one (1) year after the cause of action arises, or such claim or cause of action is barred. Claims made under the separate terms and conditions of purchase for goods and services are not subject to this limitation. No recovery may be sought or received for damages other than out-of-pocket expenses, except that the prevailing party will be entitled to costs and attorneys fees. In the event of any controversy or dispute between the parties arising out of or in connection with your use of the Site, the parties shall attempt, promptly and in good faith, to resolve any such dispute. If we are unable to resolve any such dispute within a reasonable time (not to exceed thirty (30) days), then either party may submit such controversy or dispute to mediation. If the dispute cannot be resolved through mediation, then the parties shall be free to pursue any right or remedy available to them under applicable law.

b. Contract: Governing Law; Dispute Resolution  
You agree that all matters relating to your access to or use of the Site, including all disputes, will be governed by the laws of the United Kingdom and by the laws of England without regard to its conflicts of laws provisions. You agree to the personal jurisdiction by and venue in the courts in London, England, and waive any objection to such jurisdiction or venue. The preceding provision regarding venue does not apply if you are a consumer based in New Zealand. If you are a consumer based in New Zealand, you may make a claim in the courts of the country where you reside. Any claim under these Terms of Use must be brought within one (1) year after the cause of action arises, or such claim or cause of action is barred. Claims made under the separate terms and conditions of purchase for goods and services are not subject to this limitation. No recovery may be sought or received for damages other than out-of-pocket expenses, except that the prevailing party will be entitled to costs and attorneys fees. In the event of any controversy or dispute between the parties arising out of or in connection with your use of the Site, the parties shall attempt, promptly and in good faith, to resolve any such dispute. If we are unable to resolve any such dispute within a reasonable time (not to exceed thirty (30) days), then either party may submit such controversy or dispute to mediation. If the dispute cannot be resolved through mediation, then the parties shall be free to pursue any right or remedy available to them under applicable law.

c. Contract: Governing Law; Dispute Resolution  
You agree that all matters relating to your access to or use of the Site, including all disputes, will be governed by the laws of South America and by the laws of Brazil without regard to its conflicts of laws provisions. You agree to the personal jurisdiction by and venue in the courts in São Paulo, Brazil, and waive any objection to such jurisdiction or venue. The preceding provision regarding venue does not apply if you are a consumer based in Asia. If you are a consumer based in Asia, you may make a claim in the courts of the country where you reside. Any claim under these Terms of Use must be brought within one (1) year after the cause of action arises, or such claim or cause of action is barred. Claims made under the separate terms and conditions of purchase for goods and services are not subject to this limitation. No recovery may be sought or received for damages other than out-of-pocket expenses, except that the prevailing party will be entitled to costs and attorneys fees. In the event of any controversy or dispute between the parties arising out of or in connection with your use of the Site, the parties shall attempt, promptly and in good faith, to resolve any such dispute. If we are unable to resolve any such dispute within a reasonable time (not to exceed thirty (30) days), then either party may submit such controversy or dispute to mediation. If the dispute cannot be resolved through mediation, then the parties shall be free to pursue any right or remedy available to them under applicable law. 

d. Contract: Governing Law; Dispute Resolution  
You agree that all matters relating to your access to or use of the Site, including all disputes, will be governed by the laws of Africa and by the laws of Kenya without regard to its conflicts of laws provisions. You agree to the personal jurisdiction by and venue in the courts in Nairobi, Kenya, and waive any objection to such jurisdiction or venue. The preceding provision regarding venue does not apply if you are a consumer based in South America. If you are a consumer based in South America, you may make a claim in the courts of the country where you reside. Any claim under these Terms of Use must be brought within one (1) year after the cause of action arises, or such claim or cause of action is barred. Claims made under the separate terms and conditions of purchase for goods and services are not subject to this limitation. No recovery may be sought or received for damages other than out-of-pocket expenses, except that the prevailing party will be entitled to costs and attorneys fees. In the event of any controversy or dispute between the parties arising out of or in connection with your use of the Site, the parties shall attempt, promptly and in good faith, to resolve any such dispute. If we are unable to resolve any such dispute within a reasonable time (not to exceed thirty (30) days), then either party may submit such controversy or dispute to mediation. If the dispute cannot be resolved through mediation, then the parties shall be free to pursue any right or remedy available to them under applicable law.

Original Question: "If I delete my Instagram account, does Instagram lose its right to host content that I uploaded?"

New Questions:
a. "If I cancel my subscription to a music streaming service, does the service lose its right to play songs I uploaded?"
b. "When I terminate my membership with a photo-sharing platform, does that platform lose its right to use my images?"
c. "If I withdraw from an online learning platform, does the platform lose its right to access the documents I submitted?"
d. "If I remove my profile from a gaming website, does the website retain the right to use my game achievements?"

### New Contracts:
**Permissions You Grant to Us**: As part of our agreement, you also give us permissions that we need to provide the Service. We do not claim ownership of your content, but you grant us a license to use it. Nothing is changing about your rights in your content. We do not claim ownership of your content that you upload on or through the Service and you are free to share your content with anyone else, wherever you want. However, we need certain legal permissions from you (known as a license) to provide the Service. When you share, post, or upload content protected by intellectual property rights (such as music files or recordings) on or in connection with our Service, you hereby grant to us a non-exclusive, royalty-free, transferable, sub-licensable, worldwide license to host, use, distribute, modify, run, copy, publicly perform or display, translate, and create derivative works of your content (consistent with your privacy and application settings). This license will end when your content is deleted from our systems. You can delete content individually or all at once by canceling your account. To learn more about how we use your information, and how to control or delete your content, review the Data Policy and visit the relevant Help Center for our Service.

**Permission to use your username, profile picture, and information about your relationships and actions with content or supports**: You give us permission to show your username, profile picture, and information about your actions (such as uploads or listens) or relationships (such as follows) next to or in connection with accounts, ads, offers, and other sponsored content that you follow or engage with that are displayed on our Service, without any compensation to you. For example, we may show that you uploaded a song to a service created by a brand that has paid us to display its content. As with actions on other content and follows of other accounts, actions on uploaded content and follows of sponsored accounts can be seen only by people who have permission to see that content or follow. We will also respect your ad settings. You can learn more here about your ad settings.

**You agree that we can download and install updates to the Service on your device.**

c. **YouTube Channel Name Regulations**  
Should you choose a channel name for your account, we reserve the right to modify it if it infringes on existing trademarks or violates our policies.

d. **TikTok Account Handle Policy**  
If you select an account handle, we may change it if we determine it closely resembles another user’s handle or violates our community guidelines.

   If your display name on Facebook conflicts with our community guidelines, we may change it without notice to ensure compliance with our policies."

c. **Contract**:

d. **Contract**:
   "Profile URL Adjustments
   LinkedIn reserves the right to modify a user's profile URL if the existing URL fails to adhere to our standards or naming conventions."



169
Original Question: "If someone else is using content I posted on Instagram, could this prevent the content from being deleted?"

New Questions:
a. "If another user is sharing photos I posted on Facebook, might this stop me from removing those photos?"
b. "If a third party has used a video I uploaded to YouTube, could this impact my ability to delete that video?"
c. "If someone else has reposted my article on a blog, does this affect my request to take down the article?"
d. "If my tweet is being retweeted by others, can this hinder my ability to delete the original tweet?"

Contract Corresponding to New Questions:

1. Content Use and Deletion Rights

We may not be able to delete your content if it has been utilized by others in accordance with our policies. Specifically, if another user is using your content on our platform (for example, sharing a photo on Facebook or reposting a video on YouTube), this may restrict your ability to remove the original content until those users also delete it. 

If you believe your content is being used improperly, or if you wish to exercise your right to delete, please refer to our Support Section for guidance on how to proceed. The process will begin automatically no more than 30 days after your request is received. While the content is being processed for deletion, it may remain accessible to other users until it is fully removed.

This applies equally whether the content involves photos, videos, articles, or tweets. The deletion process may extend if technical limitations arise, or if the content is necessary for an investigation, compliance with legal requirements, or communication with government authorities.

If your associated account is deleted or disabled, the agreements regarding content use and deletion will continue to be in effect, ensuring that you are protected regarding your intellectual property rights even after your account no longer exists.

### Contract for TikTok Users.

If any part of this agreement is unenforceable, the remaining sections will still be valid.
Any modifications or waivers to our agreement must be documented in writing and signed by us. Our failure to enforce any part of this agreement does not constitute a waiver.
We reserve all rights not explicitly granted to you.

### Who Has Rights Under this Agreement.
This agreement does not confer rights to any third parties.
You cannot assign your rights or obligations under this agreement without our permission.
Our rights and obligations may be assigned to others, particularly if our ownership changes (such as through a merger, acquisition, or asset sale) or according to law.

### Who Is Responsible if Something Happens.
Our service is provided "as is," without any guarantees of safety, security, or perfect functionality. TO THE EXTENT PERMITTED BY LAW, WE DISCLAIM ALL WARRANTIES, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, TITLE, AND NON-INFRINGEMENT.
We do not control the actions or statements of individuals or entities, and we are not liable for their (or your) actions or conduct (whether offline or online) or the content that they produce (including unlawful or objectionable material). We are also not accountable for services provided by others, even if accessed through our service.
Our liability regarding anything occurring on the service is limited as far as permissible by law. If there is an issue with our service, we cannot predict all potential impacts. You agree that we will not be liable for any lost profits, revenues, information, or data, or for any consequential, special, indirect, exemplary, punitive, or incidental damages arising from or related to these Terms, even if we are aware they may occur. This includes instances where we delete your content or account.

### How We Will Handle Disputes.
If you are a consumer, the laws of your country of residence will govern any claim, dispute, or cause of action you have against us arising from these Terms, and you may pursue your claim in any competent court within your country that has jurisdiction over it. In all other cases, you agree that any claim, cause of action, or dispute between us must be resolved exclusively in the U.S. District Court for the Northern District of California or a state court located in San Mateo County, and you submit to the personal jurisdiction of either of these courts for the purposes of litigating any such claims, and the laws of the State of California will govern these Terms and any claims without regard to conflict-of-law provisions. Moreover, you agree that Facebook Inc. may also bring any claims related to your unauthorized attempts to interact with our products within the jurisdiction of your country.

### Unsolicited Material.
We appreciate feedback and other suggestions but may use them freely without any obligation to compensate you or keep them confidential.

New Contracts:
1. **Contract for Online Service Providers Regarding Account Security Responsibility**:
   If users do not take the necessary security measures to protect their online accounts, they are solely responsible for any resulting adverse consequences. The service provider encourages users to follow best practices for account security to minimize risks.

2. **Contract for Account Management Services**:
   Users of account management services must understand that they are accountable for maintaining their security settings. The organization may not be liable for any issues that arise due to improper security measures taken by the user.

3. **Contract for Digital Privacy and Security**:
   Users of digital services need to ensure that they actively protect their information. The service provider is not liable for repercussions resulting from a user's failure to secure their account effectively.

4. **Contract for User Account Guidelines**:
   Users must adhere to security guidelines provided by the service. Failure to implement such security measures may result in negative consequences, for which the service provider will not assume liability.



182
Original Question: "Can I use content featured in an article on Google News without getting permission from the person who created that content?"

New Questions:
a. "Is it permissible to utilize images found in a blog post without obtaining permission from the photographer who took those images?"
b. "Can I share a video posted on a social media platform without asking the original creator for consent first?"
c. "Am I allowed to reproduce a song from a streaming service without the artist's approval?"
d. "Is it okay to quote a section from a research paper published online without seeking permission from the authors?"  

Contracts corresponding to the new questions:

a. **Contract for Photographic Content**  
Some of our services include photographic content that belongs to individual photographers. You may use such content only with proper attribution and when expressly permitted by the photographer, or under applicable legal exceptions, but we retain all intellectual property rights in the images. Do not alter or obscure any branding or legal notices associated with the images. For permissions regarding the use of images, please refer to the Photographer’s Usage Guidelines.

b. **Contract for Social Media Video Content**  
Certain services offer access to videos created by users on our platform. You may not use or share these videos without obtaining consent from the creator, unless permitted by law. The opinions and content in these videos are those of the creators and do not necessarily reflect our views. If you wish to utilize video content from our platform, please refer to our Video Sharing Policy.

c. **Contract for Music Streaming Content**  
Our services include streaming music tracks that are owned by artists and record labels. You may not reproduce or distribute these songs without the express permission of the copyright holder, except as allowed under copyright law. The views expressed in the music and lyrics belong to the artists and do not necessarily convey our perspective. To obtain permission for song use, please consult our Music Permissions Framework.

d. **Contract for Research Paper Content**  
Access to research materials provided through our platform includes original works that belong to authors and institutions. You may not reproduce or cite sections of these papers without prior approval from the authors or unless legally permitted. The opinions expressed in these papers are the authors' own and do not reflect our organizational viewpoint. For more information about permissions regarding research content, please check the Research Content Guidelines.

Original Question: "Does Google charge users money for the software?"

b. "Is there a fee for users to access the software included with Apple services?"
c. "Does Adobe have a cost associated with the software that comes with its Creative Cloud?"

Contract for New Questions:
1. Contract for Microsoft Software:
"Some of our services include downloadable software. We give you permission to use that software as part of the services.

The license we give you is:
- worldwide, which means that it's valid anywhere in the world
- non-exclusive, which means that we can license the software to others
- royalty-free, which means that there are no fees for this license
- personal, which means that it doesn't extend to anyone else
- non-assignable, which means that you're not allowed to assign the license to anyone else

Some of our services include software that’s offered under open-source license terms that we make available to you. Sometimes there are provisions in the open-source license that explicitly override parts of these terms, so please make sure that you read those licenses.

You may not copy, modify, distribute, sell or lease any part of our services or software. Also, you may not reverse engineer or attempt to extract any of our source code unless you have our written permission or applicable law lets you do so.

When a service requires or includes downloadable software, that software sometimes updates automatically on your device once a new version or feature is available. Some services let you adjust your automatic update settings."
