When a service requires or includes downloadable software, that software sometimes updates automatically on your device once a new version or feature is available. Some services let you adjust your automatic update settings."

184
Original Question: "Is Google entitled to levy fees or other charges in connection with the license hereunder?"

New Questions:
a. "Can Microsoft impose extra charges for the use of their licensed software as outlined in their agreement?"
b. "Is Apple allowed to add fees for the licensing of their applications based on the terms provided in their service contract?"
c. "Does Amazon reserve the right to charge additional fees for the usage of software licenses detailed in their user agreement?"
d. "Are there any circumstances under which Adobe can levy charges for the licenses associated with their products according to their terms of service?"

New Contracts:
1. Contract: Microsoft Software License
Some of our software products include downloadable applications. We give you permission to use that software as part of the service.

The license we provide is:
worldwide, meaning it's valid globally
non-exclusive, meaning we can license the software to others
royalty-free, meaning there are no fees for this use
personal, meaning it doesn't extend to anyone else
non-assignable, meaning you cannot transfer the license to anyone else

Some of our software is offered under open-source license terms that we provide to you. Occasionally, provisions in the open-source license may override parts of these terms, so please read those licenses carefully.

You may not copy, modify, distribute, sell, or lease any part of our software. Additionally, you may not reverse engineer or extract any part of our source code unless you have our written approval or applicable law permits it.

When a service involves downloadable software, that software may update automatically on your device when a new version or feature is available. Some services allow you to modify your automatic update preferences.

2. Contract: Apple Application License
Some of our applications include downloadable content. We grant you permission to use this content as part of our services.

The license we grant is:
worldwide, meaning it's effective anywhere
non-exclusive, meaning we can grant licenses to other users
royalty-free, meaning you incur no charges for this use
personal, meaning it does not extend to others
non-assignable, meaning you cannot transfer the license

Some applications come with open-source licenses that override certain parts of this agreement, so we encourage you to read those licenses thoroughly.

You are prohibited from copying, modifying, distributing, selling, or leasing any portion of our application services or content. You also cannot reverse engineer or try to access any source code unless permitted by us or allowed by law.

When a service involves downloadable content, updates may occur automatically on your device when new features or versions are available. Some services grant you options for adjusting update settings.
  
3. Contract: Amazon Software License Agreement
Our software products may include downloadable applications. We give you permission to utilize this software as part of our services.

The license we provide is:
worldwide, meaning valid across the globe
non-exclusive, meaning we can license it to others as well
royalty-free, meaning you do not have to pay for this usage
personal, meaning it applies only to you
non-assignable, meaning you may not transfer this license

Some of our software is available under open-source licenses, which could override sections of these terms. Please ensure you read these licenses carefully.

You must not copy, modify, distribute, sell, or lease any part of our software or services. Additionally, you may not reverse engineer or access our source code except with our written permission or as allowed by law.

When our services include downloadable software, it may update automatically once new features or versions are available. Some services provide you options to change your update settings.

4. Contract: Adobe Software License Agreement
Certain Adobe products include downloadable software. We grant permission for you to use this software under our service terms.

The license offered is:
worldwide application, meaning it's valid anywhere
non-exclusive, meaning it can also be licensed to other users
royalty-free, meaning there are no fees involved
personal use only, meaning it does not extend to others
non-assignable, meaning you cannot assign this license to third parties

Some software may come under open-source licenses, which can have provisions that supersede parts of this contract, so please read those licenses.

You may not copy, modify, distribute, sell, or lease any part of our software. You are also prohibited from reverse engineering or attempting to extract source code unless permission is given or permitted by law.

When software requires downloading, it can update automatically on your device when new versions or features are available. Certain services allow you to adjust settings related to automatic updates.

1. In case of problems or discrepancies with our services
By law, you retain the right to (1) a specific level of service quality, and (2) mechanisms for resolving issues if the service does not meet these standards. These provisions do not restrict or eliminate any of those rights. For instance, as a consumer, you continue to benefit from all legal rights granted to you under the relevant legal framework.

Warranty
We perform our services with reasonable skill and care. If we fail to achieve the quality level outlined in this warranty, you agree to notify us, and we will collaborate with you to resolve the matter.

Disclaimers
The only assurances we provide regarding our services (which includes the content in the services, specific functionalities, reliability, availability, or suitability to meet your needs) are (1) detailed in the Warranty section, (2) articulated in the additional service-specific terms, or (3) established under applicable legislation. We do not make any other guarantees about our services. Additionally, unless legally mandated, we do not provide implied warranties, such as implied warranties of merchantability, fitness for a particular purpose, and non-infringement.

New Contracts Corresponding to the New Questions:

a. **Amazon Quality Assurance Commitment**
   In the event of product-related issues or disputes, you have the right to quality assurance and remedies. These terms do not limit any legal rights applicable to consumers. If you purchase a product from Amazon, you will continue to enjoy all rights mandated by law. 

   Quality Assurance
   We aim to deliver our products with a high standard of quality. If our products do not meet the quality assurance outlined, you agree to notify us, and we will make an effort to resolve the matter.

   Disclaimers
   Our commitments regarding product quality (including manufacturability, function, and reliability) are described in the Quality Assurance section, expressed in specific product terms, or provided under applicable laws. We make no other commitments about our products. Unless mandated by law, we do not offer implied guarantees for product quality, merchantability, or fitness for a specific purpose.

b. **Apple Service Agreement Assurance**
   In case of device-related issues or discrepancies, you retain the right to a high standard of service and resolution options. This agreement does not alter your legal rights as a consumer. If you purchase an Apple product, you will maintain all applicable consumer rights.

   Service Quality Assurance
   We utilize reasonable skill in providing our devices. If we fail to meet the quality standards promised, you are expected to inform us, and we will seek to resolve the concern.

   Disclaimers
   The commitments we make concerning device performance (including features, reliability, and suitability) are only as specified in the Service Quality Assurance section, in product-specific terms, or under applicable law. We do not offer any additional commitments regarding our devices. Unless required by law, we do not provide implied warranties regarding quality or suitability for particular purposes.

c. **Microsoft Software User Agreement**
   In instances of software issues or conflicts, you have the right to certain service standards and remediation procedures. These terms do not restrict any consumer rights under the law. Purchasing Microsoft software enables you to preserve all rights granted by applicable laws.

   Software Quality Guarantee
   We strive to deliver our software with reasonable skill and diligence. If the software provided does not meet the detailed quality standards, you agree to notify us, and we will work with you to address the issue.

   Disclaimers
   Our commitments regarding the software's functionality, reliability, and effectiveness are detailed in the Quality Guarantee section, stated in software-specific terms, and governed by applicable laws. We do not commit to any additional conditions concerning our software services. Unless required by law, we do not provide any implied warranties of performance.

d. **Samsung Appliance Warranty Terms**
   In case of appliance issues or disagreements, you hold the right to proper service quality and solutions. These terms do not restrict your rights as a consumer according to applicable laws. Purchasing Samsung appliances grants you continued consumer rights under the law.

   Appliance Quality Assurance
   We provide our appliances using reasonable skill and attention. Should our products fall short of the promised quality standards, you are expected to notify us, and we will attempt to resolve the problem.

   Disclaimers
   Our tasks concerning appliance features and reliability are articulated in the Appliance Quality Assurance section, in specific product term documents, and compliant with applicable laws. No other commitments regarding our appliances are made. Unless mandated by law, we do not extend implied warranties of merchantability or fitness for any particular use.

Original Question: "Is Google likely to suspend or otherwise restrict a user's access to Google's services in the event of a single minor breach by such user?"

New Questions:

c. "Is it possible for a gym to terminate a membership due to a single minor infraction of the gym rules by a member?"
d. "Might a school impose disciplinary measures on a student for a one-time minor offense in class?"

Contract for New Questions:

**Taking Action in Case of Problems**  
Before taking action in cases of behavioral violations related to the services provided, the institution will provide advance notice when reasonably possible, describe the reason for our action, and offer the individual an opportunity to rectify the situation unless there is reasonable belief that doing so would:  
- cause harm or liability to a member, third party, or institution  
- violate legal regulations or a directive from legal enforcement authorities  
- compromise any ongoing inquiry  
- jeopardize the integrity or security of operations provided 

**Removing Access or Privileges**  
If we reasonably believe that any individual’s behavior (1) breaches the terms of service or codes of conduct, (2) violates applicable laws, or (3) could harm our members, third parties, or the institution, we reserve the right to suspend or remove access to certain services in compliance with applicable laws. Examples include misconduct, harmful or disruptive behavior, and actions infringing on the rights of others. 

**Suspending or Terminating Access to Services**  
The institution reserves the right to suspend or terminate a member's access to services or privileges if any of the following occur:  
- the individual materially or repeatedly violates the terms of service or codes of conduct  
- action is required to comply with legal regulations or judicial orders  
- we reasonably believe that the individual's behavior causes harm or liability to others, such as harassment, disruptive behavior, or violation of policies  
If you believe that your access has been revoked in error, you have the option to appeal.  
Members are always free to discontinue using the services at any time. Should you choose to do so, feedback on your experience would be appreciated for continuous improvement.

Original Question: "Can I use a program to automatically scrape video data from YouTube?"

Contract for New Questions:
**Contract: Data Collection and Usage Policies**

1. **Content Responsibility**: The content collected from the Service (including but not limited to videos, posts, tweets, and comments) is under the ownership of the respective platforms and users. You are responsible for adhering to the guidelines set forth by each platform concerning data use.

2. **Data Usage Restrictions**: You are not permitted to:
   - Access, reproduce, download, distribute, transmit, broadcast, display, sell, license, alter, modify, or otherwise use any part of the Service or any Content except: (a) as expressly authorized by the Service; or (b) with prior written permission from the respective platform and, if applicable, the respective rights holders;
   - Employ automated means (such as bots or scraping tools) to collect or harvest any Content unless this is explicitly allowed by the respective platform's policies.

3. **Reporting Violations**: You should report any Content or data that you believe does not comply with the respective platform’s guidelines or legal requirements.

4. **Permitted Uses**: You may view or listen to Content strictly for personal, non-commercial use. Publicly displaying or distributing Content is prohibited unless following specific policies set by the respective platform. 

5. **Policy Changes**: Platforms may change their data collection policies or notice requirements without prior warning. Users are encouraged to stay updated with the respective platform's terms and conditions regarding data usage.

By agreeing to these terms, you recognize the limitations and responsibilities tied to the usage and collection of data within this context.

Streaming on Social Media Platforms

The content streamed on platforms such as Instagram Live, Facebook, Twitch, or Zoom (collectively referred to as "Streaming Services") includes live videos, audio, graphics, and any interactive features. Usage of Streaming Services

Original Question: "Does YouTube permit live broadcasts for the purpose of for-profit enterprises?"

   The content shared during live broadcasts on Facebook, including videos, audio, images, and comments, is the responsibility of the broadcaster. Facebook reserves the right not to host or promote content that violates its Community Standards or legal requirements. Live broadcasts aimed at for-profit must not infringe upon any third-party rights or be misleading in nature.

b. **Twitch Live Streaming Terms of Service**
   Streamers on Twitch may conduct live sessions intended for commercial use, such as monetization through subscriptions or sponsorships. All content must adhere to Twitch's Community Guidelines, and streamers must hold the necessary rights for any content shared. Twitch does not guarantee the hosting of all broadcasts and can remove any violating content.

c. **Instagram Live Session Policy**

The content presented during these sessions must not infringe on intellectual property rights or violate community standards as outlined by Instagram.

   Users engaging in live streaming on TikTok with a focus on promoting their products or services must ensure compliance with TikTok's community guidelines and advertising policies. 193
Original Question: "Are other users allowed to use content I uploaded to YouTube outside of YouTube?"

New Questions:
a. "Can other users utilize the images I posted on Instagram for their personal websites without my permission?"
b. "Are other users permitted to share the music tracks I uploaded on SoundCloud in their videos on different platforms?"
c. "Is it allowed for users to employ the blog posts I created on my personal website elsewhere on the internet without consent?"
d. "Can individuals download and use the artwork I uploaded to my online portfolio for their projects outside of the portfolio site?"

Contracts Corresponding to New Questions:

a. Contract for Instagram Content:
"You retain ownership rights in your images posted on Instagram. However, by sharing your images on Instagram, you grant other users a limited right to view your images exclusively on the Instagram platform. Users are prohibited from using your images for any purposes outside of Instagram without obtaining your express permission."

b. Contract for SoundCloud Music:
"You maintain ownership of the music tracks you upload to SoundCloud. By uploading your music tracks, you grant listeners only the right to stream them on the SoundCloud platform. Any reproduction, distribution, or use of your tracks outside of SoundCloud requires prior written consent from you."

c. Contract for Personal Website Blog Posts:
"You retain all rights to your blog posts published on your personal website. However, you grant visitors a limited license to read and share the posts via links on their own platforms. Unauthorized reproduction, distribution, or use of your content outside of the original website is prohibited without your explicit consent."

d. Contract for Online Portfolio Artwork:
"You hold the rights to all artwork shared in your online portfolio. By presenting your artwork online, you allow visitors to view it solely within the portfolio site. Any use of your artwork outside of this context, including reproduction or alteration, requires your written authorization."



194
Original Question: "Does the content license granted by users to YouTube extend to allowing other users to access such content other than within the YouTube environment?"

New Questions:
a. "Does the image license provided by photographers to a stock photo site allow other users to use those images outside of the site itself?"
b. "When a writer submits an article to an online magazine, does the license granted allow readers to reproduce the article outside the magazine's platform?"
c. "If musicians upload their songs to a streaming service, do their licensing rights permit others to play those songs on different platforms?"
d. "When a software developer shares their code on an open-source platform, are they allowing other developers to utilize that code independently of the platform?"

Contract Corresponding to New Questions:

1. **Image License Agreement**
   - If you upload images to the stock photo site, you may use your images for personal or promotional purposes. However, you agree that the license you grant includes allowing other users to access and utilize your images strictly within the stock photo site environment. You retain ownership of your images but grant the site a non-exclusive, royalty-free license to reproduce, distribute, display, and sell the images on your behalf.

2. **Article Submission Agreement**
   - By submitting an article to our online magazine, you retain full ownership of your work. However, you grant us a license to publish, share, and reproduce the article exclusively within our website and related promotional avenues. Your rights do not extend to readers using the article outside of our platform without express permission.

3. **Music Upload Agreement**
   - When you upload your music to our streaming platform, you maintain ownership of your songs. By doing so, you grant us a worldwide, non-exclusive license to play, distribute, and promote your music within our service. This license does not include any rights for users to play, perform, or distribute your music outside of our platform unless expressly allowed by you.

4. **Open-Source Code License Agreement**
   - If you share your code on our open-source platform, you retain ownership of your original code. By sharing your contributions, you grant us and other users a worldwide, royalty-free license to use, modify, and distribute the code within the boundaries of the open-source platform. This license does not permit independent use of your code outside of our platform unless specified in the terms.



195
Original Question: "Does YouTube need my permission each time it updates its software?"

New Questions:
a. "Does Microsoft need my consent every time it makes updates to Windows software?"
b. "Does Adobe require my approval for each update to Creative Cloud applications?"
c. "Does Spotify need my authorization every time it upgrades its music streaming software?"
d. "Does Apple need my permission every time it updates the iOS on my iPhone?"

Contracts corresponding to the new questions:

a. Contract for Microsoft Windows Software:
When the Service requires or includes downloadable Windows software, you grant permission for that software to update automatically on your device once a new version or feature is available, subject to your device settings. Unless that software is governed by additional terms which provide a license, Microsoft grants you a personal, worldwide, royalty-free, non-assignable, and non-exclusive license to use the software provided to you as part of the Service. This license is for the sole purpose of enabling you to use and enjoy the benefit of the Service. You are not permitted to copy, modify, distribute, sell, or lease any part of the software, or to reverse-engineer or attempt to extract the source code of that software, unless laws prohibit these restrictions or you have Microsoft's written permission.

b. Contract for Adobe Creative Cloud Software:
When the Service requires or includes downloadable Adobe Creative Cloud software, you grant permission for that software to update automatically on your device as new versions or features become available, subject to your device settings. Unless that software is governed by additional terms which provide a license, Adobe grants you a personal, worldwide, royalty-free, non-assignable, and non-exclusive license to use the software provided as part of the Service. This license is solely for the purpose of allowing you to utilize and benefit from the Service as outlined in this Agreement. You are not allowed to copy, modify, distribute, sell, or lease any part of the software, or to reverse-engineer or attempt to extract the source code of that software, except where prohibited by applicable law or unless you have Adobe's written permission.

c. Contract for Spotify Music Streaming Software:
When the Service requires or contains downloadable Spotify software, you give your consent for that software to automatically update on your device when a new version or feature is released, depending on your device settings. Unless that software is governed by additional terms that provide a license, Spotify grants you a personal, worldwide, royalty-free, non-assignable, and non-exclusive license to use the software provided to you as part of the Service. This license is intended solely for enabling you to use and benefit from the Service as permitted by this Agreement. You are not allowed to copy, modify, distribute, sell, or lease any part of the software, or to reverse-engineer or attempt to extract the source code of that software, unless laws prohibit these restrictions or you have Spotify's written permission.

Contract for New Questions:
1. **Rights to Post Content**: Users may share or post content, including but not limited to reviews, videos, articles, and photos, only if they have full rights to that content and the appropriate permissions have been obtained where applicable. Users may not claim authorship or ownership over content created by someone else without express consent from the original creator.

2. **Representation and Warranty**: By posting content, users represent and warrant that they either own the rights to the content or have received permission from the rightful owner to use and share it. Users further affirm that such sharing does not infringe on any intellectual property rights and will not result in harm to any individual or entity.

3. **Indemnification**: Users agree to indemnify and hold harmless the platform from any claims arising from the posting of content that the user does not own or has no rights to use, including claims for infringement or damage to reputation.

4. **Content Monitoring**: The platform retains the right to monitor, edit, or remove any content at its discretion but is not obligated to regularly review posted content for copyright infringement or misinformation.

208
Original Question: "Does Amazon take responsibility for items sold by third parties through Amazon?"

New Questions:
a. "Is eBay liable for products sold by independent sellers on its platform?"
b. "Can Shopify be held accountable for the goods sold by merchants using its services?"
c. "Does Etsy assume any responsibility for items sold by its individual artisans?"
d. "Is Alibaba responsible for the merchandise offered by third-party sellers on its site?" 

Contracts corresponding to the new questions:

Contract for Question a: 
**eBay Liability Policy**
eBay does not assume responsibility for any items sold by independent sellers on its platform. All transactions are between the buyer and the seller, and any concerns related to the products purchased must be resolved directly with the seller. eBay encourages users to review seller ratings and product descriptions carefully before making a purchase.

Contract for Question b:
**Shopify Seller Agreement**
Shopify is not liable for the products sold by merchants utilizing its services. Each transaction is a direct agreement between the customer and the merchant. Customers are advised to review merchant policies and product information prior to purchasing, as Shopify does not guarantee the quality or delivery of the goods sold.

Contract for Question c:
**Etsy Responsibility Disclaimer**
Etsy disclaims any responsibility for items sold by individual artisans on its marketplace. Buyers engage in transactions directly with sellers and not with Etsy itself. Customers should examine shop reviews and product details thoroughly, as Etsy is not liable for any disputes or issues about the products purchased.

Contract for Question d:
**Alibaba Seller Liability Clause**
Alibaba does not hold responsibility for the products offered by third-party sellers on its platform. Buyers enter into contracts directly with the sellers, and any grievances regarding the items must be addressed with the sellers directly. It is recommended that buyers investigate seller ratings and product listings before making a purchase decision.



209
Original Question: "Can Amazon become liable in connection with offerings made by third parties?"

New Questions:
a. "Is a restaurant liable for issues arising from dishes prepared by outside suppliers?"
b. "Can a bookstore be held responsible for the quality of books published by various independent authors?"
c. "Is a travel agency accountable for services offered by hotels and vendors not managed by them?"
d. "Can a software company be liable for bugs in an application developed by a third-party contractor?"

**Contract for New Questions**

**APP PERMISSIONS**
When you use services provided by the restaurant, you may grant certain permissions for any personal information shared with third-party suppliers. Most dining establishments provide you with information about these permissions. To learn more about these permissions, ask a staff member.

**SANCTIONS AND EXPORT POLICY**
You may not use any services at the restaurant if you are subject to any local sanctions or regulations imposed by your governing authority. You must comply with all laws and restrictions that may apply to goods, ingredients, and services.

**OTHER BUSINESSES**
Parties other than the restaurant operate kitchens, provide catering services, or supply ingredients through restaurant services. Additionally, we provide links to sites of affiliated suppliers and various other businesses. If you purchase any food or services offered by these suppliers, you are purchasing directly from those third parties, not from the restaurant. We are not responsible for examining or evaluating, and we do not warrant, the offerings of any of these suppliers or businesses (including the content on their websites). The restaurant does not assume any responsibility or liability for the actions, food quality, and content of all these and any other third parties. You should carefully review their privacy statements and other conditions of use.

Original Question: "Am I allowed to use source code from Amazon's software in my own software?"

New Questions:
a. "Can I incorporate elements of the Google Maps API into my application?"
b. "Is it permissible to use snippets from Microsoft Word's code in my own word processing software?"
c. "Am I allowed to integrate functions from the Apple Music API into my music streaming app?"
d. "Can I use features from Adobe Photoshop's software in my own image editing tool?"

Contracts for New Questions:
a. Contract for the use of Google Maps API:
   The following terms (Google Maps API Terms) apply to any software development utilizing the Google Maps API and any related documentation we make available to you in connection with Google Services (the "Google Maps API").
   1. Use of the Google Maps API. You may use the Google Maps API solely for the purpose of building applications that utilize Google Maps Services as provided by Google, and as permitted by these Terms. You may not incorporate any portion of the Google Maps API into other applications or compile any portion in combination with other programs, or otherwise copy (except to exercise rights granted in this section), modify, create derivative works of, distribute, assign any rights to, or license the Google Maps API in whole or in part. All software used in any Google Service is the property of Google or its software suppliers and is protected by United States and international copyright laws.
   2. Use of Third Party Services. When you use the Google Maps API, you may also be utilizing services of third parties. Your use of these services may be subject to separate policies and terms of use of these third parties.

b. Contract for the use of Microsoft Word code:
   The following terms (Microsoft Word Code Terms) apply to any software utilizing Microsoft's Word code and any related documentation we make available to you in connection with Microsoft Services (the "Microsoft Word Code").
   1. Use of Microsoft Word Code. You may use Microsoft Word Code solely for the purposes of developing applications that function in conjunction with Microsoft Services, and as permitted by these Terms. You may not incorporate any portion of Microsoft Word Code into your own software or combine it with other programs, or otherwise copy or modify it, create derivative works of, distribute, assign rights to, or license Microsoft Word Code in any part. All software is the property of Microsoft or its software suppliers and is protected by copyright laws.

c. Contract for the use of Apple Music API:
   The following terms (Apple Music API Terms) apply to any software development involving the Apple Music API and any related documentation we provide in connection with Apple Services (the "Apple Music API").
   1. Use of Apple Music API. You may use the Apple Music API solely for creating applications that enable use of Apple Music Services, and as allowed by these Terms. You may not incorporate any portion of the Apple Music API into your own software or intermix it with other code, nor can you copy, modify, or license the Apple Music API in whole or part. All software is the property of Apple and is protected by copyright laws.

d. Contract for the use of Adobe Photoshop software:
   The following terms (Adobe Photoshop Terms) apply to any development involving Adobe Photoshop software and related documentation provided in connection with Adobe Services (the "Adobe Photoshop Software").
   1. Use of Adobe Photoshop Software. You may use the Adobe Photoshop Software only for purposes enabling the development of compatible applications and as allowed by these Terms. You may not incorporate any part of Adobe Photoshop Software into your own tools, nor compile any portion with your code, or otherwise copy, modify, create derivative works of, distribute, assign rights to, or license the Adobe Photoshop Software in any part. All software related to Adobe products remains the property of Adobe and is protected under copyright laws.

Original Question: "Does Amazon permit the replication of, or other unauthorized use of, the source code of its software?"

New Questions:
a. "Is it allowed to duplicate or misuse the source code of the software provided by Google?"
b. "Can you replicate or engage in unauthorized use of the software code from Microsoft products?"
c. "Does Apple allow the copying or unauthorized deployment of its software's source code?"

Contract for New Questions:
1. Use of the Software. You may use the Software solely for purposes of enabling you to use the Services provided by the Company, and as permitted by these Conditions of Use and any Service Terms. You may not incorporate any portion of the Software into other programs or compile any portion of it in combination with other programs, or otherwise copy (except to exercise rights granted in this section), modify, create derivative works of, distribute, assign any rights to, or license the Software in whole or in part. All software used in any Company Service is the property of the Company or its software suppliers and is protected by United States and international copyright laws.
   
2. Use of Third Party Services. When you use the Software, you may also be using the services of one or more third parties, such as a wireless carrier or a mobile software provider. Your use of these third party services may be subject to the separate policies, terms of use, and fees of these third parties.

3. No Reverse Engineering. You may not reverse engineer, decompile or disassemble, tamper with, or bypass any security associated with the Software, whether in whole or in part.

4. Updates. We may offer automatic or manual updates to the Software at any time and without notice to you.

5. Government End Users. If you are a U.S. Government end user, we are licensing the Software to you as a "Commercial Item" as that term is defined in the U.S. Code of Federal Regulations (see 48 C.F.R.  2.101), and the rights we grant you to the Software are the same as the rights we grant to all others under these Conditions of Use.

6. Conflicts. In the event of any conflict between these Conditions of Use and any other Company or third-party terms applicable to any portion of the Software, such as open-source license terms, such other terms will control as to that portion of the Software and to the extent of the conflict.

Original Question: "Does Facebook require users to pay money for its services?"

New Questions:
a. "Does LinkedIn charge its users to access its premium features?"
b. "Is Twitter's basic functionality free for users, or is there a subscription fee?"
c. "Do users need to pay to use the services offered by Instagram?"
d. "Is there a cost for accessing the main features of TikTok?"

Contract for New Questions:
1. LinkedIn Contract:
   Welcome to LinkedIn!

   LinkedIn builds technologies and services that enable professionals to connect, share insights, and grow careers. These terms govern your use of LinkedIn and its associated services (the LinkedIn Products), except where we expressly state that separate terms (and not these) apply. These Products are provided to you by LinkedIn Corporation.

   We offer free access to many of our Products, but some features may require a subscription. By using our Products, you agree that we can inform you about both free and paid features that may enhance your experience.

   We do not sell your personal data to advertisers, and we do not share information that directly identifies you without your consent. We aim to create a professional environment where users can make informed choices about their visibility and connection requests. For details on our data handling practices, please consult our Privacy Policy.

2. Twitter Contract:
   Welcome to Twitter!

   Twitter provides a platform for users to express themselves and connect with others. These terms govern your use of Twitter and its related services (the Twitter Products), except where we explicitly state that separate terms (and not these) apply. These Products are provided to you by Twitter, Inc.

   Our essential features are available to all users at no cost, although we may offer premium services for a fee. By using our Products, you consent to our practices concerning advertising and data usage.

   We prioritize user privacy and do not sell personal information without consent. For more on how we use your data to enhance your Twitter experience, please see our Privacy Policy.

3. Instagram Contract:
   Welcome to Instagram!

   Instagram is committed to building a community where users can share photos and videos with the world. These terms govern your use of Instagram and its features (the Instagram Products), except where we specifically indicate that separate terms apply. These Products are provided to you by Instagram, LLC.

   Access to our basic features is free, although some functionalities may require a fee. By using our Products, you agree that we can show you relevant advertisements based on your interests.

   Your privacy is significant to us, and we do not share your information with advertisers unless you provide clear consent. To learn more about how we process your personal data, refer to our Data Policy.

4. TikTok Contract:
   Welcome to TikTok!

   TikTok is a platform that empowers users to create and share short videos. These terms govern your use of TikTok and its services (the TikTok Products), except where we specify that different terms (and not these) apply. These Products are provided to you by TikTok Inc.

   Many of our features can be accessed for free, but some may involve fees. By using our Products, you agree to receive advertisements tailored to your preferences.

   We value your privacy and ensure your data is used responsibly. We do not sell your data to advertisers unless you have provided explicit consent. For more information on our data usage practices, please consult our Privacy Policy.



215
Original Question: "Does Facebook levy fees or charges in connection with the services it provides to users?"

New Questions:
a. "Does Instagram impose fees or charges for the services it offers to its users?"
b. "Are there any fees or charges associated with using Twitter's platform services?"
c. "Does LinkedIn require users to pay for accessing its professional networking services?"
d. "Are there any costs or fees involved in utilizing YouTube's content sharing and streaming services?"

Contract for New Questions:
1. Welcome to Instagram!

Instagram builds technologies and services that enable users to share photos, videos, and connect with others. These Terms govern your use of Instagram, and the other products and services we offer (the Instagram Products), except where we expressly state that separate terms (and not these) apply. These Products are provided to you by Instagram, Inc.

We do not charge you to use Instagram or the other products and services covered by these Terms. Instead, businesses pay us to show you ads for their products and services. By using our Products, you agree that we can show you ads that we think are relevant to you and your interests. We utilize your personal data to help determine which ads to display to you.

We do not sell your personal data to advertisers, and we do not share information that directly identifies you (such as your name, email address or other contact information) with advertisers unless you provide us specific permission. Rather, advertisers can tell us the type of audience they want to target, and we show those ads to users who may be interested. We also provide advertisers with reports about the performance of their ads, helping them understand engagement with their content.

Our Data Policy explains how we collect and use your personal data to tailor certain ads and provide all other services. You can see your settings any time to review privacy options regarding how your data is used.

2. Welcome to Twitter!

Twitter offers features that allow users to engage with content through tweets, retweets, and following others. These Terms govern your use of Twitter and the services we offer (the Twitter Products), except where we expressly mention separate terms. These Products are provided to you by Twitter, Inc.

There are no charges to use Twitter or the services detailed in these Terms. Instead, advertisers pay us to display ads targeting you. By using our services, you accept that we can show you personalized ads based on your interests. We leverage your personal data to determine the ads shown to you.

We don't sell your personal information to businesses, nor do we share identifiable information (like your name or email) with advertisers without your permission. Advertisers can specify their desired audience type, and we select the relevant users. We provide them with insights into ad performance based on interactions from users.

Our Data Policy outlines our methods for collecting and utilizing your personal data to customize your experience and the ads you see. You retain the ability to adjust your privacy settings at any point.

3. Welcome to LinkedIn!

LinkedIn provides professional networking and job-related services through its platform. These Terms apply to your use of LinkedIn and its services (the LinkedIn Products), unless specifically noted that separate terms apply. These Products are offered by LinkedIn Corporation.

LinkedIn does not charge any fees for basic services under these Terms. Instead, companies pay LinkedIn to promote their job listings and services. By utilizing our services, you consent to see ads tailored to your profession and interests based on your data.

We do not sell your personal information to recruiters or advertisers, and we do not disclose identifiable information (like your email or address) without your explicit permission. Recruiters can inform us about the type of professionals they wish to target, and we connect them with potential candidates. We also provide insights into ad engagement effectiveness.

Our Data Policy elaborates on how we handle and utilize your personal data to enhance your networking experience and ensure you see relevant ads. You can modify your data privacy preferences at all times.

4. Welcome to YouTube!

YouTube allows users to upload, share, and stream video content online. These Terms govern your access to YouTube and its services (the YouTube Products), unless we indicate otherwise through separate terms. These Products are provided by YouTube, Inc.

We do not charge you to use YouTube or any of the services described in these Terms. Instead, advertisers fund the platform to display ads to users. By using YouTube, you agree to receive targeted ads based on your viewing behavior and interests.

We do not sell your personal information to advertisers; neither do we share identifiable information (like your name or contact details) without your consent. Advertisers inform us about their target audience, and we display their ads to appropriate users. We also deliver analytics regarding ad performance.

Our Data Policy breaks down the methods we use to gather and process your personal data to improve your viewing experience and the advertisements you encounter. You may check and alter your privacy settings whenever needed.



216
Original Question: "Does Facebook use only AI to discover and remove harmful content?"

New Questions:
a. "Does YouTube rely solely on AI to identify and eliminate inappropriate videos?"
b. "Does Twitter utilize only machine learning to detect and address abusive behavior?"
c. "Is Instagram's approach to finding and removing offensive images based solely on automation?"
d. "Does LinkedIn employ exclusively AI technology to find and manage inappropriate job postings?" 

Contracts corresponding to the new questions:

a. Contract: "Our mission is to ensure a safe environment for all users on YouTube. To help achieve this, we utilize a combination of automated systems and human moderation to identify and remove content that violates our community guidelines. We implement advanced technologies, including AI and machine learning, to assist in this process, but we also rely on feedback from our users and our dedicated team to ensure comprehensive oversight."

b. Contract: "Twitter is committed to maintaining a positive user experience by combating abuse on the platform. We employ a robust system that includes both AI-driven technologies and human review to identify harmful behavior. While AI plays a critical role in this endeavor, user reports and proactive human moderation are essential components of our strategy to ensure the safety and integrity of our community."

c. Contract: "At Instagram, we aim to foster a safe space for creativity and expression. To maintain this, we leverage a mix of advanced technologies and human input to identify and take down harmful visual content. Our automated systems, while effective, are complemented by a dedicated team that reviews flagged content, ensuring that our community guidelines are enforced effectively."

d. Contract: "LinkedIn is dedicated to providing a professional and safe environment for our users. We use a combination of AI technologies and manual oversight to monitor job postings for appropriateness. This multifaceted approach allows us to efficiently identify offensive content while ensuring user safety through continuous improvement and learning from community feedback."



217
Original Question: "Are automated systems the sole means by which Facebook identifies and removes problematic content?"

New Questions:
a. "Is machine learning the only method that Instagram uses to detect and eliminate inappropriate posts?"
b. "Do algorithms serve as the exclusive technique that Twitter employs to find and address harmful tweets?"
c. "Are AI systems the only approach LinkedIn takes to identify and remove offensive job listings?"
d. "Is automated software the singular way that YouTube tracks and filters out violating videos?"

Corresponding Contract:
Our mission is to provide individuals with a safe and engaging environment to connect and share. To help advance this mission, we provide the Products and services described below to you:

1. Ensure a safe user experience:
Your experience on Instagram is personalized and tailored, incorporating features such as posts, stories, and notifications. We leverage advanced technology and user interactions to not only enhance your engagement but also to detect and remove suspicious or harmful content.

2. Utilize combined methods for content management:
We combine both automated systems and human moderation to monitor interactions on Instagram. This allows us to more effectively identify inappropriate content and take the necessary actions against it.

3. Combat harmful conduct through community engagement:
We believe communities thrive in a safe environment. Thus, we have implemented both machine learning technologies and human reviewers to ensure that any harmful or abusive behavior can be swiftly addressed.

4. Research and implement technology for safety:
We continuously research new technologies, including AI and machine learning, to improve our products. Through detailed analytics and user feedback, we enhance our ability to discover and remove harmful content, assuring a more enjoyable experience for all users.

5. Provide users with consistent experiences across platforms:
Our Products are designed to give you a unified experience regardless of the platform. We share user engagement data across Instagram, allowing for seamless moderation and communication of safety policies to manage problematic interactions.

6. Enable global moderation capabilities:
To effectively operate our services worldwide, we employ various methods for content control, ensuring that content aligns with our community guidelines, and that harmful content is promptly identified and dealt with, regardless of geographic location.



218
Original Question: "Can I use the timeline for promoting my business?"

New Questions:
a. "Is it permissible to use your social media account to advertise your services?"
b. "Can I post promotional content for my event on my personal page?"
c. "Am I allowed to use my profile to market my products to friends?"
d. "Can I share links to my business website on my personal account?"

---

**Contract Corresponding to New Questions:**

1. Services Use Policy

We provide these services to you and others to help advance our mission. In exchange, we need you to make the following commitments:

1. Who can use our Social Media Services
   
When users are mindful of their actions, our community remains supportive and accountable. Therefore, you must:
   - Use your real name as recognized in everyday life.
   - Share truthful information about your identity.
   - Create only one account (your own) for personal use.
   - Not share your password, allow access to your account to others, or transfer your account without our consent.

Our platform is intended for a wide range of users, but you are prohibited from using it if:
   - You are under the legal age of 13 (or the minimum age in your country).
   - You have a felony conviction for sexual offenses.
   - Your account was previously disabled for policy violations.
   - You are legally barred from accessing our products under applicable laws.

2. What you can share and do on our Social Media Services

We encourage users to express their thoughts and share meaningful content, provided it doesn't infringe upon others' safety or the community's integrity. Hence, you agree not to engage or facilitate:

1. Sharing content that:
   - Violates these Terms, our Community Standards, or applicable policies.
   - Is unlawful, misleading, discriminatory, or fraudulent.
   - Infringes upon someone else's rights, including intellectual property rights.

2. Uploading harmful software or creating actions that disrupt our services’ functionality or user experience.

3. Accessing data using automated methods without our permission or trying to obtain data without authorization.

We reserve the right to remove or limit access to content that breaches these provisions. If we take down any content you’ve shared for violating our Policy, we will inform you and provide options for review unless severe, repetitive violations occur or legal liabilities may arise. 

We also encourage users to report any conduct or content that seems to violate rights or our terms. We can restrict or remove your content if necessary to prevent any adverse legal or regulatory impacts on our services.

Original Question: "Are users permitted to utilize the timeline for commercial purposes?"

New Questions:

b. "Is it allowed for individuals to share advertisements on their personal accounts?"
c. "Are users allowed to conduct sales transactions directly through their social media accounts?"
d. "Can users post promotional content for their services on their user pages?"

Contract for New Questions:

1. Use of Personal Accounts
When individuals create accounts on our platform, they agree to utilize their profiles primarily for personal purposes. For this reason, they must:
- Use their real name that they use in everyday life.
- Provide truthful and accurate information about themselves.
- Create only one account and refrain from using it to promote businesses or commercial activities.

2. Restrictions on Commercial Use
We aim for individuals to express themselves and share important content, but personal accounts should not be used for commercial purposes. Consequently, users agree not to:
- Use their profiles for promoting products or services, or conducting any commercial transactions.
- Share advertisements or commercial promotions that could undermine the integrity of the platform.
- Engaging in sales or business marketing activities through their personal accounts without proper authorization. 

We may take actions to remove or restrict access to content identified as commercial in nature if it is deemed inappropriate for personal profiles.

Contract for New Questions:

1. **Permission to remove content from platforms**: When you delete content that you have shared on our platform, you have the right to delete that content, and we will make efforts to remove it from visibility across our services. However, please be advised that immediate deletion may not be possible in all instances due to technical limitations. Content will generally be fully deleted within a maximum of 90 days from when you initiate the deletion.

2. **Follow-up on deletion**: Even after you delete your content, it may still exist in our backup systems for a limited period to comply with legal obligations or to aid in investigations regarding possible violations of our terms.

3. **Updating your preferences**: You maintain the ability to delete your account and all associated content entirely. You are encouraged to review your account settings to manage how your deleted content is handled and whether any information remains visible under certain circumstances. 

4. **No Guarantee of Universal Deletion**: While we strive to remove your content from visibility, we cannot guarantee that it will be completely removed from every aspect of our systems. This is particularly pertinent in cases where others may have shared or interacted with your content before its removal.

   When you delete your content or cancel your subscription on our platform, we strive to remove all traces of that content from our systems across all products and services. However, we acknowledge that immediate deletion may not always be feasible due to technical limitations. In such cases, we will ensure that any content you have deleted is removed within 90 days of the request for deletion. We maintain the right to retain information as necessary to comply with legal obligations, investigate violations, or other essential functions as outlined in this section.

2. **Profile and Activity Information**: 
   If you choose to delete your profile or account, you authorize us to remove any associated information, including but not limited to your viewing history, workout records, or purchase data, across our platforms, unless such information is retained for compliance with legal requirements or to complete outstanding transactions.

3. **Software Updates and Data Usage**: 
   You allow us the right to automate the process of updating any software you have downloaded, and to manage the removal of your data as per your deletion request, in accordance with our privacy policy and user agreements.

For all other claims, you agree to resolve the dispute exclusively in California courts, and California laws will govern these terms.

**3. Limits on Liability**
We strive to ensure that our services offer the best possible experience and provide explicit guidelines for all users. Our services, however, are offered "as is," and we do not guarantee that they will always be safe, secure, or free from errors or disruptions. To the fullest extent allowed by law, we DISCLAIM ALL WARRANTIES, WHETHER EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, TITLE, AND NON-INFRINGEMENT. We do not control what users do and are not liable for their actions or any content they publish (including offensive or unlawful materials).

We cannot foresee when issues might arise concerning our services. Therefore, our liability is limited to the maximum extent allowed by applicable law, and under no circumstances will we be liable for any lost profits, revenues, information, or data, nor for consequential, special, indirect, exemplary, punitive, or incidental damages arising from or related to these Terms or the services we provide, even if we have been informed of the potential for such damages.

**4. Disputes**
We aim to establish clear guidelines to limit or ideally prevent disputes between you and us. However, if a dispute occurs, it's important to know in advance where it can be resolved and which laws will apply. 

If you are a consumer, the laws of your country of residence apply to any claims or disputes you have against us arising from these Terms or our services, and you may resolve your claim in any competent court in that country that has jurisdiction. In all other situations, you agree that the claim must be resolved exclusively in the U.S. District Court for the Northern District of California or a state court located in San Mateo County. You also consent to the personal jurisdiction of these courts for the purpose of litigating any such claim, with the laws of the State of California governing these Terms and any claims, disregarding conflict of law provisions.

1. **Spotify Account Ownership Transfer**  
   **Account Information**: You may need a Spotify account to use the Services. You must ensure that your account information remains current and accurate. Upon the account holder’s death, the rights to the account may be transferred to a designated individual, as specified in your Spotify account settings.  
   **Access to Your Account**: You are responsible for all activity that happens on or through your account. To protect your account, keep your password confidential. In the event of your death, if you have designated an individual to take over the account, they will be granted access following verification.  
   **Notices**: Spotify may provide you with notices related to changes in terms or service updates through various means including email or in-app notifications. You consent to receive these notices as described.

2. **Google Account Management upon Death**  
   **Account Information**: You may need a Google account to utilize certain services. You must ensure your account remains up to date. In the event of your death, you may designate an individual to manage your Google account, following Google's designated processes.  
   **Access to Your Account**: You are responsible for any activities conducted under your account. In the case of your death, if a designated individual attempts access, they must complete the verification process to gain control over the account.  
   **Notices**: Google may provide service announcements and updates regarding terms of service via email or application notifications, and your designated individual will also receive these notices after your passing.

3. **Netflix Account Transfer Upon Death**  
   **Account Information**: A Netflix account is necessary to use the streaming service. You must keep your login details updated. In the event of your death, you may prepare to transfer your account to a designated individual by setting proper permissions within your account settings.  
   **Access to Your Account**: You bear responsibility for all account activity. Should you pass away, a designated individual would need to provide verification to take over the account.  
   **Notices**: Netflix communicates service alerts and important updates through email and notifications within the application. Your designated individual will be subject to receiving notices following your death.

4. **Apple ID Account Access Guidelines**  
   **Account Information**: An Apple ID is required for various Apple services. Ensure your account details are correct and current. Upon your death, it is possible to assign access to a chosen individual, provided the necessary legal documentation is submitted.  
   **Access to Your Account**: You are accountable for all account actions. In the event of your passing, a designated individual may claim access to your Apple ID by meeting validation requirements set forth by Apple.  
   **Notices**: Apple will send service announcements and updates regarding your terms of service through various channels. These notices will also be provided to your designated individual once they gain access posthumously.

b. Contract for Facebook Account:
"Account Management After Death. The ability to transfer or grant access to your Facebook account upon your death is prohibited. The account and its contents will be permanently inaccessible to all upon the holder's death."

c. Contract for Apple ID:
"Heir Access Policy. Following the death of an Apple ID holder, all rights to the account and its contents will be terminated. Heirs are not allowed to manage or assume control of the account."

d. Contract for Microsoft Account:
"Post-Mortem Account Control. Microsoft accounts cannot be transferred or granted to other individuals upon the account holder's death. All associated rights and data will be inaccessible after the holder's passing."

4. **Waiver of Rights:**
   Our inaction in enforcing any provision of these Terms will not be viewed as a waiver of those rights. Should any part of a provision be deemed invalid, the intent behind that provision is still upheld while the remainder of the Terms remains effective.

5. **Assignment Rights:**

a. **Contract for AT&T in California**
   Choice of Law. These Terms and the relationship between the parties, including any claim or dispute that might arise between the parties, whether sounding in contract, tort, or otherwise, will be governed by the laws of the State of California without regard to its conflict of law provisions. In no event will the parties bring claims against one another under the laws of another jurisdiction.

   Forum. If for any reason a Dispute proceeds in court rather than through arbitration, all such Disputes (regardless of theory) arising out of or relating to these Terms, or the relationship between you and us, will be brought exclusively in the courts located in the county of Los Angeles, California or the U.S. District Court for the Central District of California. In such cases, you and we agree to submit to the personal jurisdiction of the courts located within the county of Los Angeles, California or the Central District of California, and agree to waive any and all objections to the exercise of jurisdiction over the parties by such courts and to venue in such courts.

b. **Contract for T-Mobile in Florida**
   Choice of Law. a. **Beta Services for Microsoft Teams**
Zoom may, from time to time, offer access to services that are classified as Beta version related to Microsoft Teams alternatives. Access to and use of Beta versions may be subject to additional agreements. Zoom makes no representations that a Beta version will ever be made generally available and reserves the right to discontinue or modify a Beta version at any time without notice. Beta versions are provided AS IS, may contain bugs, errors or other defects, and Your use of a Beta version is at Your sole risk.

b. **Use of Services for Google Meet**
You may only use the Services pursuant to the terms of this Agreement as they relate to Google Meet alternatives. You are solely responsible for Your and Your End Users use of the Services and shall abide by, and ensure compliance with, all Laws related to competing products including, but not limited to, Laws related to recording, intellectual property, privacy, and export control.

c. **Your Responsibilities for Skype Competing Services**
You agree that You are solely responsible for the content ("Content") sent or transmitted by You or displayed or uploaded by You when using services that compete with Skype, including compliance with all applicable Laws.

d. **Limitations on Use for Cisco Webex Alternatives**
You may not reproduce, resell, or distribute any services or reports generated that compete with Cisco Webex for any purpose unless specifically permitted to do so under a separate agreement with Zoom.

CHARGES AND CANCELLATION. You agree that Fitness Center may charge to Your credit card or other payment mechanism selected by You and approved by Fitness Center ("Your Account") all amounts due and owing for the Services, including taxes and service fees, registration fees, membership fees, or any other fee or charge associated with Your Account. Fitness Center may change prices at any time, including changing from a free trial to a paid membership and charging for Services that were previously offered free of charge; provided, however, that Fitness Center will provide you with prior notice and an opportunity to terminate Your Account if Fitness Center changes the price of a Service to which you are subscribed and will not charge you for a previously free Service unless you have been notified of the applicable fees and agreed to pay such fees. You agree that in the event Fitness Center is unable to collect the fees owed for the Services through Your Account, Fitness Center may take any other steps it deems necessary to collect such fees from You and that You will be responsible for all costs and expenses incurred by Fitness Center in connection with such collection activity, including collection fees, court costs and attorneys' fees. You further agree that Fitness Center may collect interest at the lesser of 1.5% per month or the highest amount permitted by law on any amounts not paid when due. You may cancel your membership at any time. If you cancel, you will not be billed for any additional membership terms, and service will continue until the end of the current Membership Term. If you cancel, you will not receive a refund for any fees already paid.

TERMINATION. The Fitness Center website contains information on how to terminate Your Account. If you have purchased a Service for a specific term, such termination will be effective on the last day of the then-current term. Your Order Form may provide that a Renewal Term will begin automatically unless either party provides notice of termination at least thirty (30) days prior to the commencement of the next Renewal Term. If You fail to comply with any provision of this Agreement, Fitness Center may terminate this Agreement immediately and retain any fees previously paid by You. Sections 1 and 3 through 20, inclusive, shall survive any termination of this Agreement. Upon any termination of this Agreement, You must cease any further use of the Services. If at any time You are not satisfied with the Services, your sole remedy is to cease using the Services and follow this termination process.



243
Original Question: "Upon cancellation, are users entitled to reimbursement in respect of amounts previously paid?"

New Questions:
a. "If a membership is canceled, are members entitled to a refund for any fees already paid?"
b. "When a subscription is terminated, does the user receive any reimbursement for the payment they made in advance?"
c. "Upon the cancellation of a service plan, are customers eligible for a refund of any charges previously billed?"
d. "If a user decides to cancel their account, do they have the right to receive any funds back for payments already processed?"

Corresponding Contracts:
1. **CHARGES AND REIMBURSEMENT:** You agree that, upon cancelling your membership, you may not be entitled to reimbursement for any fees already paid. The terms surrounding membership cancellations will clearly state that no refunds are offered for services that have been processed or are not included in the current billing cycle. By canceling, you acknowledge understanding these terms.

2. **TERMINATION AND REFUNDS.** The platform contains information outlining how to terminate your membership. Upon cancellation, if you have prepaid for future services, you agree that you will not receive a refund for any service already rendered. Users must follow the designated process for termination as specified.

3. **PAYMENT POLICY:** You agree that upon the termination of your custom plan for a specific duration, there will be no refunds issued for the remaining period, and users must adhere to the payment protocols set forth. No refunds will be available for previous charges once a decision for cancellation has been made. 

4. **CANCELLATION TERMS:** The website outlines the procedure for canceling your subscription. Upon cancellation, you understand that you forfeited rights to reimbursement for any amounts paid before the cancellation date. Following termination, all services will cease, and you will remain liable for any fees incurred up to that point.

Original Question: "Under the license, am I permitted to use Zoom in a life-and-death situation in a hospital?"

New Questions:

Contracts corresponding to new questions:

a. **Military Operations Clause**: The Services shall not be used for or in any military operation or defense-related activity, particularly those situations involving life-threatening scenarios or operational control over military units.

b. **Emergency Rescue Disclaimer**: You acknowledge that the Services are not designed for use in emergency rescue missions and employing them in such contexts involves significant risks and is prohibited under this Agreement.

c. **Critical Condition Monitoring Limitation**: The Services are not intended for, and should not be used in, the real-time monitoring or management of patients in critical or life-threatening conditions, and such use is expressly prohibited.

d. **High-Stakes Negotiation Clause**: You understand and agree that utilizing the Services for high-stakes negotiations that may impact human lives is strictly restricted, and doing so goes against the terms outlined in this Agreement.

Original Question: "Pursuant to the terms hereunder, does the Zoom license permit using the licensed services in critical or emergency medical contexts?"

The Adobe Services are not designed or licensed for use in military operations or defense scenarios, including without limitation operations of combat systems, communication systems for defense, and any environment involving strategic national security. The Services shall not be used for or in any HIGH RISK environment.

INJUNCTIVE RELIEF. You acknowledge that any unauthorized use of the Adobe Services may cause irreparable injury to Adobe, and under such circumstances, Adobe will be entitled to equitable relief, including, but not limited to, injunctive relief without posting bond.

NO WARRANTIES. YOU UNDERSTAND AND AGREE THAT THE ADOBE SERVICES ARE PROVIDED "AS IS" AND ADOBE EXPRESSLY DISCLAIMS ALL WARRANTIES, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE OR NON-INFRINGEMENT. USE OF THE SERVICES IS AT YOUR SOLE RISK.

b. NO HIGH RISK USE. The Microsoft Services are not designed or licensed for use in life-saving emergency response situations including without limitation coordination of first responders and execution of emergency public safety operations. The Services shall not be used for or in any HIGH RISK environment.

INJUNCTIVE RELIEF. You acknowledge that misuse of the Microsoft Services may result in serious harm, and Microsoft will be entitled to seek equitable relief without the need for any security.

NO WARRANTIES. YOU UNDERSTAND AND AGREE THAT THE MICROSOFT SERVICES ARE PROVIDED "AS IS" AND MICROSOFT DISCLAIMS ALL WARRANTIES, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED. USE OF THE SERVICES IS AT YOUR OWN RISK.

c. NO HIGH RISK USE. The AWS Services are not designed or licensed for use in high-risk environments such as aviation safety monitoring, including without limitation control of flight navigation systems and aircraft guidance. The Services shall not be used for any HIGH RISK activity.

INJUNCTIVE RELIEF. You acknowledge that any unauthorized use of AWS Services may severely impact safety measures, and AWS will be entitled to equitable relief as necessary.

NO WARRANTIES. YOU UNDERSTAND AND AGREE THAT THE AWS SERVICES ARE PROVIDED "AS IS" AND AWS DISCLAIMS ALL WARRANTIES, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED. USE OF THE SERVICES IS AT YOUR SOLE RISK.

d. NO HIGH RISK USE. The Google Cloud Services are not designed or licensed for use in nuclear power facility operations including without limitation control systems for reactor operations and emergency protocols for nuclear incidents. The Services shall not be utilized in a HIGH RISK environment.

INJUNCTIVE RELIEF. You acknowledge that violating the use conditions of Google Cloud Services may cause significant harm, and Google will be entitled to seek immediate equitable relief.

NO WARRANTIES. YOU UNDERSTAND AND AGREE THAT GOOGLE CLOUD SERVICES ARE PROVIDED "AS IS" AND GOOGLE DISCLAIMS ALL WARRANTIES, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED. USE OF THE SERVICES IS AT YOUR OWN RISK.

Original Question: "In the event that certain provisions of the agreement are deemed invalid by a judicial decision, will the remaining provisions also be rendered invalid?"

New Questions:
a. "If a specific clause in this contract is found to be unlawful by a court, will the other clauses still hold valid?"

Contract corresponding to the new questions:

20.1 Choice of Law and Forum. This Agreement shall be governed by and construed under the laws of the State of New York, U.S.A., as applied to agreements entered into and to be performed in New York by New York residents. Except as provided in Exhibit A, the Parties consent to the exclusive jurisdiction and venue of the state courts located in and serving New York County, New York and the federal courts in the Southern District of New York.

20.2 Contracting Entity. In the event Your online account reflects a bill to/sold to address in Canada, the contracting entity under these TOS shall be our Affiliate, XYZ Canada Ltd.

20.3 Waiver and Severability. Failure by either Party to exercise any of its rights under, or to enforce any provision of, this Agreement will not be deemed a waiver or forfeiture of such rights or ability to enforce such provision. If any provision of this Agreement is held by a court of competent jurisdiction to be illegal, invalid or unenforceable, that provision will be amended to achieve as nearly as possible the same economic effect of the original provision and the remainder of this Agreement will remain in full force and effect.

20.4 General Provisions. This Agreement embodies the entire understanding and agreement between the Parties respecting the subject matter of this Agreement and supersedes any and all prior understandings and agreements between the Parties respecting such subject matter, except that if You or Your company have executed a separate written agreement or you have signed an order form referencing a separate agreement governing your use of the Services, then such agreement shall control to the extent that any provision of this Agreement conflicts with the terms of such agreement. Our company may elect to change or supplement the terms of this Agreement from time to time at its sole discretion. We will exercise commercially reasonable business efforts to provide notice to You of any material changes to this Agreement. Within ten (10) business days of posting changes to this Agreement (or ten (10) business days from the date of notice, if such is provided), they will be binding on You. If You do not agree with the changes, You should discontinue using the Services. If You continue using the Services after such ten-business-day period, You will be deemed to have accepted the changes to the terms of this Agreement. In order to participate in certain Services, You may be notified that You are required to download software and/or agree to additional terms and conditions. Unless expressly set forth in such additional terms and conditions, those additional terms are hereby incorporated into this Agreement. This Agreement has been prepared in the English Language and such version shall be controlling in all respects and any non-English version of this Agreement is solely for accommodation purposes.
