248
Original Question: "Upon a person obtaining the right to take legal action against Zoom, can such person commence that legal action two years after obtaining the right to do so?"

New Questions:
a. "After an individual gains the right to sue a restaurant for a mishap, are they allowed to file that lawsuit three years after acquiring that right?"
b. "Once an employee receives the opportunity to pursue legal action against their employer for wrongful termination, can they initiate the lawsuit four years after gaining that opportunity?"
c. "When a consumer is entitled to bring a claim against an online retailer for a defective product, are they able to initiate that claim one and a half years after their entitlement begins?"
d. "If a client has the right to seek legal recourse against a financial advisor for negligence, can they start legal proceedings five years after they have that right?"

Contracts corresponding to the new questions:

a. 
A. Disputes. A dispute is any controversy between You and the Restaurant concerning any service provided, any issues related to food safety, the price of the meals, or any term of this Agreement, under any legal theory including contract, warranty, tort, statute, or regulation, except disputes relating to the enforcement of Your or the Restaurant's intellectual property rights.
B. Small Claims Court Available. You may initiate an action in your local Small Claims Court if you meet the court's requirements. However, if such a claim is transferred, removed, or appealed to a different court, the Restaurant reserves the right to require arbitration.
C. Arbitration Procedure. Disputes not resolved pursuant to Section A or B shall be resolved through arbitration, conducted by an arbitration association under its relevant rules. 
D. Arbitration Fees. If you are unable to afford the arbitration costs, the Restaurant will advance those costs for you, subject to the arbitrator's decision on reimbursement if the Restaurant prevails.
E. Requirement to File Within One Year. A claim or dispute relating to this Agreement must be filed within one year after it could first be filed, or such claim will be permanently barred.

b. 
A. Disputes. A dispute is any controversy between You and Your Employer regarding employment conditions, severance, or any term of this Agreement, except those relating to intellectual property rights.
B. Small Claims Court Available. You may bring an action in your local Small Claims Court if you meet the court's requirements; however, if it is transferred, the Employer may require arbitration.
C. Arbitration Procedure. Disputes unresolved under Section A or B shall proceed to arbitration under existing commercial rules.
D. Arbitration Fees. If you cannot afford arbitration fees, the Employer will cover costs pending the arbitrator’s ruling on reimbursement if the Employer wins.
E. Requirement to File Within One Year. Claims must be filed within one year after they arise, or they will be permanently barred.

c. 
A. Disputes. A dispute includes any disagreement between You and the Online Retailer regarding products, services, or any element of this agreement, except for intellectual property issues.
B. Small Claims Court Available. Claims can be initiated in your local Small Claims Court if you meet the criteria but may be moved to arbitration if necessary.
C. Arbitration Procedure. Any dispute not resolved via Section A or B will be settled by arbitration as per the established rules of the relevant arbitration association.
D. Arbitration Fees. The Online Retailer will advance arbitration costs for you, with potential reimbursement upon a ruling in favor of the Retailer.
E. Requirement to File Within One Year. All claims must be filed within one year of their eligibility, or they will be permanently barred.

d.
A. Disputes. Any controversy between You and Your Financial Advisor pertaining to advice given, services rendered, or any term of this agreement shall constitute a dispute, excluding intellectual property rights issues.
B. Small Claims Court Available. Claims may be initiated in local Small Claims Court provided you meet applicable requirements, though arbitration may apply if the case is transferred.
C. Arbitration Procedure. Any unresolved dispute following Section A or B will be addressed through arbitration according to specified arbitration association rules.
D. Arbitration Fees. Should you be unable to cover arbitration costs, the Financial Advisor will advance these expenses for you, subject to repayment considerations if the advisor is victorious.
E. Requirement to File Within One Year. Disputes must be filed within one year from the date they become actionable, or claims will be barred permanently.



249
Original Question: "If I give Reddit a great commercial idea, can I demand payment for it?"

New Questions:
a. "If I share a brilliant marketing strategy with Facebook, can I expect compensation for it?"
b. "If I propose an innovative product design to a startup, am I entitled to receive payment for my idea?"
c. "If I present a unique business model to a crowdfunding platform, can I require financial reward for my contribution?"
d. "If I offer a distinctive content creation concept to an online media company, can I claim a fee for my proposal?"

New Contracts:
1. **Contract for Marketing Strategy Submission**
   - By submitting a marketing strategy to Facebook, you acknowledge that the idea is yours and you have the rights to share it. You understand that Facebook is under no obligation to compensate you for the idea, and any use of the strategy will be at their discretion. You also agree that Facebook may modify, adapt, and use your strategy without any compensation to you.

2. **Contract for Product Design Proposal**
   - When proposing a product design to a startup, you confirm that you hold all necessary rights and authority to disclose the idea. You agree that sharing this idea does not guarantee a payment and that the startup may decide to use, modify, or reject the proposal at their own discretion.

3. **Contract for Business Model Presentation**
   - By presenting a business model to a crowdfunding platform, you represent that the idea is original and you have ownership rights. You understand that you cannot demand payment for your idea and that the platform retains the right to utilize or disregard your proposal without compensation.

4. **Contract for Content Creation Concept Submission**
   - If you submit a content creation concept to an online media company, you agree that you retain ownership of the idea but you cannot pursue any payment. The media company has the right to evaluate the concept and use it as they see fit, including modifications and adaptations without any obligation to compensate you.



250
Original Question: "Are users entitled to compensation in connection with proposals they may provide to Reddit?"

New Questions:
a. "Are contributors entitled to royalties for creative works submitted to a publishing platform?"
b. "Do artists receive payment when they submit their designs for a merchandise line?"
c. "Can participants expect financial rewards for ideas presented at a startup incubator?"
d. "Are game developers compensated for concepts they share with a gaming company?" 

Contracts corresponding to new questions:

a. **Contract for Question 1**:  
"By submitting creative works to the publishing platform, you retain ownership of your designs but grant the platform a worldwide, royalty-free license to use, reproduce, and distribute your work in any media. You acknowledge that you are not entitled to royalties or payments unless expressly agreed upon in a separate agreement."

b. **Contract for Question 2**:  
"When you submit your designs for a merchandise line, you maintain ownership of your creative rights. However, you hereby grant the company a non-exclusive, royalty-free license to use, reproduce, and modify your designs for the purposes of manufacturing and selling merchandise. Compensation for your designs, if any, will be detailed in a separate agreement."

c. **Contract for Question 3**:  
"Any ideas presented at the startup incubator remain your intellectual property; however, by participating, you grant the incubator the right to evaluate, use, and incorporate your ideas into their projects without obligation for compensation unless specified in a separate agreement."

d. **Contract for Question 4**:  
"By submitting your game concepts to the gaming company, you acknowledge that you retain all rights to your ideas, but grant the company a non-exclusive license to review and utilize your ideas for potential development without obligation for compensation unless otherwise stated in a subsequent contract."



251
Original Question: "Can I get paid to moderate a subreddit?"

New Questions:
a. "Is it permissible to receive compensation for managing a Facebook group?"
b. "Can I be financially rewarded for overseeing a Discord server?"
c. "Am I allowed to earn money while moderating a Twitter community?"
d. "Is it possible to get paid for being an administrator of a forum?"

Contracts for New Questions:

a. **Contract for Facebook Group Moderation**: 
Moderating a Facebook group is a voluntary position that may be available to users. We are not responsible for actions taken by the group moderators. You may not enter into any agreement with a third party regarding compensation for your moderation efforts without our written approval. Any rules you create for the group must comply with Facebook's Community Standards and Terms of Service. Facebook reserves the right to revoke your moderation privileges at any time.

b. **Contract for Discord Server Management**:
Managing a Discord server is a voluntary role undertaken by users. You are not authorized to represent Discord and may not receive any compensation for your moderation services unless expressly permitted in writing by Discord. If you create rules for your server, they must align with Discord’s Community Guidelines. Discord reserves the right to remove your moderation status at any time.

c. **Contract for Twitter Community Moderation**:
Overseeing a Twitter community is an informal, volunteer position. You cannot claim to be representing Twitter and are not permitted to accept payment for moderation activities unless approved by Twitter. Any guidelines you set for your community must not violate Twitter's rules. Twitter holds the right to revoke your moderation capabilities at its discretion.

d. **Contract for Forum Administration**:
Administering a forum is a voluntary, unofficial role. Forum administrators cannot accept compensation for their work without prior written consent from the forum owner. You may establish and enforce rules for the forum as long as they do not conflict with the forum's terms of use or guidelines. The forum owner reserves the right to terminate your administrative privileges at any time.

1. Moderators of Community Events
Moderating a community event is an unofficial, voluntary position that may be available to users of the platform. We are not responsible for actions taken by the event coordinators. We reserve the right to revoke or limit a user's ability to coordinate at any time and for any reason or no reason, including for a breach of these Terms.

If you choose to coordinate a community event:
You agree to follow the Community Guidelines for Healthy Engagement;
You agree that when you receive reports related to a community event you coordinate, you will take appropriate action, which may include addressing concerns that violate policy and/or promptly escalating to event management for review;
You are not, and may not represent that you are, authorized to act on behalf of the organization;
You may not enter into any agreement with a third party on behalf of the organization or any community events that you coordinate, without our written approval;
You may not perform coordination actions in return for any form of compensation, consideration, gift, or favor from third parties;
If you have access to non-public information as a result of coordinating a community event, you will use such information only in connection with your performance as a coordinator; and
You may create and enforce rules for community events you coordinate, provided that such rules do not conflict with these Terms, the Engagement Policy, or the Community Guidelines for Healthy Engagement.

The organization reserves the right, but has no obligation, to overturn any action or decision of a coordinator if the organization, in its sole discretion, believes that such action or decision is not in the interest of the organization or the community.

10. Indemnity
Except to the extent prohibited by law, you agree to defend, indemnify, and hold us, our directors, officers, employees, affiliates, agents, contractors, third-party service providers, and licensors (the YouTube Entities) harmless from any claim or demand, including costs and attorneys fees, made by any third party due to or arising out of (a) your use of the Services, (b) your violation of these Terms, (c) your violation of applicable laws or regulations, or (d) Your Content. We reserve the right to control the defense of any matter for which you are required to indemnify us, and you agree to cooperate with our defense of these claims.

THE SERVICES ARE PROVIDED AS IS AND AS AVAILABLE WITHOUT WARRANTIES OF ANY KIND, EITHER EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, TITLE, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, AND NON-INFRINGEMENT. YOUTUBE ENTITIES DO NOT WARRANT THAT THE SERVICES ARE ACCURATE, COMPLETE, RELIABLE, CURRENT, OR ERROR FREE. YOUTUBE DOES NOT CONTROL, ENDORSE, OR TAKE RESPONSIBILITY FOR ANY CONTENT AVAILABLE ON OR LINKED TO THE SERVICES OR THE ACTIONS OF ANY THIRD PARTY OR USER, INCLUDING MODERATORS. WHILE YOUTUBE ATTEMPTS TO MAKE YOUR ACCESS TO AND USE OF OUR SERVICES SAFE, WE DO NOT REPRESENT OR WARRANT THAT OUR SERVICES OR SERVERS ARE FREE OF VIRUSES OR OTHER HARMFUL COMPONENTS.

IN NO EVENT AND UNDER NO THEORY OF LIABILITY, INCLUDING CONTRACT, TORT, NEGLIGENCE, STRICT LIABILITY, WARRANTY, OR OTHERWISE, WILL THE YOUTUBE ENTITIES BE LIABLE TO YOU FOR ANY INDIRECT, CONSEQUENTIAL, EXEMPLARY, INCIDENTAL, SPECIAL, OR PUNITIVE DAMAGES, OR LOST PROFITS ARISING FROM OR RELATING TO THESE TERMS OR THE SERVICES, INCLUDING THOSE ARISING FROM OR RELATING TO CONTENT MADE AVAILABLE ON THE SERVICES THAT IS ALLEGED TO BE DEFAMATORY, OFFENSIVE, OR ILLEGAL. ACCESS TO, AND USE OF, THE SERVICES IS AT YOUR OWN DISCRETION AND RISK, AND YOU WILL BE SOLELY RESPONSIBLE FOR ANY DAMAGE TO YOUR DEVICE OR COMPUTER SYSTEM, OR LOSS OF DATA RESULTING THEREFROM. IN NO EVENT WILL THE AGGREGATE LIABILITY OF THE YOUTUBE ENTITIES EXCEED THE GREATER OF ONE HUNDRED U.S. DOLLARS ($100) OR ANY AMOUNT YOU PAID YOUTUBE IN THE PREVIOUS SIX MONTHS FOR THE SERVICES GIVING RISE TO THE CLAIM. THE LIMITATIONS OF THIS SECTION WILL APPLY TO ANY THEORY OF LIABILITY, INCLUDING THOSE BASED ON WARRANTY, CONTRACT, STATUTE, TORT (INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE) OR OTHERWISE, AND EVEN IF THE YOUTUBE ENTITIES HAVE BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF ANY SUCH DAMAGE, AND EVEN IF ANY REMEDY SET FORTH HEREIN IS FOUND TO HAVE FAILED ITS ESSENTIAL PURPOSE.    If you have any disagreements regarding these Terms, it is understood that such disputes must be handled through litigation in accordance with the laws specified herein, and you agree to submit to the jurisdiction of the applicable courts.

   **Section 17. Informal Negotiation Clause**
   Should any issues arise, the parties agree to engage in good faith informal negotiation as a first step before pursuing alternative or formal dispute resolutions as outlined in later sections.

259
Original Question: "Does the Wikimedia Foundation help to edit Wikipedia articles?"

New Questions:
a. "Does the OpenStreetMap Foundation assist in modifying map entries on OpenStreetMap?"
b. "Does the Creative Commons organization provide support for editing content on their licensing platform?"
c. "Does the Internet Archive play a part in curating and updating content on its Wayback Machine?"
d. "Does the Free Software Foundation have a role in the maintenance and editing of documentation for open-source software projects?"

Contracts for New Questions:

a. Contract: The OpenStreetMap Foundation is committed to supporting the growth and distribution of open geographic data. Our role is to host a platform that allows users to collaboratively edit map entries for public use. However, we act solely as a hosting service and do not engage in editorial activities regarding the content contributed by users. It is important to understand the following aspects of our relationship:
1. We do not edit map entries: All content hosted on OpenStreetMap is created by users, and we do not modify or oversee those contributions. This means we typically do not monitor map content and do not take responsibility for its accuracy or reliability.
2. Contributors are responsible for their contributions: Users are legally accountable for the edits made on OpenStreetMap, and should ensure they do not contribute content that may lead to legal issues under applicable laws, including relevant laws of their respective countries.

b. Contract: The Creative Commons organization is dedicated to facilitating the sharing and use of creative works through its licensing framework. Our role is to provide resources and tools that enable users to understand and apply licenses to their content. It is crucial to be aware of the following aspects of our engagement:
1. We do not edit licensed content: Creative Commons does not oversee or modify content that users apply licenses to. Each user holds responsibility for their contributions and the appropriate usage of licenses.
2. Users must maintain legal responsibility: Contributors to Creative Commons licenses must ensure their actions comply with legal standards, as we cannot provide immunity or legal guarantees regarding the use of licensed works.

c. Contract: The Internet Archive is dedicated to building an enduring library of digital content for public access. We provide tools and a platform for users to view and access archived websites. Our principles dictate the following:
1. We do not curate archived websites: The content preserved in the Wayback Machine is the product of user activity, and we do not interfere with or alter any archived material.
2. Responsibility lies with users: Individuals using the Wayback Machine must understand that they are responsible for any issues arising from their actions, and we cannot shield users from legal repercussions due to the archival content.

d. Contract: The Free Software Foundation is focused on promoting the development and distribution of free software. We aim to support the community that creates and documents these projects. It is important to clarify the following points regarding our role:
1. We do not modify documentation: The Free Software Foundation does not engage in editing or overseeing documentation created for free software projects; we provide a space where users can contribute their work.
2. Contributors accept legal liability: Users are accountable for their contributions and must ensure compliance with relevant laws, as we cannot offer protective measures against possible legal liabilities.

Original Question: "Does the Wikimedia Foundation perform any editorial function in respect of articles on Wikipedia?"

New Questions:
a. "Does the Open Library oversee any editorial duties regarding the books listed on its platform?"
b. "Does Reddit engage in any moderation or editorial functions for the posts submitted by its users?"
c. "Does Stack Overflow play any editorial role in the questions and answers shared by its community members?"
d. "Does Quora have any editorial responsibilities when it comes to the content posted by its users?" 

Contract for New Questions:

**a. Open Library Contract:**
The Open Library is committed to facilitating access to a vast array of books and literary content, enabling users to contribute and share knowledge. Our role is to host a diverse repository of resources, which are generated and maintained by a community of contributors. While we provide this platform, it is essential to recognize that we do not engage in editing or overseeing the content provided. We do not endorse or guarantee the validity of the material submitted by users. 

**b. Reddit Contract:**
Reddit is dedicated to fostering a community-driven environment that allows users to freely share and discuss varied topics. However, we want to clarify that Reddit does not assume an editorial capacity over posts made by its users. The content is solely the responsibility of the individual contributors, and we do not take responsibility for the accuracy or reliability of any information shared.

**c. Stack Overflow Contract:**
Stack Overflow advocates for an open exchange of knowledge through user-contributed questions and answers. It is important to note that we do not perform any editorial functions concerning content submitted by our users. Contributors are solely responsible for their content, and we do not provide assurances about the accuracy or completeness of the answers shared on the platform.

**d. Quora Contract:**
Quora provides a platform for individuals to share knowledge through questions and answers. We wish to emphasize that Quora does not engage in any editorial oversight of the content written by our users. The contributions made are the sole responsibility of the authors, and we cannot guarantee their validity or reliability.

Original Question: "Are contributors who received compensation obligated to make disclosures in their user page?"

Contract for New Questions:
The community-driven platform values transparency and integrity in contributions. Therefore, if you receive compensation for your contributions, you are required to disclose such affiliations in a clear manner. This can be achieved through one of the following methods:
1. A statement on your user page, highlighting any employer or client relationships related to your contributions.
2. A declaration on the discussion page accompanying any paid contributions, indicating compensation received.
3. A note in the edit summary that explains the nature of your compensation or sponsorship related to the content you modify or create.

Failure to make such disclosures may lead to a violation of community standards and could subject you to sanctions as determined by platform authority. It is crucial to comply with these guidelines to maintain the integrity of the collaborative environment. For further details, please refer to the platform’s FAQs regarding disclosure of paid contributions.



262
Original Question: "Is there one specific license that applies to all pictures and videos I contribute to Wikipedia?"
New Questions:
a. "Is there a single license that governs all images and sound recordings I submit to Wikimedia Commons?"
b. "Is there a uniform license that applies to every photograph and audio clip I upload to the Open Knowledge Foundation?"
c. "Does one particular license cover all visual and audio materials I donate to Creative Commons projects?"
d. "Is there a standard license that regulates all artwork and video files I provide to the Internet Archive?"

Contract for New Questions:
**Contract for Contributing Visual and Audio Media**

To promote the sharing and accessibility of creative works, all users contributing visual and audio media to the Projects are required to grant broad permissions to the general public for re-distributing and re-using their contributions freely, provided that proper attribution is given and the same freedoms are granted to any derivative works.

You agree to the following licensing requirements:

a. **Media to which you hold the copyright:** When you submit visual or audio media that you own, you agree to license it under:
   - Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License (CC BY 4.0), and
   - GNU Free Documentation License (GFDL) (unversioned, with no invariant sections, front-cover texts, or back-cover texts).
   (Re-users may comply with either license or both.)

The only exception is if the Project edition or feature requires a different license. In that case, you agree to license any media you contribute under that particular license. For example, at the publication of this version of the Terms of Use, Wikimedia Commons mandates that all media content is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution 2.0 Generic License (CC BY 2.0) and does not require a dual license with GFDL.

Please note that these licenses allow for commercial uses of your media, as long as such uses comply with the terms.

b. **Attribution:** Attribution is a vital component of these licenses. We consider it giving credit where credit is due to creators like yourself. When you contribute visual or audio media, you agree to be attributed in any of the following manners:
   i. Through hyperlink (where possible) or URL to the page containing the media you contributed (since each page has a history that lists all authors and editors);
   ii. Through hyperlink (where possible) or URL to an alternative, stable online copy that is freely accessible, which conforms with the license, and provides credit to the contributors similarly to the credit given on the Project website; or
   iii. Through a list of all contributors (but please note that any list of contributors may be filtered to exclude insignificant or irrelevant contributions).

c. **Importing media:** You may import visual or audio media that you have found elsewhere or co-created with others, but in such cases, you warrant that the media is available under terms compatible with the CC BY 4.0 license (or, as indicated above, another license when required by the Project edition or feature). Content available only under GFDL is not permissible.

You agree that, if you import media under a CC BY license requiring attribution, you must appropriately credit the creator(s). Where such credit is commonly given through page histories (such as Wikimedia-internal copying), it is sufficient to give attribution in the edit summary, which is recorded in the page history during import. There may be instances where the Wikimedia community decides that imported media cannot be used due to attribution difficulties.

d. **Non-text media licensing:** Non-text media uploaded to the Projects will be available under various licenses that support the overall goal of allowing broad re-use and re-distribution. When you contribute non-text media, you agree to comply with the requirements for those licenses as described in our Licensing Policy, and you must also comply with the requirements of the specific Project edition or feature to which you contribute.

e. **No revocation of license:** Except as accordance with your license, you agree that you will not unilaterally revoke or seek invalidation of any license granted under these Terms of Use for visual or audio media contributed to the Wikimedia Projects or features, even if you terminate usage of our services. 

f. **Public domain media:** Media in the public domain is welcome! However, you must confirm the public domain status of the media under the laws of the United States and any other applicable country laws concerning the specific Project edition. When you contribute public domain media, you warrant that the material is genuinely in the public domain, and you agree to label it appropriately.

g. **Re-use and distribution:** Re-use of media content hosted by us is encouraged, but exceptions exist for media contributed under "fair use" or similar copyright exemptions. Any re-use must comply with the applicable license(s).

When you re-use or distribute visual or audio media developed by the Wikimedia community, you agree to attribute the creators in any of the following manners:
i. Through hyperlink (where possible) or URL to the page or pages you are re-using (since each page has a history that lists all authors and editors);
ii. Through hyperlink (where possible) or URL to an alternate, stable online copy that is freely accessible, which conforms with the license, and provides credit to the creators similar to the credit given on the Project website; or
iii. Through a list of all creators (but be cautioned that any list of creators may be filtered to exclude very small or irrelevant contributions).

You acknowledge that modified or added content must be licensed under the same terms when altering any media sourced from a Project website, and proper attribution must be clearly indicated.



263
Original Question: "Do the terms provide for one specific license that governs the rights in respect of all images contributed to Wikipedia?"

New Questions:
a. "Are all video contributions to Wikidata covered by a single licensing agreement, or do they require different licenses based on the nature of the content?"
b. "Is there a universal license that dictates the permissions for all audio files uploaded to Wikimedia Commons?"
c. "Do the rules specify a single licensing type that applies to all artwork contributed to the Open Arts Project?"
d. "Are there overarching terms that establish a specific license for all graphics shared on the Free Culture Platform?"

Contract Corresponding to New Questions:

**Contract for Videos on Wikidata:**

To encourage the contribution of multimedia content and provide clear guidelines for its use, all users submitting video content to the Projects are required to grant broad permissions to the general public to reuse and redistribute their contributions freely, as long as proper attribution is provided. Users also agree that any derivative works created from their contributions should maintain the same freedom to reuse and redistribute.

You agree to the following licensing requirements:

a. **Videos to which you hold the copyright:** When submitting videos that you own the copyright for, you agree to license them under:
   - Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International License (CC BY-SA 4.0).
   - GNU General Public License (GPL) (unversioned).

(Users may comply with either license.)

The only exception applies if the Project edition specifies a different licensing requirement.

b. **Attribution:** When contributing video content, you agree to allow attribution via:
   i. A hyperlink (where feasible) to the page of the video you contributed.
   ii. A citation of authorship in an accessible format.

c. **Re-use of video content:** Users are welcome to reuse video materials available on the Projects if they adhere to the underlying licenses. Different licensing terms may apply in instances of "fair use."

d. **Modifications:** If modifications are made to videos sourced from Projects, the modified versions must also be licensed under CC BY-SA 4.0 or other required licensing for specific projects.

e. **Public domain videos:** Contributions that are public domain must be confirmed under the applicable laws, and the appropriate labeling must be applied.

Feel free to reach out if you have any inquiries about these terms.



264
Original Question: "Does Wikipedia promise to address cases of fraud?"

New Questions:
a. "Is there a commitment from the online gaming community to handle instances of cheating?"
b. "Does the social media platform ensure that it will deal with cases of harassment?"
c. "Is there an assurance from the e-commerce website to respond to reports of fraudulent transactions?"
d. "Does the blogging network guarantee that it will take action against plagiarism?"

Contracts Corresponding to New Questions:
a. Contract: The online gaming community has the primary responsibility for creating rules and enforcing guidelines to maintain fair play. While the platform administrators may seldom interfere in community matters regarding rule enforcement, they reserve the right, though not the obligation, to investigate reports of cheating that significantly disturb the gaming environment or jeopardize user safety. In such instances, the community members may take preventive measures against identified cheats. Users found violating these rules may have their access restricted or be banned from participating in the community.

b. Contract: The social media platform strives to foster a safe and inclusive environment for all users. In rare situations, when serious harassment cases arise, the platform maintains the authority to act decisively. This includes the ability to investigate user interactions and implement measures against users whose behaviors breach the community's guidelines. While the platform typically relies on the community to address such issues, it reserves the right to intervene if necessary, including disabling accounts of those who engage in harassment, while upholding the principle of allowing good faith criticism.

c. Contract: The e-commerce website emphasizes the importance of trust and security within its marketplace. Users are encouraged to report any fraudulent transactions, and the platform commits to investigating such incidents. In extraordinary circumstances, where significant fraud is detected, the website may take appropriate action, including disabling accounts related to fraudulent activities, and reporting to law enforcement authorities if required. Users engaging in fraud are subject to penalties outlined in the website's Terms of Service.

d. Contract: The blogging network is dedicated to maintaining intellectual integrity and original content creation. It has set policies to identify and mitigate plagiarism instances. In cases where users are reported for plagiaristic actions, the platform has the right, though not the obligation, to investigate these claims, take necessary actions, including warning or blocking accounts of repeat offenders, while respecting the rights to creative expression and good faith sharing of ideas.



265
Original Question: "Does Wikipedia undertake to take action with respect to instances of fraud?"

New Questions:
a. "Does the online forum commit to addressing cases of harassment among its members?"
b. "Is the social media platform obligated to respond to reports of misinformation shared by its users?"
c. "Will the gaming community take measures against players who cheat in the competition?"
d. "Does the blogging site promise to investigate allegations of copyright infringement made by its users?"

New Contract:
The online forum has the primary responsibility to create and enforce policies pertaining to user conduct. In exceptional circumstances, the forum may feel the need to intervene in user decisions regarding conduct enforcement. In such cases, the forum reserves the right, but is not obligated, to:
(a) Investigate user activity to determine whether violations of the Terms of Service, community policy, or other applicable laws have occurred;
(b) Detect, prevent, or address issues related to harassment, security, or respond to user support requests;
(c) Restrict access to any user who violates these Terms of Service;
(d) Ban any individual from participating or engaging on the platform due to actions that violate the Terms of Service;
(e) Take necessary legal action against users violating these Terms of Service.

In the interest of maintaining community safety, any individual whose access has been restricted is prohibited from creating or using another account unless explicit permission is granted. This includes actions benign in nature that align with good-faith criticism but do not violate these Terms of Service.

Community members are empowered to act within the framework of established policies, which may include warning, investigation, blocking, or banning users violating those policies. Users agree to comply with the decisions of dispute resolution bodies established for the community, which might result in sanctions as outlined in those policies.

Problematic users who have faced restrictions across various community aspects may face comprehensive bans. The enforcement of such bans will adhere to the community’s established policies and regulatory measures.



266
Original Question: "Does Wikimedia often get involved in policy decisions?"

New Questions:
a. "Does the Open Source Foundation frequently intervene in community-led project governance?"
b. "Does the Collaborative Network typically engage in shaping rules for community interaction?"
c. "Does the Digital Commons Initiative regularly participate in setting guidelines for platform content?"
d. "Does the Community Association often interfere with user policy implementations in joint projects?"

New Contracts:
1. Contract for a. 
   The Open Source Foundation has a limited role in governing project policies created and enforced by the community members. In exceptional cases where community policies require intervention, the Foundation may choose to:
   a) Assess the necessity of regulatory action based on significant community disruption or user behavior concerns.
   b) Investigate any potential violations of project terms or applicable laws.
   c) Take necessary steps to manage user contributions in line with established policies, including issuing warnings or prohibiting further engagement.
   
2. Contract for b. 
   The Collaborative Network underscores the intent that community members play a primary role in governance and decision-making. The Network may step in under certain circumstances where:
   a) Community decisions lead to notable disruptions, prompting a review of user actions.
   b) Appropriate measures are taken to enforce community standards and practices.
   c) Recommendations for further changes are made in alignment with user feedback to improve policy enforcement.

3. Contract for c. 
   The Digital Commons Initiative aims to support community development of guidelines and practices for content contribution. The Initiative retains the option to:
   a) Conduct inquiries into any compliance issues related to content contributions.
   b) Implement strategies to prevent fraud, security issues, and technical problems.
   c) Provide mechanisms for conflict resolution and enforce decisions made by community-established bodies.

4. Contract for d. 
   The Community Association's primary purpose lies in promoting sustainable interaction among users while overseeing adherence to projects’ guidelines. In instances of significant conflict or policy violation, the Association may choose to:
   a) Investigate actions that disrupt community harmony or violate established norms.
   b) Approve sanctions as determined by the community, including temporary or permanent access restrictions.
   c) Protect the integrity and purpose of community efforts in accordance with the broader objectives of the associated projects.

269
Original Question: "Can residents of Illinois take legal action against Wikipedia in Illinois courts?"
New Questions:
a. "Are individuals from New York permitted to file lawsuits against a nonprofit organization in courts located in New York?"
b. "Can users in Texas initiate legal proceedings against an online service in Texas courts?"
c. "Is it possible for citizens of Florida to pursue legal claims against a tech company in Florida's judicial system?"
d. "Can consumers in Ohio bring a legal case against an educational platform in the courts of Ohio?" 

Contracts corresponding to each new question:

a. **Contract for New Question 1**:
   "If you seek to file a legal claim against us, you agree to file and resolve it exclusively in a state or federal court located in New York. You also agree that the laws of the State of New York and, to the extent applicable, the laws of the United States of America will govern these Terms of Use, as well as any legal claim that might arise between you and us. You agree to submit to the personal jurisdiction of, and agree that venue is proper in, the courts located in New York in any legal action or proceeding relating to us or these Terms of Use."

b. **Contract for New Question 2**:
   "If you wish to take legal action against us, you must do so exclusively in a court of competent jurisdiction in Texas. You agree that the laws of the State of Texas and, where applicable, the laws of the United States of America will govern these Terms of Use, including any claims arising between you and us. You further agree to submit to the personal jurisdiction of the courts in Texas for any legal action related to these Terms."

c. **Contract for New Question 3**:
   "Should you decide to pursue a legal case against us, you agree to do so in a state or federal court located in Florida. The laws of the State of Florida and, applicable federal laws of the United States will govern these Terms of Use and any related claims. You also consent to personal jurisdiction and venue being proper in Florida courts for actions concerning these Terms."

d. **Contract for New Question 4**:
   "If you are considering legal action against us, you agree to initiate proceedings exclusively in the courts of Ohio. The laws of the State of Ohio and, where applicable, the laws of the United States, shall govern these Terms of Use, alongside any claims that arise. You consent to personal jurisdiction and venue in the state courts of Ohio for any related legal action."



270
Original Question: "If people legally become adults at age 20 in my country, can I use Shopify when I'm only 18?"

New Questions:
a. "In a country where the legal drinking age is 21, can I enter a bar when I'm 19 years old?"
b. "If the legal age for voting in my region is 18, is it possible for me to vote if I turn 18 the day after the elections?"
c. "In a state where you must be 25 to rent a car, can I rent a car at the age of 22?"
d. "If a student must be at least 16 to drive a car in my country, can I start learning to drive at the age of 15?"

### New Contracts:
1. **New Contract for New Question a:**
   1. You must provide valid identification proving your age when entering the bar.
   2. The establishment reserves the right to refuse entry based on age verification.
   3. You confirm that you are entering the bar for the purpose of social activities and not for unlawful purposes.
   4. The bar will communicate with you via the contact details you provided upon entry, and you must ensure these details are up to date.
   5. You are responsible for your behavior and must comply with all local laws regarding alcohol consumption.
   6. The bar is not liable for any personal consequences resulting from your failure to adhere to age restrictions.

2. **New Contract for New Question b:**
   1. You must have a valid identification to show proof of your age when you go to vote.
   2. The electoral office reserves the right to challenge your eligibility based on age.
   3. You acknowledge that you are voting for legitimate civic purposes and not for fraudulent reasons.
   4. All communications regarding your voting record will be sent to the email address you registered with the electoral office.
   5. You are responsible for ensuring you are informed about the voting process and any changes to your eligibility.
   6. The electoral office cannot be held liable for any issues stemming from your failure to register your age accurately.

3. **New Contract for New Question c:**
   1. You must present valid identification showing you meet the minimum age requirement when renting the vehicle.
   2. The rental company has the right to refuse service if you do not meet their age criteria.
   3. You agree to use the rental vehicle solely for lawful purposes and will not engage in illegal activities during the rental period.
   4. Communication regarding your rental agreement will be sent to the contact information you provided at the time of rental.
   5. You are responsible for all charges and consequences arising from your rental, including accidents or violations of rental policies.
   6. The rental company is not liable for any issues stemming from your failure to comply with their age policies.

4. **New Contract for New Question d:**
   1. You must have a valid learner's permit or identification to begin your driving lessons.
   2. The driving school reserves the right to refuse services if you do not meet the minimum age required by law.
   3. You acknowledge that you are seeking driving instruction solely for the purpose of becoming a qualified driver.
   4. The driving school will communicate with you through the contact information you have provided, and you must ensure it is accurate.
   5. You are responsible for your conduct during lessons and must comply with all traffic regulations.
   6. The driving school is not liable for any incidents that arise from your participation in driving lessons if you do not adhere to the age requirements.

Contract for New Questions:
1. To access and use the Services, you must register for an account (Account) by providing your full legal name, current address, phone number, a valid email address, and any other information indicated as required. The Service Provider may reject your application for an Account, or cancel an existing Account, for any reason, in their sole discretion.
2. You must be the older of: (i) 18 years, or (ii) at least the age of majority in the jurisdiction where you reside and from which you use the Services to open an Account.
3. You confirm that you are receiving any Services provided for the purposes of carrying on a business activity and not for any personal, household or family purpose.
4. You acknowledge that the provider will use the email address you provide on opening an Account or as updated by you from time to time as the primary method for communication with you. You must monitor the primary Account email address you provide and it must be capable of both sending and receiving messages. Your email communications can only be authenticated if they come from your primary Account email address.
5. You are responsible for keeping your password secure. The Service Provider cannot and will not be liable for any loss or damage resulting from your failure to maintain the security of your Account and password.
6. You are responsible for all activity and content such as photos, images, videos, graphics, written content, audio files, code, information, or data uploaded, collected, generated, stored, displayed, distributed, transmitted, or exhibited on or in connection with your Account (Materials).
7. A breach or violation of any term in the Terms of Service may result in an immediate termination of your Services, as determined by the Service Provider in their sole discretion.

1. VideoShare reserves the right to review and moderate content uploaded to our platform to ensure it meets community standards and does not contain harmful material. We may remove any content that violates our terms without notice.

2. ArtGallery maintains the right to assess all artwork submissions and will not publish works deemed to contain offensive or inappropriate material. Failure to comply will result in removal from the gallery.

3. MusicStream acknowledges the importance of maintaining a respectful content library and reserves the right to review and remove any track with explicit lyrics or harmful messages prior to its availability to users.

4. BookPublisher reserves the right to screen all manuscript submissions for harmful or sensitive content. Submissions that contravene our guidelines may be rejected or removed from consideration.



275
Original Question: "Does Shopify review content prior to its being made publicly available in order to ensure that it is not harmful?"

New Questions:
a. "Does an online marketplace evaluate listings before they are published to make sure they comply with safety standards?"
b. "Does a social media platform screen posts before they are shared to ensure they do not contain hate speech?"
c. "Does a video-sharing service inspect uploaded videos prior to their release to confirm they are not inappropriate?"
d. "Does a crowdfunding site check project descriptions before they go live to make certain they do not mislead potential backers?"

Contract for New Questions:
1. We reserve the right to evaluate listings, posts, or content for compliance with our guidelines and safety standards before they are made publicly available.
2. We reserve the right to deny the publication of any content for any reason, including but not limited to, concerns about the safety and appropriateness of the material.
3. We may, but are not obligated to, remove any listings, posts, or videos that we determine violate our policies or community standards at our sole discretion.
4. Any form of abuse towards users or employees of our service will lead to immediate suspension or termination of accounts.
5. We do not pre-screen content and retain the right to remove any materials that do not meet our guidelines, including those uploaded to our platform.
6. We reserve the right to offer our services in competitive markets without any promise of exclusivity, and we acknowledge that our employees may also be users of our platform.
7. In the case of disputes regarding content ownership, we reserve the right to request documentation to ascertain or affirm ownership, which may include legal business licenses, identification, or payment information.
8. We maintain the discretion to determine rightful ownership of any content and may temporarily suspend access to the service pending resolution of ownership disputes between parties involved.



276
Original Question: "By uploading content on Shopify services, do I give up my IP rights in that content?"

New Questions:
a. "If I share my photos on a social media platform, do I lose my copyright over those photos?"
b. "When I publish a blog post on a free blogging website, do I forfeit my ownership rights to that post?"
c. "If I submit my music to a streaming service, am I relinquishing my intellectual property rights to my songs?"
d. "By posting my artwork on an online gallery, do I surrender my rights to the artwork I've created?"

Contracts corresponding to the new questions:

a. Contract for social media platform:
1. You retain all copyright and intellectual property rights to the photos you share on our platform. 
2. By sharing your photos, you grant us a non-exclusive, worldwide license to use, display, and distribute your photos within the platform. 
3. You may remove your photos at any time, and upon removal, the license you granted us will cease.

b. Contract for blogging website:
1. You maintain full ownership of any blog posts you publish on our platform.
2. By publishing your posts, you grant us a non-exclusive right to display and distribute your content on our site.
3. You may delete your posts at any time, and upon deletion, the rights granted will be terminated.

c. Contract for streaming service:
1. You retain complete ownership of all rights in the music you submit to our service.
2. By submitting your music, you provide us with a limited license to stream and display your works on our platform.
3. You can retract your submission at any time, which will terminate the license given to us for your music.

d. Contract for online gallery:
1. You keep all rights and ownership of the artwork you upload to our online gallery.
2. By uploading, you give us a non-exclusive license to showcase and promote your artwork on our site.
3. You may remove your artwork from our gallery at any time, and the license will expire upon removal.



277
Original Question: "Does Shopify purport to obtain IP rights in content provided to Shopify services?"

New Questions:
a. "Does Amazon claim ownership over photos uploaded by sellers to the Amazon marketplace?"
b. "Does Facebook assert rights over videos shared by users on its platform?"
c. "Does Google intend to acquire intellectual property rights for articles submitted to its blogging service?"
d. "Does YouTube suggest that it has rights to music uploaded by creators on its site?"

Contract for Generated Questions:
1. We do not claim any intellectual property rights over the content you provide to the Amazon marketplace. All content you upload remains yours. You can remove your seller account at any time.
2. By uploading content, you agree: (a) to allow other users to view the content you post publicly to your seller page; (b) to allow Amazon to store, and in the case of content you post publicly, display and use your content; and (c) that Amazon can, at any time, review and delete all the content submitted to its services, although Amazon is not obligated to do so.
3. You retain ownership over all content that you upload to the marketplace; however, by making your seller page public, you agree to allow others to view content that you post publicly. You are responsible for compliance of the content with any applicable laws or regulations.
4. Amazon shall have the non-exclusive right and license to use the names, trademarks, service marks and logos associated with your seller page to promote the service. 

[Repeat the same format for the other new questions, replacing "Amazon" with "Facebook," "Google," and "YouTube," respectively, and modifying the references to the related services accordingly.]



278
Original Question: "Does Shopify provide technical support for theme store designs?"

New Questions:
a. "Does Etsy offer customer support for sellers using their creative templates?"
b. "Can Amazon assist vendors with technical issues related to their product listing layouts?"
c. "Will Squarespace provide help for users facing issues with website design templates?"
d. "Is there technical assistance available from Wix for its website builder themes?" 

Contracts corresponding to the new questions:

a. Contract for Etsy:
1. Sellers using Etsy's creative templates may seek assistance for technical issues directly related to the design of their listings. Etsy provides resources and guidelines for troubleshooting common problems. However, sellers should note that the primary responsibility for managing and optimizing the listings rests with them.
2. Any modifications or customizations made to the templates should comply with Etsy's policies, and sellers must ensure that they do not violate copyright or intellectual property rights of the original template designers.
3. Etsy messages and response times for technical support inquiries may vary, and the platform does not guarantee immediate assistance or resolution of issues.

b. Contract for Amazon:
1. Vendors utilizing Amazon's product listing layouts may report technical issues through the Seller Central support system. Amazon may offer guidance and troubleshooting tips for resolving common layout problems.
2. Vendors are responsible for ensuring that any changes or customizations to their product listings conform to Amazon's policies and guidelines.
3. Amazon does not guarantee support for every aspect of product layout and sellers are encouraged to maintain backups of their listings before making significant changes.

c. Contract for Squarespace:
1. Users of Squarespace design templates can reach out to customer support for assistance with technical problems related to website templates. The support service will provide general guidance and potential solutions.
2. Users must ensure that any custom changes made to their templates comply with Squarespace’s terms of service to avoid any violations.
3. The resolution times for support inquiries may vary based on the complexity of the technical issue.

d. Contract for Wix:
1. Wix users can request technical support for issues related to the website builder themes they are using. Wix aims to provide assistance and troubleshooting guidance for common technical challenges.
2. Users should fully understand and comply with the terms outlined by Wix, particularly in regards to customization that could affect the integrity of the original theme or potential conflicts with Wix's policies.
3. While Wix strives to respond promptly, the timeframe for resolving technical support issues can differ based on the inquiry's nature.



279
Original Question: "Does Shopify agree to provide certain technical support in connection with designs made available through the Theme Store?"

New Questions:
a. "Does WordPress commit to offering specific technical assistance for plugins available through its Plugin Repository?"
b. "Will Wix provide any level of technical support related to templates offered in its Template Gallery?"
c. "Does Squarespace agree to provide technical help for the layouts available in its Design Library?"
d. "Is there a guarantee from Weebly for technical support regarding themes accessible through its Theme Center?"

Contract for New Questions:

1. You may establish the appearance of your WordPress site with a plugin from WordPress's Plugin Repository (a Plugin). If you download a Plugin, you are licensed to use it for a single site only. You are free to transfer a Plugin to a second one of your own sites if you deactivate your first site. To initiate a transfer of a Plugin to a second one of your sites, please contact WordPress Support. You are not permitted to transfer or sell a Plugin to any other person's site on WordPress or elsewhere. Multiple sites require multiple downloads, and each download is subject to the applicable fee. WordPress gives no assurance that a particular Plugin will remain available for additional downloads.  
2. You may modify the Plugin to suit your site. WordPress may add or modify elements in a Plugin that refers to WordPress at its discretion. WordPress may modify the Plugin where it contains, in our sole discretion, an element that violates WordPress's AUP or other provisions of the Terms of Service, even if you received the Plugin in that condition. WordPress may modify the Plugin to reflect technical changes and updates as required.
3. The intellectual property rights of the Plugin remain the property of the designer. If you exceed the rights granted by your purchase of a Plugin, the designer may take legal action against you, and, without prejudice to our other rights or remedies, WordPress may take administrative action such as modifying your site or closing your site.
4. Technical support for a Plugin is the responsibility of the designer, and WordPress accepts no responsibility to provide such support. WordPress may be able to help you contact the designer.
5. It is the responsibility of the user, and not WordPress, to ensure that the installation of a new plugin does not overwrite or damage the current or preexisting plugin, or UI, of the user.

283
Original Question: "Does Shopify generally issue refunds in the event of cancellation of an account?"

New Questions:
a. "In the event of a cancellation of a subscription, does Netflix typically provide refunds to the user?"
b. "Will Amazon issue refunds if a Prime membership is canceled by the user?"
c. "If a customer decides to terminate their membership with a gym, are they entitled to a refund for any unused months?"
d. "Does Adobe offer refunds to users who cancel their Creative Cloud subscription before the billing cycle ends?" 

Contract Corresponding to New Questions:

1. You may cancel your subscription and discontinue the service at any time by contacting customer support and following the specific instructions they provide.

2. Upon termination of the subscription by either party for any reason:
   1. The service provider will cease providing you with the services and you will no longer be able to access your subscription account;
   2. Unless otherwise specified in the subscription agreement, you may not be entitled to any refunds, partial or otherwise;
   3. Any outstanding balance owed for your use of the services up to the cancellation date will become due immediately; and
   4. Your account will be disabled upon cancellation.

3. If you purchased any additional services along with your subscription, upon cancellation, those services may not be automatically renewed. After termination, you will be responsible for managing any related matters with the service provider.

4. If you have outstanding fees at the time of cancellation, you will receive one final invoice via email. After payment of that invoice, your account will be fully settled.

5. The service provider reserves the right to modify or terminate the services, the subscription agreement, and/or your account for any reason, without prior notice, except as required by applicable law. Termination will not affect any rights or obligations that arose before the termination date.

6. Fraud: The service provider may suspend or terminate your account if there is reasonable suspicion that you have engaged in fraudulent behavior concerning the use of the services.

Contract for New Questions:
1. In connection with using or accessing our Services, you will not:
   - transfer your Amazon account (including any associated benefits, Feedback, or user ID) to another party without our consent;
   - share your Etsy account information with others who are not authorized to use it;
   - transfer your gaming account to another player without complying with the platform's user agreement;
   - share your PayPal account credentials with anyone else, as account security is essential to protect your financial information.

2. You must ensure that you maintain the privacy and security of your account, and you should not authorize others to use your account or access your private information. Failure to comply with these requirements may result in account termination or other enforcement actions.



285
Original Question: "According to the agreement, does it ever take longer than 24 hours for a listing to be searchable?"

New Questions:
a. "As per the contract, can it take more than a day for an advertisement to be visible in search results?"
b. "In accordance with the terms, is it possible for a job posting to not be immediately available for browsing within 24 hours?"
c. "Based on the policy, can the activation of a service listing exceed 24 hours before it appears in search results?"
d. "According to the terms, could it take longer than one day for a real estate listing to show up during a property search?"

New Contract for New Questions:
When creating a listing for sale on our platform, you agree to comply with our Listing policies and Selling practices policy and that:

You assume full responsibility for the item offered and the accuracy and content of the listing,
Your listing may not be immediately searchable by keyword or category for several hours (or up to 24 hours in some circumstances). We cannot guarantee exact listing duration,
Your fixed-price listings may renew automatically every calendar month, based on the listing terms at the time, until all quantities sell or the listing is ended by you or our platform, in its sole discretion,
Content that violates any of our policies may be modified, obfuscated, or deleted at our sole discretion,
We may revise product data associated with listings to supplement, remove, or correct information,
We strive to create a marketplace where users find what they are looking for. Therefore, the appearance or placement of listings in search and browse results will depend on a variety of factors, including, but not limited to:
user's location, search query, browsing site, and history;
item's location, listing format, price and shipping cost, terms of service, end time, history, and relevance to the user query;
seller's history, including listing practices, Detailed Seller Ratings, policy compliance, Feedback, and defect rate; and
number of listings matching the user's query,
To drive a positive user experience, a listing may not appear in some search and browse results regardless of the sort order chosen by the user,
Some advanced listing upgrades will only be visible on some of our Services,
Our Duplicate listings Policy may also affect whether your listing appears in search results,
Metatags and URL links that are included in a listing may be removed or altered so as to not affect third-party search engine results,
We may provide you with optional recommendations to consider when creating your listings. Such recommendations may be based on the aggregated sales and performance history of similar sold and current listings; results may vary for individual listings. To drive the recommendations experience, you agree that we may display the sales and performance history of your individual listings to other sellers,
For items listed in certain categories, subject to certain programs, and/or offered or sold at certain price points, we may require the use of certain payment methods, subject to our Payments methods policy. For example, for inventory covered by authentication services, buyers and sellers may be subject to escrow, screening, shipping, and/or payment handling requirements.



286
Original Question: "Pursuant to the agreement, are there circumstances in which a listing may become searchable following a period greater than 24 hours after the creation of such listing?"

New Questions:
a. "According to the terms of the agreement, can a job posting become visible to applicants after a period exceeding 48 hours from its publication?"
b. "Under the conditions of the contract, are there scenarios in which a rental advertisement may be viewable by potential tenants more than 72 hours after it was listed?"
c. "In line with the policy, can a culinary class schedule still be discoverable to students after a timeframe longer than 36 hours from its initial announcement?"
d. "As stipulated in the guidelines, might a product promotion remain unlisted in search results for over 48 hours from the time it was initially created?"

Contract Corresponding to the New Questions:
1. When posting a job advertisement on our platform, you agree to comply with our job listing policies, which include:
   - You assume full responsibility for the job offered and the accuracy and content of the posting.
   - Your job listing may not be immediately visible to applicants for several hours (or up to 48 hours in some circumstances). The platform cannot guarantee exact visibility duration.
   - Your job postings may renew automatically every calendar month based on the listing terms until the position is filled or the listing is ended by you or the platform at its sole discretion.
   - Content that violates any of our policies may be modified, obfuscated, or deleted at the platform's sole discretion.
   - We may revise job data associated with postings to supplement, remove, or correct information.
   - We strive to create a marketplace where job seekers find opportunities. Therefore, the visibility or placement of postings in search and browse results will depend on various factors, including, but not limited to:
     - applicant's location, search query, browsing history;
     - job's location, listing format, compensation, and relevance to the user query;
     - employer's history and compliance with the platform's posting practices;
     - number of job listings matching the applicant's query.
   - To foster a positive user experience, a posting may not appear in some search and browse results regardless of the sort order chosen by the applicant.
   - Certain listing upgrades may only be visible on some of our services.
   - Our Duplicate postings Policy may also affect whether your listing appears in search results.
   - We may provide optional recommendations for posting jobs based on the aggregated sales and performance history of similar postings; results may vary for individual listings. You agree that we may display the performance history of your individual postings to other employers, to assist with the recommendations experience. 
   - For job postings in specific categories or price ranges, the platform may require the use of certain payment methods, subject to our Payment methods policy.

Original Question: "Does eBay promise that the product data it provides will be somewhat accurate?"

New Questions:
a. "Does Amazon guarantee that the information it offers about products will be at least partially correct?"
b. "Is there an assurance from Google that the search results it delivers will be somewhat reliable?"
c. "Does Facebook commit to maintaining accuracy in the content that is shared on its platform?"
d. "Can you expect Etsy to ensure that the details it supplies regarding listings will be somewhat precise?"

Contract Corresponding to New Questions:

1. **Amazon Contract**: When you provide content using Amazon’s Services (directly or indirectly), you grant Amazon a non-exclusive, worldwide, perpetual, irrevocable, royalty-free, sublicensable (through multiple tiers) right to exercise any and all Intellectual Property Rights you have in that content in connection with their provision, expansion, and promotion of their Services, in any media known now or developed in the future. To the fullest extent permitted under applicable law, you waive your right to enforce your Intellectual Property Rights in that content against Amazon, their assignees, their sublicensees, and their assignees in connection with Amazon’s, those assignees’, and those sublicensees’ use of that content in connection with their provision, expansion, and promotion of their Services.

2. **Google Contract**: By using our Services to provide content, you grant Google a non-exclusive, worldwide, perpetual, irrevocable, royalty-free, sublicensable (through multiple tiers) right to exercise any and all Intellectual Property Rights you have in that content related to the usage, expansion, and promotion of the Services, in any media now or developed in the future. To the fullest extent permitted under applicable law, you waive your right to enforce these rights against Google and its partners concerning their use of your content.

3. **Facebook Contract**: When you share content on Facebook, you grant Facebook a non-exclusive, worldwide, perpetual, irrevocable, royalty-free, sublicensable right to use any and all Intellectual Property Rights you have in that content in the provision, expansion, and promotion of their Services in any form of media now or developed in the future. You understand that Facebook does not guarantee the absolute accuracy of user-generated content.

4. **Etsy Contract**: When you publish listings on Etsy, you provide Etsy a non-exclusive, worldwide, perpetual, irrevocable, royalty-free, sublicensable right to use your content related to the promotion of their Services. You acknowledge and agree that Etsy does not ensure the accuracy or completeness of any product information provided by third parties and may modify or revoke permissions at any time.



288
Original Question: "Does eBay guarantee a certain level of accuracy with respect to the product data it provides?"

New Questions:
a. "Does Amazon ensure the reliability of the product descriptions it lists on its platform?"
b. "Does Etsy promise any specific standard of precision regarding the artwork images provided by sellers?"
c. "Does Walmart offer any assurance concerning the correctness of the nutritional information on its private label products?"
d. "Does Shopify provide guarantees about the accuracy of customer data shared within its app?"

Contract for New Questions:
1. Amazon Contract: When you provide content using our Services (directly or indirectly), you grant us a non-exclusive, worldwide, perpetual, irrevocable, royalty-free, sublicensable right to use your content in connection with our services, promotional efforts, and expansion. You affirm that you own or control all necessary rights to the content you provide and that it does not violate any third-party intellectual property rights. Amazon will not be held liable for any inaccuracies or liabilities arising from the product descriptions provided by users.

2. Etsy Contract: When you submit creative content to our platform, you provide us a non-exclusive, worldwide, perpetual, irrevocable license to use that content manage, promote, and expand our services. You guarantee that you have proper ownership rights over your content, ensuring it does not infringe on any third-party intellectual property. Etsy cannot guarantee the accuracy or reliability of product images and descriptions listed by its users.

3. Walmart Contract: By providing product information to our services, you grant Walmart a non-exclusive, perpetual, and worldwide license to use that data for the operation of our business, including selling and marketing our products. You represent that you own the rights to the information you provide and that it does not violate any third-party intellectual property. Walmart does not guarantee the accuracy of nutritional information provided on its products.

4. Shopify Contract: When utilizing our platform, you grant us a non-exclusive and worldwide right to use your provided data in accordance with our services and promotional efforts. You represent that you control all necessary rights and ensure that such data does not violate any third-party rights. Shopify disclaims any responsibility for inaccuracies in the customer data shared within its app.



289
Original Question: "Does eBay decide who has to pay the costs of going to arbitration?"

New Questions:
a. "Does Amazon determine who bears the costs associated with arbitration?"
b. "Is it up to Netflix to decide who is responsible for the fees related to the arbitration process?"
c. "Does Google have the authority to decide who pays the arbitration costs?"
d. "Does Uber specify who is liable for the expenses incurred during arbitration?"

### New Contracts Corresponding to New Questions:

1. **Amazon Contract: Costs of Arbitration**
   "Payment of all filing, administration, and arbitrator fees will be governed by Amazon's rules. If you comply with the Notice of Dispute procedures and the value of the relief sought is $10,000 or less, Amazon will cover all administration and arbitrator fees associated with the arbitration upon your request. Any request for payment of fees should be submitted to Amazon along with your Demand for Arbitration, and Amazon will arrange to pay the fees directly to the arbitration provider."

2. **Netflix Contract: Costs of Arbitration**
   "All mediation and arbitration costs, including filing and administrative fees, will be managed by Netflix according to their dispute resolution policies. In cases where the claim is $10,000 or less, Netflix agrees to pay all administrative and arbitration fees once notified through a proper Notice of Dispute. Such notice must accompany your Demand for Arbitration, allowing Netflix to handle all related costs directly."

3. **Google Contract: Costs of Arbitration**
   "The allocation of filing and arbitration costs shall follow Google's specified guidelines. If a dispute involves a claim of $10,000 or less and you have complied with the Notice of Dispute requirements, Google will handle the administration and arbitrator costs. Claims for cost reimbursement must be submitted with your arbitration initiation notice for Google's prompt action."

4. **Uber Contract: Costs of Arbitration**
   "Uber stipulates that all filing, administrative, and arbitration costs will adhere to the company's regulations. In instances where claims do not exceed $10,000, Uber will assume responsibility for all associated costs if you have followed the Notice of Dispute process. Requests for reimbursement of these costs must be included in your Demand for Arbitration."



290
Original Question: "Is eBay entitled to decide which party pays the costs of arbitration?"

New Questions:
a. "Can Amazon determine which party bears the fees for mediation?"
b. "Is Uber allowed to decide which party is responsible for the expenses of arbitration?"
c. "Does Alibaba have the authority to dictate which party pays for the costs related to arbitration?"
d. "Is it within the rights of Netflix to specify who pays the arbitration fees?"

Contracts for New Questions:

**Contract for Question a:**
1. Costs of Mediation
Payment of all filing, administration, and mediator fees will be governed by the applicable mediation rules. If you complied with the Notice of Dispute procedures and the value of the relief sought is $10,000 or less, at your request, Amazon will pay all administration and mediator fees associated with the mediation. Any request for payment of fees by Amazon should be submitted by mail to the mediation service along with your Demand for Mediation, and Amazon will arrange to pay the fees directly.

**Contract for Question b:**
1. Costs of Arbitration
All filing, administration, and arbitration fees will be governed by the arbitration service's rules, unless otherwise specified. If you satisfactorily followed the Notice of Dispute guidelines, and the claim amount is $10,000 or less, upon your request, Uber will cover all relevant administration and arbitration fees for the arbitration. Requests for fee payments by Uber should be submitted with your Request for Arbitration.

**Contract for Question c:**
1. Costs of Arbitration
The expenses related to filing, administration, and arbitration will be governed by the rules set forth by the arbitration service provider. If the proper Notice of Dispute procedures were adhered to and the claim value is $10,000 or below, Alibaba will pay all associated administration and arbitration fees upon your request. You must include your request for fee coverage alongside your Demand for Arbitration.

**Contract for Question d:**
1. Costs of Arbitration
Payment responsibilities for all arbitration-related fees, including filing and administrative fees, will align with the governing rules of the arbitration association. If you have completed the Notice of Dispute process and your claim is for $10,000 or less, Netflix will cover all arbitration fees if you make an official request. This request must accompany your Arbitration Demand.
