**Contract: Acceptance of Terms for App Sharing**
The services that XYZ Apps provides to you are subject to the following Terms of Use ("TOU"). XYZ Apps reserves the right to update the TOU at any time without notice to you. The most current version of the TOU can be reviewed by clicking on the "Terms of Use" hypertext link located at the bottom of our app pages.

**Description of Services**
Through its network of app properties, XYZ Apps provides you with access to various resources, including application downloads, support forums, and product information (collectively "Services"). The Services, including any updates, enhancements, new features, and/or the addition of any new app properties, are subject to the TOU.

**Personal and Non-Commercial Use Limitation**
Unless otherwise specified, the Services are for your personal and non-commercial use. You may not modify, copy, distribute, transmit, display, perform, reproduce, publish, license, create derivative works from, transfer, or sell any application, software, products or services obtained from the Services.

**Privacy and Protection of Personal Information**
See the Privacy Statement disclosures relating to the collection and use of your information.

**Notice Specific to Applications Available on this Website**
Any application that is made available to download from the Services ("Application") is the copyrighted work of XYZ Apps and/or its suppliers. Use of the Application is governed by the terms of the end user license agreement, if any, which accompanies or is included with the Application ("License Agreement"). An end user will be unable to install any Application that is accompanied by or includes a License Agreement unless they first agree to the License Agreement terms.

The Application is made available for download solely for use by end users according to the License Agreement. Any reproduction or redistribution of the Application not in accordance with the License Agreement is expressly prohibited by law, and may result in civil and criminal penalties. Violators will be prosecuted to the maximum extent possible.

The Application is warranted, if at all, only according to the terms of the License Agreement. Except as warranted in the License Agreement, XYZ Apps hereby disclaims all warranties and conditions with regard to the Application, including all warranties and conditions of merchantability, whether express, implied or statutory, fitness for a particular purpose, title and non-infringement. For your convenience, XYZ Apps may make available as part of the Services or in its Application products, tools and utilities for use and/or download. XYZ Apps does not make any assurances regarding the accuracy of the results or output that derives from such use of any such tools and utilities. Please respect the intellectual property rights of others when using the tools and utilities made available on the Services or in XYZ Apps products.

**RESTRICTED RIGHTS LEGEND.** Any Application which is downloaded from the Services for or on behalf of the United States of America, its agencies and/or instrumentalities ("U.S. Government"), is provided with Restricted Rights. Use, duplication, or disclosure by the U.S. Government is subject to restrictions as set forth in subparagraph (c)(1)(ii) of the Rights in Technical Data and Computer Software clause at DFARS 252.227-7013 or subparagraphs (c)(1) and (2) of the Commercial Computer Software - Restricted Rights at 48 CFR 52.227-19, as applicable. 293
Original Question: "Are schools prohibited from providing students in class with Microsoft FAQs and similar documents?"

New Questions:
a. "Is it forbidden for universities to distribute educational videos and materials to students during lectures?"
b. "Can libraries restrict access to public domain ebooks for their patrons in reading groups?"
c. "Are non-profit organizations allowed to share instructional handouts and brochures at community workshops?"
d. "Do community centers need special permission to give out recipe cards and cooking tips to participants in cooking classes?"

Contracts corresponding to the new questions:

a. Permission to use Educational Materials in Classrooms
Permission to use educational materials, such as videos and instructional guides, in a classroom setting is granted to accredited institutions, provided that (1) proper attribution is given to the source, (2) materials are used strictly for educational and non-commercial purposes, and (3) the original content remains unaltered. Use of these materials outside the classroom context requires express written permission. Unauthorized use is prohibited and may lead to legal implications.

b. Guidelines for Library Access to Public Domain Ebooks
Public libraries are encouraged to grant access to public domain ebooks to their patrons. Libraries must ensure that materials are provided in a manner that respects copyright laws and does not involve any restrictions on personal use. Any redistribution or commercial use of these ebooks without permission is strictly prohibited and eligible for penalties.

c. Sharing Instructional Handouts at Community Workshops
Non-profit organizations are permitted to distribute instructional handouts and brochures during community workshops, provided that (1) materials are for non-commercial use, (2) the source is credited, and (3) no modifications are made. Any distribution of these materials in a different context requires prior written approval. Violators may face legal repercussions.

d. Community Center Guidelines for Recipe Distribution
Community centers are allowed to share recipe cards and cooking tips with participants in cooking classes, as long as (1) the recipes are intended for personal use, (2) proper attribution to authors is maintained, and (3) the content remains unchanged. Any publication or broader distribution without written consent from the original authors is strictly against policy and may have legal consequences.

Original Question: "Can I use the Microsoft forums to run a survey?"

New Questions:
a. "Is it permissible to utilize the Google groups to conduct a poll?"
b. "Can I execute a questionnaire on the Facebook community pages?"
c. "Am I allowed to carry out a survey on the Reddit discussion boards?"
d. "Is it acceptable to perform a survey using the LinkedIn professional groups?"  

**Contract for New Questions:**

**Use of Services for Surveys and Polls**

The Services may contain features such as discussion forums, groups, chat rooms, and other communication platforms designed to enable you to connect with users (each a "Communication Service" and collectively "Communication Services"). You agree that when utilizing the Communication Services, you will not:

1. Utilize the Communication Services to solicit participation in surveys, polls, or contests unless expressly permitted by the specific Communication Service.
2. Publish or share any content related to surveys or polls that may mislead or misrepresent information to participants.
3. Engage in any activity related to surveys or polls that may infringe upon the rights of others or violate any legal guidelines or ethical standards.
4. Collect personal data from participants without their explicit consent when conducting surveys or polls through the Communication Services.
5. Disrupt or hinder the use of the Communication Services for other users, including using the platforms primarily for survey-related activities that interfere with regular communication.

Microsoft has the right to monitor, review, and remove materials related to surveys or polls in its sole discretion, and reserves the authority to terminate your access to any or all of the Communication Services that do not comply with these terms. Always exercise caution when soliciting information from others, ensuring compliance with applicable laws and regulations regarding data collection and privacy.

   Use the Communication Services in connection with contests, surveys, pyramid schemes, chain letters, junk email, spamming or any duplicative or unsolicited messages (commercial or otherwise).
   
   Defame, abuse, harass, stalk, threaten or otherwise violate the legal rights (such as rights of privacy and publicity) of others.
   
   Publish, post, upload, distribute or disseminate any inappropriate, profane, defamatory, obscene, indecent or unlawful topic, name, material or information.
   
   Advertise or offer to sell or buy any goods or services for any business purpose, unless such Communication Services specifically allows such messages.

   Use the Communication Services for advertising or conducting promotional activities aimed at gathering personal information or soliciting responses.

**Adjusted Contracts for New Questions:**

1. **Contract for Question a:**
   Use of Forums and Discussion Boards  
   The forums and discussion boards provided may include features designed to enable users to post questions, comments, and communicate with others (each a "Forum" and collectively "Forums"). You agree to use the Forums only to post, send, and receive messages that are relevant and appropriate to the specific Forum. You agree that when using the Forums, you will not:  
   - Engage in any activity that disrupts or interferes with the forums' operation.
   - Post any content that violates the rights of others.  
   Google reserves the right to monitor, review, and remove any content at its discretion and to terminate your access to any or all Forums for any reason without prior notice. Always exercise caution when sharing personal information.  

---

2. **Contract for Question b:**
   Use of Groups and Events  
   The Groups and Events functionalities allow users to interact and share information (each a "Group" and collectively "Groups"). You agree to use Groups responsibly and make sure your contributions adhere to the guidelines set forth. You will not:  
   - Post material that is harmful or misleading.
   - Use the Groups to harass or defame others.  
   Facebook reserves the right to manage content and activities within the Groups and can remove any post that does not comply with its community standards or terminate access at any time without notice.  

---

3. **Contract for Question c:**
   Use of Messaging and Communication Services  
   The messaging and communication tools offered, like iMessage and FaceTime, are designed to facilitate safe and effective communication among users. You agree to adhere to the usage guidelines, ensuring that your messages comply with applicable laws. You will not:  
   - Engage in the dissemination of spam or violate user privacy.  
   Apple reserves the right to oversee the communication platforms and has the discretion to remove any inappropriate content or terminate access at any time. It is recommended to protect your personal information when using these services.  

---

4. **Contract for Question d:**
   Use of Customer Review and Q&A Sections  
   The customer review and Q&A platform offers a space for buyers to engage and share feedback (each a "Review Section" and collectively "Review Sections"). You agree to use these platforms to provide honest and relevant feedback. You will not:  
   - Post fraudulent or misleading reviews.
   - Engage in deceptive practices that could misinform other users.  
   Amazon reserves the right to monitor these sections and can remove any content or restrict access to users who violate the established guidelines at any time without notice. Exercise caution when submitting personal information in these public forums.

Contract for New Questions:
**Contract: Feedback and Suggestions Provided to [Company Name]**

[Company Name] does not claim ownership of the feedback and suggestions you provide to [Company Name] or post, upload, input, or submit for review by the general public, or by members of any public or private community (each a "Submission" and collectively "Submissions"). However, by posting, uploading, inputting, providing, or submitting ("Posting") your Submission, you are granting [Company Name], its affiliated companies, and necessary sublicensees permission to use your Submission in connection with the operation of their Internet businesses, including, without limitation, all [Company Name] Services, including, without limitation, the license rights to: copy, distribute, transmit, publicly display, publicly perform, reproduce, edit, translate, and reformat your Submission; to publish your name in connection with your Submission; and the right to sublicense such rights to any supplier of the Services.

No compensation will be paid with respect to the use of your Submission, as provided herein. [Company Name] is under no obligation to post or use any Submission you may provide, and [Company Name] may remove any Submission at any time in its sole discretion.

By Posting a Submission, you warrant and represent that you own or otherwise control all the rights to your Submission as described in these Terms of Use including, without limitation, all the rights necessary for you to provide, post, upload, input, or submit the Submissions. 

In addition to the warranty and representation set forth above, by Posting a Submission that contains images, photographs, pictures, or that are otherwise graphical in whole or in part ("Images"), you warrant and represent that (a) you are the copyright owner of such Images, or that the copyright owner of such Images has granted you permission to use such Images or any content and/or images contained in such Images consistent with the manner and purpose of your use and as otherwise permitted by these Terms of Use and the Services, (b) you have the rights necessary to grant the licenses and sublicenses described in these Terms of Use, and (c) that each person depicted in such Images has provided consent to the use of the Images as set forth in these Terms of Use, including, by way of example, and not as a limitation, the distribution, public display, and reproduction of such Images. By Posting Images, you are granting permission to (a) all members of your private community for Images available to members of such private community, and/or (b) the general public for Images available anywhere on the Services, other than a private community, to use your Images in connection with the use, as permitted by these Terms of Use, of any of the Services. The licenses granted for Images will terminate when you completely remove such Images from the Services, provided that, such termination shall not affect any licenses granted in conjunction with such Images before the complete removal. No compensation will be paid regarding the use of your Images.

"APPLE OR ANY OF ITS EMPLOYEES DO NOT ACCEPT OR CONSIDER UNSOLICITED IDEAS, INCLUDING IDEAS FOR NEW ADVERTISING CAMPAIGNS, NEW PRODUCTS, OR TECHNOLOGIES. PLEASE DO NOT SEND ANY ORIGINAL WORKS. THE SOLE PURPOSE OF THIS POLICY IS TO AVOID POTENTIAL MISUNDERSTANDINGS OR DISPUTES."

b. **Contract**: Unsolicited Idea Submission Policy for Google
"GOOGLE OR ANY OF ITS EMPLOYEES DO NOT ACCEPT OR CONSIDER UNSOLICITED IDEAS, INCLUDING IDEAS FOR NEW PRODUCTS, SERVICES, OR TECHNOLOGIES. PLEASE DO NOT SEND ANY ORIGINAL CONTENT. THIS POLICY IS IN PLACE TO AVOID MISUNDERSTANDINGS."

c. **Contract**: Unsolicited Idea Submission Policy for Facebook
"FACEBOOK OR ANY OF ITS EMPLOYEES DO NOT ACCEPT OR CONSIDER UNSOLICITED IDEAS, INCLUDING DESIGN PROPOSALS OR MARKETING PLANS. PLEASE REFRAIN FROM SENDING ORIGINAL WORKS. THIS POLICY AIMS TO PREVENT MISUNDERSTANDINGS."

d. **Contract**: Unsolicited Idea Submission Policy for Amazon
"AMAZON OR ANY OF ITS EMPLOYEES DO NOT ACCEPT OR CONSIDER UNSOLICITED IDEAS, INCLUDING BUSINESS STRATEGIES OR INNOVATIONS. PLEASE DO NOT SHARE ORIGINAL CONTENT. THIS POLICY IS DESIGNED TO AVOID POTENTIAL DISPUTES."

These AUP Guidelines provide to you a personal, revocable, limited, non-exclusive, and non-transferable license to use the Service conditioned upon your continued compliance with these AUP Guidelines. [Company Name] reserves all rights not granted in the AUP Guidelines.

YOUR CONTENT & YOUR PERMISSIONS
When you use our Service, you provide us with things like your files, content, messages, etc. (Your Content). Your Content is yours. You represent that you have all necessary right, power, and authority to use the Service and share Your Content and will comply with all applicable laws when doing so. These AUP Guidelines don't give us any rights to Your Content except for the limited rights that enable us to offer the Service. We need your permission to do things like host Your Content, back it up, or share it when you ask us to. This permission extends to our trusted third parties we work with. You therefore give us, and third parties (with whom we work) permission to use, display, host, share, and back up Your Content. By submitting Your Content, you also permit us to identify you by your username and as the contributor of Your Content.

Coursera's Acceptable Use Policy (AUP) governs the access and use of their services by individual users. By utilizing our services, you are agreeing to abide by the AUP guidelines as well as review Coursera's Privacy Policy regarding the handling of personally identifiable information. Coursera reserves the right to modify these policies, and it is your responsibility to stay updated with the changes. A violation of the AUP may result in the termination of access to Coursera services.

**Dropbox Acceptable Use Policy**  
The Dropbox Acceptable Use Policy explains how Dropbox handles user data, including file backups. Users must comply with this AUP to use the service. By using Dropbox, you consent to the data handling practices described in the Privacy Policy. Dropbox reserves the right to perform necessary backups of user data and may update its policies periodically.

**Facebook Data Policy**  
Facebook's Data Policy outlines the terms for managing user content and data. Users agree to this policy by engaging with Facebook’s services. It specifies that Facebook may perform automatic backups of user content without seeking individual permission, provided users comply with the service’s guidelines.

**Steam User Agreement**  
The Steam User Agreement sets forth the terms for using the Steam platform, including data management and privacy. By using the service, users acknowledge that Steam may create backups of user data as necessary without additional consent. This agreement is subject to changes, and users should remain aware of the current policies.

You retain all rights to your artwork, and the gallery will not claim ownership. Visit our policy page for more details on artwork submissions.

2. **Contract for question b:**

   Users of the product review site may submit their feedback without revealing their identities. By posting a review, you agree to do so anonymously. The website ensures that personal data will not be shared with third parties without your consent. You are responsible for ensuring that your review complies with applicable laws. For further details, please refer to our review policy.

   Users are granted the right to submit comments on our forum anonymously. By participating, you agree to maintain your anonymity unless you choose to disclose your identity. The forum management commits to protecting your personal information and will not disclose any identifying details without your explicit permission. For more information, refer to our privacy guidelines.

4. **Contract for question d:**

   Participants in our events are allowed to provide feedback without revealing their names. By submitting your feedback, you consent to remain anonymous. The event organizers will protect your identity and ensure that your feedback is collected and analyzed without any personal identifiers. Please review our feedback collection policy for additional information.



306
Original Question: "Am I allowed to scrape data on the services for a research project I'm doing?"

New Questions:
a. "Can I gather public posts from social media platforms for a study I'm conducting?"
b. "Is it permissible for me to collect user reviews from a website for my thesis?"
c. "Am I allowed to extract product information from an online store for my market analysis?"
d. "Can I harvest comments from a forum for a paper I am writing on public opinion?"

New Contracts:
1. **Sharing Your Research Findings**
   Our Service allows you to share your research findings, but please be sure to do so ethically and legally. By using the Service, you agree to follow these guidelines and not misuse the Service or assist anyone else in doing so. This includes, but is not limited to, not engaging in the following in connection with the Service:
   - Storing, transmitting, or creating non-compliant content that violates privacy, copyright, or other legal protections.
   - Modifying, translating, adapting, or creating derivative works of any data collected without proper authorization.
   - Harassing, threatening, or impersonating any individual while conducting your research.
   - Using automated systems or software to extract data in a way that disrupts the functionality of the Service.
   - Attempting to gain unauthorized access to any user-generated content or data on the Service.
   - Introducing harmful software or code that might compromise the Security of the Service.
   - Violating the law in connection with data collection, including any form of infringement or unauthorized distribution of content.

2. **Guidelines for Ethical Data Collection**
   If you wish to collect data from our Service for your research, you must ensure it is done in accordance with ethical standards and applicable laws. This includes:
   - Avoiding the collection of sensitive or personally identifiable information without consent.
   - Not disrupting the normal operations of the Service during data collection efforts.
   - Citing sources properly if you intend to publish your findings.
   - Not sharing data in a manner that could harm individuals or entities involved in the data set.



307
Original Question: "Does Instructure permit the scraping of its data for academic or other research purposes?"

New Questions:
a. "Is it allowed for researchers to collect data from Facebook for the purpose of academic studies?"
b. "Can students use web scraping to gather information from Wikipedia in order to conduct research projects?"
c. "Does Google provide permission for developers to extract search result data for analytical purposes?"
d. "Are there any restrictions on extracting data from LinkedIn for personal use or professional research?"  

Contracts corresponding to the new questions:

a. **Contract: DATA USE AND RESEARCH**
Research conducted using Facebook's services must comply with the following guidelines:
- Ensure that you respect user privacy and data protections when collecting public information.
- Avoid automated systems that may disrupt the functionality of the platform.
- Obtain permission where necessary and adhere to Facebook's API use policy.
- Use the data solely for academic purposes and ensure proper attribution.
- Do not collect data that breaches Facebook's community standards or terms of service.

b. **Contract: WIKIPEDIA DATA ACCESS**
When utilizing Wikipedia for research purposes, users must adhere to the following terms:
- Information obtained must be acknowledged and referenced appropriately.
- Respect the copyrights and licensing agreements associated with Wikipedia content.
- Scraping tools should be utilized responsibly, and operations must not degrade the site's performance.
- Ensure that collected data does not compromise the integrity and user experience of Wikipedia.

c. **Contract: GOOGLE DATA UTILIZATION**
Accessing Google search results for analytical purposes involves agreeing to these terms:
- Research must not violate Google's terms of service or automated data collection policies.
- Ensure that any extracted data is used in a manner that respects intellectual property and copyright laws.
- Usage of data must be for legitimate analytical purposes without intention of monopolization or competitive disadvantage.
- Provide credit to Google when presenting findings based on its search data.

d. **Contract: LINKEDIN DATA EXTRACTION**
LinkedIn user data may only be accessed under the following conditions:
- Information collected for personal use or professional research must comply with LinkedIn's terms of service.
- Scraping must not disrupt the service or violate user privacy settings.
- Proper attribution must be given when using data derived from LinkedIn.
- The data collected must not be sold, repackaged, or used for commercial gain without express permission from LinkedIn.

Contract for New Questions:
OUR PROPERTY
The Platform is protected by copyright, trademark, and other US and foreign laws. These Guidelines don’t grant you any right, title, or interest in the Platform or any content on it. We value your feedback, but please be aware that we may use your comments or suggestions without any obligation to you.

INFRINGEMENT
We honor the intellectual property of others and expect you to do the same. We will address notices of suspected infringement upon receipt of a proper notice that adheres to the law and is received by our designated representative. We reserve the right to remove or disable access to content alleged to infringe and to terminate accounts of individuals who repeatedly violate these terms. If you think that any content on the Platform may constitute infringement, please provide our designated representative with the following information:
1. An electronic or physical signature of the person authorized to act on behalf of the rights owner;
2. A description of the content you believe is infringing;
3. A description or link to the specific location of the material you claim is infringing;
4. Your physical address, telephone number, and email address;
5. A statement asserting that you have a good faith belief that the content is unauthorized by the rights owner, its agent, or the law;
6. A statement made under penalty of perjury affirming that the information stated in your notice is accurate and that you are the owner or authorized to act on behalf of the owner.
Contact information for our designated representative for notice of claims of infringement is as follows: General Counsel; 6330 South 3000 East, Suite 700, Salt Lake City, UT 84121; legal@instructure.com. We may also take appropriate action if we receive a valid counter-notice under the law.



311
Original Question: "In the event a user suspects that certain content is in breach of the applicable guidelines and wishes to report such content, is it sufficient that such user describe the content, provide a link to the content and provide their personal and contact details?"

If an employee suspects a violation of company policies, they must provide a clear and detailed description of the alleged violation. They are also required to include any relevant evidence and their contact information to facilitate further investigation. The company assures that complaints will be treated confidentially and will be investigated promptly.

b. CONTRACT: PRODUCT SAFETY COMPLAINTS
Customers who wish to report safety concerns about a product must submit a detailed description of the issue, including any evidence and a clear identification of the product in question. Furthermore, customers are required to provide their personal contact information. All complaints will be addressed in accordance with applicable regulations.

c. CONTRACT: ACADEMIC INTEGRITY REPORTING
Students who believe they have witnessed academic dishonesty must submit a report containing a comprehensive explanation of the incident and any supporting documentation. Their report should also include their contact details for any follow-up. The institution ensures that such reports are handled with utmost seriousness and confidentiality.

d. CONTRACT: COMMUNITY RULES ENFORCEMENT
Participants of the online forum who suspect that a post violates community guidelines must submit a report that describes the alleged violation in detail, including a direct link to the content. Additionally, they need to provide their username and contact information for follow-up purposes. All reports will be reviewed in accordance with forum rules and privacy standards.

**GOVERNING LAW**
These Terms and Conditions and your use of the Service will be interpreted, governed, and construed by the laws of [State Name] except for its conflicts of laws principles, unless otherwise agreed in a separate written agreement with [Company Name] or as required by a mandatory law of a competent jurisdiction.

**ENTIRE AGREEMENT**
These Terms and Conditions set forth terms governing your use of the Service and supersede and replace any other prior or contemporaneous agreements applicable to the subject matter of these Terms and Conditions. These Terms and Conditions create no third-party beneficiary rights. These Terms and Conditions shall inure to the benefit of [Company Name] and its respective legal representatives, successors, and assigns.

**WAIVER, SEVERABILITY & ASSIGNMENT**
[Company Name]'s failure to enforce a provision is not a waiver of its right to do so later. You may not assign any of your rights under these Terms and Conditions, and any such attempt will be void. [Company Name] may assign its rights to any of its affiliates or subsidiaries or to any successor in interest of any business associated with the Service. If any provision of these Terms and Conditions is held by a court of competent jurisdiction to be contrary to law, such provision shall be changed and interpreted so as to best accomplish the objectives of the original provision to the fullest extent allowed by law, and the remaining provisions of these Terms and Conditions will remain in full force and effect.

**MODIFICATIONS**
We may revise these Terms and Conditions from time to time and will always post the most current version HERE. If a revision meaningfully reduces your rights, we will provide notice to you (by, for example, sending a message to the email address associated with your account). By continuing to use or access the Service after the revisions come into effect, you agree to be bound by and subject to the revised Terms and Conditions.

**NOTICES**
For any notices relating to these Terms and Conditions, you may contact [Company Name] by sending an email to [legal@example.com].

317
Original Question: "If my parents (who I live with) have a Netflix subscription, can I still get a free trial?"

New Questions:
a. "If my roommates already have a Spotify subscription, can I still sign up for a free trial of Spotify?"
b. "If my siblings are subscribed to an online gaming service, can I still access a free trial period for that service?"
c. "If my family has a Hulu account, am I still eligible for a free trial on my own Hulu account?"
d. "If my friends are currently using a food delivery service, can I still initiate a free trial for their platform?"

Contracts corresponding to the new questions:

**Contract for Question a: Spotify Membership**

1. Membership

1.1. Your Spotify membership will continue until terminated. To use the Spotify service, you must have Internet access and a Spotify ready device, and provide us with one or more Payment Methods. Payment Method means a current, valid, accepted method of payment, as may be updated from time to time. Unless you cancel your membership before your billing date, you authorize us to charge the membership fee for the next billing cycle to your Payment Method.

1.2. We may offer a number of membership plans, including special promotional plans or memberships offered by third parties. We are not responsible for the products and services provided by such third parties. Some membership plans may have differing conditions and limitations, which will be disclosed at your sign-up or in other communications made available to you. You can find specific details regarding your Spotify membership by visiting our website.

2. Free Trials

2.1. Your Spotify membership may start with a free trial. The duration of the free trial period of your membership will be specified during sign-up and is intended to allow new members and certain former members to try the service.

2.2. Free trial eligibility is determined by Spotify at its sole discretion and we may limit eligibility or duration to prevent free trial abuse. We reserve the right to revoke the free trial and put your account on hold in the event that we determine that you are not eligible. Members of households with an existing Spotify membership are not eligible. 

2.3. We will charge the membership fee for the next billing cycle to your Payment Method at the end of the free trial period unless you cancel your membership prior to the end of the free trial period.

---

**Contract for Question b: Online Gaming Membership**

1. Membership

1.1. Your gaming membership will continue until terminated. To use the gaming service, you must have Internet access and a gaming-ready device, and provide us with one or more Payment Methods. Payment Method means a current, valid, accepted method of payment.

1.2. We may offer various membership plans, including promotional memberships offered by third parties. We are not responsible for the products and services provided by such third parties. Some membership plans may have differing conditions and limitations, which will be disclosed at your sign-up. You can find specific details regarding your membership by visiting our website.

2. Free Trials

2.1. Your gaming membership may start with a free trial. The duration of the free trial period will be specified during sign-up and is intended to allow new members to try the service.

2.2. Free trial eligibility is determined by our service at its sole discretion and may limit eligibility or duration to prevent free trial abuse. Members of households with an existing gaming membership are not eligible. 

2.3. We will charge the membership fee for the next billing cycle at the end of the free trial period unless you cancel your membership prior to the end of the free trial period.

---

**Contract for Question c: Hulu Membership**

1. Membership

1.1. Your Hulu membership will continue until terminated. To use the Hulu service, you must have Internet access and a Hulu ready device, and provide us with one or more Payment Methods. Payment Method means a current, valid, accepted method of payment.

1.2. We may offer a number of membership plans, including promotional plans offered by third parties. We are not responsible for the products and services provided by such third parties. 

2. Free Trials

2.1. Your Hulu membership may start with a free trial. The duration of the free trial will be specified during sign-up.

2.2. Free trial eligibility is at Hulu's discretion, and we reserve the right to limit access to prevent abuse.

2.3. At the end of the free trial, your Payment Method will be charged unless you cancel beforehand.

---

**Contract for Question d: Food Delivery Service Membership**

1. Membership

1.1. Your food delivery service membership will continue until terminated. To use the service, you must have access to the internet and a compatible device, and provide us with one or more Payment Methods.

1.2. We may offer various plans, including promotional options. We are not responsible for third-party services offered alongside our memberships.

2. Free Trials

2.1. Your membership may begin with a free trial, intended for new and certain former members.

2.2. Eligibility for a free trial is determined solely by us, and restrictions may apply to prevent misuse.

2.3. Charges will apply at the end of the trial period unless canceled beforehand.

319
Original Question: "Is the length of the billing cycle period the same for all Netflix subscribers?"

New Questions:
a. "Is the duration of the subscription period uniform for all Spotify users?"
b. "Do all Amazon Prime members have the same delivery schedule for their subscriptions?"
c. "Is the billing frequency identical for every user of Hulu's streaming service?"
d. "Are the payment cycles consistent for all users of Disney+ subscriptions?" 

Contract:
3. Billing and Cancellation

3.1. Billing Cycle. The membership fee for the Spotify service and any other charges you may incur in connection with your use of the service, such as taxes and possible transaction fees, will be charged to your Payment Method on the specific billing date indicated on your "Account" page. The length of your billing cycle will depend on the type of subscription that you choose when you sign-up for the service. In some cases, your payment date may change, for example, if your Payment Method has not successfully settled or if your paid membership began on a day not contained in a given month. Visit our website and click on the "Billing details" link on the "Account" page to see your next payment date. We may authorize your Payment Method in anticipation of membership or service-related charges through various methods, including authorizing it for up to approximately one month of service as soon as you register. In some instances, your available balance or credit limit may be reduced to reflect the authorization during your free trial period.

3.2. Payment Methods. To use the Spotify service, you must provide one or more Payment Methods. You authorize us to charge any Payment Method associated with your account in case your primary Payment Method is declined or no longer available to us for payment of your subscription fee. You remain responsible for any uncollected amounts. If a payment is not successfully settled, due to expiration, insufficient funds, or otherwise, and you do not cancel your account, we may suspend your access to the service until we have successfully charged a valid Payment Method. For some Payment Methods, the issuer may charge you certain fees, such as foreign transaction fees or other fees relating to the processing of your Payment Method. Local tax charges may vary depending on the Payment Method used. Check with your Payment Method service provider for details.

3.3. Updating your Payment Methods. You can update your Payment Methods by going to the "Account" page. We may also update your Payment Methods using information provided by the payment service providers. Following any update, you authorize us to continue to charge the applicable Payment Method(s).

3.4. Cancellation. You can cancel your Spotify membership at any time, and you will continue to have access to the Spotify service through the end of your billing period. To the extent permitted by the applicable law, payments are non-refundable and we do not provide refunds or credits for any partial membership periods or unwatched Spotify content. To cancel, go to the "Account" page and follow the instructions for cancellation. If you cancel your membership, your account will automatically close at the end of your current billing period. To see when your account will close, click "Billing details" on the "Account" page. If you signed up for Spotify using your account with a third party as a Payment Method and wish to cancel your Spotify membership, you may need to do so through such third party, for example by visiting your account with the applicable third party and turning off auto-renew, or unsubscribing from the Spotify service through that third party. You may also find billing information about your Spotify membership by visiting your account with the applicable third party.

3.5. Changes to the Price and Subscription Plans. We may change our subscription plans and the price of our service from time to time; however, any price changes or changes to your subscription plans will apply no earlier than 30 days following notice to you.

Contract for New Questions:

**3. Billing and Cancellation**

**3.1. Billing Cycle.** The membership fee for the Spotify service and any other charges you may incur in connection with your use of the service, such as taxes and possible transaction fees, will be charged to your Payment Method on the specific billing date indicated on your "Account" page. The length of your billing cycle will depend on the type of subscription that you choose when you sign up for the service. In some cases, your payment date may change, for example, if your Payment Method has not successfully settled or if your paid membership began on a day not contained in a given month. Visit our website and click on the "Billing details" link on the "Account" page to see your next payment date. We may authorize your Payment Method in anticipation of membership or service-related charges through various methods, including authorizing it for up to approximately one month of service as soon as you register. In some instances, your available balance or credit limit may be reduced to reflect the authorization during your trial period.

**3.2. Payment Methods.** To use the Spotify service you must provide one or more Payment Methods. You authorize us to charge any Payment Method associated with your account in case your primary Payment Method is declined or no longer available to us for payment of your subscription fee. You remain responsible for any uncollected amounts. If a payment is not successfully settled, due to expiration, insufficient funds, or otherwise, and you do not cancel your account, we may suspend your access to the service until we have successfully charged a valid Payment Method. For some Payment Methods, the issuer may charge you certain fees, such as foreign transaction fees or other fees relating to the processing of your Payment Method. Local tax charges may vary depending on the Payment Method used. Check with your Payment Method service provider for details.

**3.3. Updating your Payment Methods.** You can update your Payment Methods by going to the "Account" page. We may also update your Payment Methods using information provided by the payment service providers. Following any update, you authorize us to continue to charge the applicable Payment Method(s).

**3.4. Cancellation.** You can cancel your Spotify membership at any time, and you will continue to have access to the Spotify service through the end of your billing period. To the extent permitted by the applicable law, payments are non-refundable and we do not provide refunds or credits for any partial membership periods or unwatched content. To cancel, go to the "Account" page and follow the instructions for cancellation. If you cancel your membership, your account will automatically close at the end of your current billing period. To see when your account will close, click "Billing details" on the "Account" page. If you signed up for Spotify using your account with a third party as a Payment Method and wish to cancel your membership, you may need to do so through such third party, for example by visiting your account with the applicable third party and turning off auto-renew or unsubscribing from the service through that third party. You may also find billing information about your membership by visiting your account with the applicable third party.

**3.5. Changes to the Price and Subscription Plans.** We may change our subscription plans and the price of our service from time to time; however, any price changes or changes to your subscription plans will apply no earlier than 30 days following notice to you.



321
Original Question: "If I signed up for Netflix in Country A, can I do 90% of my Netflix watching in Country B?"

New Questions:
a. "If I registered for an online gaming service in Country X, am I allowed to play 90% of my games while in Country Y?"
b. "If I subscribed to a music streaming service in Country M, can I access 90% of my playlist while traveling in Country N?"
c. "If I created an account for a digital photo storage service in Country J, will I be able to view 90% of my uploaded photos while in Country K?"
d. "If I joined a fitness app based in Country R, can I track 90% of my workouts from a location in Country S?"

**Generated Contracts for New Questions:**

**Contract for Question a: Online Gaming Service**
1. You must be of legal age or have parental consent to register for the online gaming service.
2. The gaming service is for your personal use and should not be shared with individuals outside your household.
3. You may access the gaming content primarily within the country you registered and only in regions where the service is available.
4. You agree not to use the service for public displays or distribute gaming content without authorization.
5. You may not bypass content access restrictions based on your location, nor may you engage in malicious activities that disrupt the service.
6. The quality of the gaming experience may vary depending on your internet connection and device capabilities.

**Contract for Question b: Music Streaming Service**
1. You need to be of legal age or have parental consent to subscribe to the music streaming service.
2. Content accessed through the service is intended for personal use only and must not be shared outside your household.
3. You are required to stream music primarily within the country of your subscription and may face restrictions when accessing from other locations.
4. You agree not to reproduce or distribute the music content available through the service.
5. The streaming quality may depend on your internet capabilities and device used to access the service.

**Contract for Question c: Digital Photo Storage Service**
1. You must be of legal age or have parental consent to create an account with the digital photo storage service.
2. The service allows for personal use of stored photos and sharing is limited to individuals within your household.
3. Photos may primarily be accessed within the country of sign-up, with potential limitations in other regions.
4. You agree to not reproduce, distribute, or publicly display any photos without proper authorization.
5. Accessing photos may require a stable internet connection, with variability in display quality based on device and connection strength.

**Contract for Question d: Fitness App**
1. You must be of legal age or have parental consent to create an account on the fitness app platform.
2. The app’s functionalities are intended for personal use and should not be shared with individuals outside your household.
3. You may interact with the app primarily within the country of registration, with potential limitations in other countries.
4. You agree not to share or distribute any workout data from the app without explicit permission.
5. The performance of the app may vary based on your internet connection and device compatibility.



322
Original Question: "Are Netflix users permitted to watch the overwhelming majority of Netflix content they consume in a country other than that in which they subscribed for Netflix services?"

New Questions:
a. "Can YouTube users access most of the videos they have saved in a different country than the one where they created their account?"
b. "Are Spotify subscribers allowed to stream the majority of their playlists while traveling outside the country where they signed up for the service?"
c. "Do Hulu members have the right to view the bulk of their selected shows while located in a foreign country that is not their account's registration country?"
d. "May Amazon Prime Video users watch their saved films in a different nation from the one in which they activated their Prime membership?" 

Contracts for New Questions:

1. **YouTube Service Contract**:
   - You must be at least 13 years of age to use YouTube, or the minimum age applicable in your country. Users under the age of 18 should have parental permission.
   - You may view YouTube content primarily in the country where you have established your account and only in regions where YouTube offers its service.

2. **Spotify Service Contract**:
   - You must be at least 13 years old or the legal age of majority in your country to use Spotify. Users under the age of 18 need the consent of a parent or guardian.
   - Spotify content is to be accessed primarily within the country of your registered account and only where Spotify has content rights available.

3. **Hulu Service Contract**:
   - To become a Hulu user, you must be 18 years of age or older, or have parental permission if you are under 18.
   - You may access Hulu content primarily in the country where your account is registered and in regions where Hulu is operational.

4. **Amazon Prime Video Service Contract**:
   - You must be at least 18 years old to register for Amazon Prime Video or have permission from a parent or guardian if underage.
   - You may generally access Prime Video content in the country where your account is established and only in regions where Amazon Prime Video is offered.

**(A) Governing Terms.** These Terms of Use, along with any additional terms and conditions that are referenced herein or that are presented elsewhere on the Site concerning a specific service or feature and the applicable Privacy Policy, set forth the terms and conditions that apply to your use of the hln.com Site. By using the Site, you agree to comply with all terms and conditions hereof. If you do not agree with these Terms of Use, you should not access or use the Site.

**(B) Changes to Terms of Use.** The organization may modify the Terms of Use, or any part thereof, or add or remove terms at any time, and such modifications, additions, or deletions will be effective immediately upon posting. Your use of the Site after such posting shall be deemed to constitute acceptance by you of such modifications, additions, or deletions.

**(C) Changes to Site.** The organization may change or discontinue any aspect, service, or feature of the Site at any time, including but not limited to content, hours of availability, and equipment needed for access or use.

**(D) Registration.** You may be given the opportunity to register via an online registration form to create a user account ("Your Account") that may allow you to receive information from the organization and/or to participate in certain features on the Site such as Interactive Areas. The organization will use the information you provide in accordance with the Privacy Policy. By registering, you represent and warrant that all information that you provide on the registration form is current, complete, and accurate to the best of your knowledge. You agree to maintain and promptly update your registration information on the Site so that it remains current, complete, and accurate. During the registration process, you may be required to choose a password and/or user name. You acknowledge and agree that the organization may rely on this password or user name to identify you. You shall be responsible for protecting the confidentiality of your user name(s) or password(s), if any. You are responsible for all use of Your Account, regardless of whether you authorized such access or use, and for ensuring that all use of Your Account complies fully with the provisions of these Terms of Use.

**(E) Equipment.** You are responsible for obtaining and maintaining all connectivity, computer software, hardware, and other equipment needed for access to and use of the Site and all charges related to the same.

Original Question: "Is it OK for me to use bots to visit webpages I contribute to so they look more popular?"

**New Contract for the Generated Questions:**

The following terms apply to the use of automated systems or tools to influence the popularity of content on the Site, including, but not limited to, social media platforms and blogging sites:

(A) Automated Interactions. Users may not employ bots, scripts, or other forms of automation to increase the visibility, traffic, or engagement of their User Content on the Site. This conduct may be considered misrepresentation and can lead to penalties, including the removal of content or suspension of accounts.

(B) Integrity of User Content. By participating in any aspect of the Site, you agree that any likes, views, shares, or other forms of engagement with your content must be genuine and obtained through lawful means. Users engage with the Site at the risk of having their content or accounts terminated if found in violation of these terms.

(C) User Responsibility. You acknowledge that you are solely responsible for how your content is perceived and that using unauthorized methods for increasing its popularity undermines trust and credibility. Infringement of these terms may lead to civil liabilities.

(D) Ethical Standards. You agree to maintain ethical standards while interacting with the Site, ensuring that your content reflects integrity and honesty without artificially influencing its reception. Any behavior deemed unethical or deceptive will be subject to repercussions at the discretion of the Site administrators.



325
Original Question: "Does CNN permit using bots to artificially increase page visits for certain content?"

New Questions:
a. "Is it allowed for users to employ automated scripts to boost views on their uploaded videos on the platform?"
b. "Can individuals utilize software to enhance the number of likes on their submitted articles on the website?"
c. "Does the platform allow the use of automated tools to inflate the engagement metrics of user-generated posts?"
d. "Are users permitted to use technology that increases the interaction rates of their blog entries on the site?" 

Corresponding Contract for the New Questions:

The following terms apply to the use of automated systems, bots, or similar technologies in connection with content and engagement metrics on the Site:

(A) Use of Automated Technologies. Users may not use any automated technologies, including bots, scripts, or software, to artificially inflate page views, likes, or engagement of any user-generated content on the Site. Such actions are strictly prohibited and may result in disciplinary actions including account termination. Users are solely responsible for ensuring their content complies with this policy.

(B) Prohibited Conduct. By participating in the Site, users agree not to:
1. Employ any automated system to increase views, likes, shares, or other engagement metrics on any content submitted to the Site.
2. Misrepresent the authenticity of their interaction metrics or performance data.
3. Interfere with the regular functioning of the Site's analytics and engagement tracking systems.

Users found to be in violation of these terms may be banned from future participation on the Site, and they acknowledge that CNN does not endorse any form of manipulation of user-generated content metrics.

Original Question: "Can users retract rights they give to CNN for content they created?"

New Questions:
a. "Are artists able to revoke the permissions they granted to a gallery for exhibiting their artwork?"
b. "Can authors withdraw the licenses they provided to a publisher for their written works?"
c. "Is it possible for filmmakers to cancel the rights they assigned to a distribution company for their films?"
d. "Can photographers retract the usage rights they granted to a magazine for their photographs?"

Contracts:
a. Contract for Artists: 
   "License to Exhibit Artwork. By providing artwork to [Gallery Name], you automatically grant [Gallery Name] the right to exhibit, reproduce, modify, and promote the artwork in any form, media, or technology now known or hereafter developed. This license is perpetual, irrevocable, and non-exclusive. You may not revoke this license for any projects or exhibits that have already been scheduled after submission."

b. Contract for Authors: 
   "License to Publish Written Works. By submitting written works to [Publisher Name], you grant [Publisher Name] the non-exclusive right to publish, distribute, and modify your works globally in any format. This grant is irrevocable, but you acknowledge that you cannot retract it for any copies that have already been printed or distributed prior to your retraction request."

c. Contract for Filmmakers: 
   "License for Distribution. By submitting your film to [Distribution Company Name], you grant [Distribution Company Name] a perpetual and irrevocable license to distribute, promote, and exhibit your film in all media. You cannot retract this license for any scheduled screenings or distributions that occurred prior to your request for retraction."

d. Contract for Photographers: 
   "Usage Rights for Photographs. By submitting photographs to [Magazine Name], you grant [Magazine Name] the right to use, reproduce, and publish your photographs in print and digital format. This license is non-exclusive and irrevocable, and cannot be revoked for any issues or editions that have already been published at the time of your retraction."



327
Original Question: "Do the terms permit users to revoke rights granted to CNN in connection with content created by such users?"

New Questions:
a. "Are users allowed to withdraw the rights granted to the publishing company regarding articles they have contributed?"
b. "Can individuals retract the permissions given to the platform for using the photos they uploaded?"
c. "Is it possible for users to cancel the licensing rights they provided to the video-sharing service for clips they have shared?"
d. "Do the conditions allow users to rescind the rights extended to the network regarding the music they composed and submitted?"

Contracts corresponding to the new questions:

a. License to Contributor Content. By submitting Contributor Content to the publishing company, you automatically grant the company the royalty-free, perpetual, irrevocable, non-exclusive right and license, but not the obligation, to use, publish, reproduce, modify, adapt, edit, translate, create derivative works from, incorporate into other works, distribute, sub-license and otherwise exploit such Contributor Content (in whole or in part) worldwide in any form, media, or technology now known or hereafter developed for the full term of any copyright that may exist in such Contributor Content, without payment to you or to any third parties. Notwithstanding the foregoing, in the event the company licenses your article as stand-alone content outside of the company's programming to third parties unaffiliated with the company, they will pay you a percentage of the license fees they actually receive according to rates determined by their licensing division.

b. License to Uploaded Photos. By uploading photos to the platform, you grant the platform a royalty-free, perpetual, irrevocable, non-exclusive right and license, not limited to the right to use, publish, reproduce, modify, adapt, edit, translate, create derivative works from, distribute, and sub-license the photos (in whole or in part) worldwide in any form, media, or technology now known or developed later without payment to you or any third parties. In the event that the platform licenses your photo to third parties, it will pay you a share of the income according to its policies.

c. Licensing Agreement for Shared Clips. By sharing video clips on the video-sharing service, you automatically grant the service a royalty-free, perpetual, irrevocable, and non-exclusive right and license to use, publish, reproduce, modify, and distribute the content globally. If the service decides to license your clips to third parties for independent use, you will receive a proportionate share of the licensing revenue.

d. Rights Grant for Composed Music. By submitting your composed music to the network, you grant the network a non-exclusive, perpetual, and irrevocable right to use, adapt, modify, and distribute your music worldwide across any media or technology now recognized or developed in the future, without compensation to you unless specified otherwise in subsequent agreements for any commercial use of the music outside the standard broadcasting scope.

Original Question: "Do all disputes with CNN go to arbitration?"

d. "Are any disputes that arise with the e-commerce site Amazon directed to arbitration?" 

Contracts:
10. Governing Law and Venue.
The content, data, video, and all other material and features on the Site are presented for the purpose of providing entertainment, news and/or information and/or promoting programs, films, music, games, and other products and/or services that are or may become available in the United States, its territories, possessions, and protectorates.
Any and all disputes, claims, and controversies arising out of or in connection with your access to, and/or use of the Sites, and/or the provision of content, services, and/or technology on or through the Sites shall be governed by and construed exclusively in accordance with the laws and decisions of the State of California applicable to contracts made, entered into and performed entirely therein, without giving effect to its conflict of laws provisions, except to the extent that law is inconsistent with or preempted by federal law. To the extent that a dispute is not subject to arbitration under Section 12 (Dispute Resolution) of this Agreement, that action shall be brought in the appropriate state or federal court located in Los Angeles County, California; and we both irrevocably consent to the exclusive jurisdiction and venue of the state or federal courts in Los Angeles County, California for the adjudication of all non-arbitral claims.

11. Severability.
Except as specified in Section 12 (Dispute Resolution), if any provision of this Agreement shall be unlawful, void, or for any reason unenforceable, then that provision shall be deemed severable for this Agreement and shall not affect the validity and enforceability of any remaining provisions. This is the entire agreement between the parties relating to the matters contained herein. 

(Note: Repeat the same format for each of the new questions, updating the contracts accordingly to reflect the respective company and location.)



331
Original Question: "Are all disputes between the parties adjudicated by way of arbitration?"

New Questions:
a. "Will all disagreements arising from the agreement be resolved through mediation?"
b. "Do all conflicts between the signatories go through a court trial?"
c. "Are any disagreements related to the terms settled via negotiation?"
d. "Is arbitration the only method for resolving disputes among the involved parties?"


New Contract Corresponding to New Questions:

1. **Mediation Provision**: 
   "Any and all disputes, claims, and controversies arising out of or in connection with your access to, and/or use of the agreement shall be resolved through mediation. Both parties agree to engage in good faith negotiations before pursuing formal proceedings."

2. **Court Trial Provision**: 
   "Any disagreements arising under this agreement shall be resolved through the legal system, with appropriate actions brought in the relevant state or federal courts. Both parties consent to the jurisdiction of these courts for trial proceedings."

3. **Negotiation Clause**: 
   "All conflicts arising in connection with the agreement shall first be addressed through informal negotiation efforts between the parties. Only if these efforts fail shall either party have recourse to legal proceedings."

4. **Dispute Resolution**: 
   "Disputes among the involved parties may be resolved using multiple methods, including arbitration, negotiation, or litigation as deemed appropriate by the parties involved."

If you do not know whether you have reached the age of majority where you live, or do not understand this section, please ask your parent or legal guardian for help. If you are the parent or legal guardian of a minor, you and the minor accept and agree to be bound by these Terms and are responsible for all use of the Google account or Services, including purchases, whether the minor's account is now open or created later."

2. Contract for question b: "Kids and Accounts. By creating a Netflix account or using the Services, you accept and agree to be bound by these Terms and represent that you have either reached the age of majority where you live or your parent or legal guardian agrees to be bound by these Terms on your behalf. If you do not know whether you have reached the age of majority where you live, or do not understand this section, please ask your parent or legal guardian for help. If you are the parent or legal guardian of a minor, you and the minor accept and agree to be bound by these Terms and are responsible for all use of the Netflix account or Services, including purchases, whether the minor's account is now open or created later."

333
Original Question: "Do the terms stipulate a specific age that applies across all jurisdictions above which users do not require parental consent in order to access Microsoft services?"

New Questions:
a. "Do the guidelines specify a universal age threshold beyond which individuals do not need adult approval to use Amazon services?"
b. "Is there a defined age mentioned in the policies that applies globally, allowing users to register for Facebook without needing parental consent?"
c. "Do the regulations indicate a consistent age limit across different countries at which users can sign up for YouTube without parental permission?"
d. "Are there particular age requirements outlined in the terms that universally permit users to create a Snapchat account without the need for guardianship approval?"

### Corresponding Contracts for New Questions:

a. Contract: Amazon Services Agreement. By creating an Amazon account or using the services, you agree to adhere to these terms and confirm that you have reached the necessary age where you live to independently access Amazon services or that your parent or legal guardian consents to these terms on your behalf. If you are uncertain whether you have achieved the required age, please consult your parent or legal guardian. Parents or legal guardians of minors and the minor both agree to these terms and take responsibility for any usage of the Amazon account, including purchases.

b. Contract: Facebook User Agreement. By registering for a Facebook account or utilizing the platform, you accept and bind yourself to these terms and confirm that you have either reached the age of consent established for your area or that your parent or legal guardian has agreed to these terms on your behalf. If you are unsure about your age regarding legal consent, we encourage you to seek advice from your parent or legal guardian. If you are a parent or legal guardian, you acknowledge responsibility for your minor's actions on Facebook.

c. Contract: YouTube Terms of Service. By creating a YouTube account or using the platform, you agree to comply with these terms and represent that you meet the age requirement, allowing you to access YouTube services without needing parental consent, or that your guardian agrees to these terms for you. If you do not know if you meet the age requirement, please consult with a guardian. The parent or legal guardian accepts responsibility for the minor’s use of YouTube and ensures compliance with all regulations concerning the account.

d. Contract: Snapchat Terms and Conditions. By creating a Snapchat account or accessing the service, you agree to these terms and confirm that you have reached the designated age for your jurisdiction that permits you to use Snapchat without parental approval. If you are unsure about the applicable age, you should check with a parent or guardian. Both parents or guardians of minors, and the minors themselves, agree to these terms and are accountable for all actions tied to the Snapchat account.

5. Using Third-Party Apps and Services. The Services may allow you to access or acquire products, services, websites, links, content, material, games, skills, integrations, bots or applications from independent third parties (companies or people who aren't Apple/Sony/Google/Spotify) ("Third-Party Apps and Services"). The Third-Party Apps and Services may allow you to store Your Content or Data with the publisher, provider or operator of the Third-Party Apps and Services. The Third-Party Apps and Services may present you with a privacy policy or require you to accept their terms before you can install or use the Third-Party App or Service. You should review the third-party terms and privacy policies before acquiring, using, requesting, or linking your account to any Third-Party Apps and Services. Any third-party terms do not modify any of these Terms. You are responsible for your dealings with third parties. [Company] does not license any intellectual property to you as part of any Third-Party Apps and Services, and is not responsible or liable to you or others for information or services provided by any Third-Party Apps and Services.

6. Service Availability.
a. The Services, Third-Party Apps and Services, or material or products offered through the Services may be unavailable from time to time, may be offered for a limited time, or may vary depending on your region or device. If you change the location associated with your account, you may need to re-acquire the material or applications that were available to you and paid for in your previous region.
b. We strive to keep the Services up and running; however, all online services suffer occasional disruptions and outages, and [Company] is not liable for any disruption or loss you may suffer as a result. In the event of an outage, you may not be able to retrieve Your Content or Data that you've stored. We recommend that you regularly back up Your Content and Data that you store on the Services or store using Third-Party Apps and Services.

Original Question: "If for some reason Microsoft needs to pay me, will Microsoft take care of the relevant taxes?"

New Questions:
a. "If Apple owes me a refund, will they be responsible for any associated tax obligations?"
b. "In the event that Amazon has to reimburse me, will they handle the necessary tax deductions?"

d. "Should Netflix need to provide me with a compensation, will they take care of any applicable tax requirements?"

Contracts corresponding to the new questions:

**Contract for Question a:**
"Payments to You. If Apple owes you a payment, then you agree to timely and accurately provide them with any information needed to process that payment. Apple is not responsible for any taxes or charges that may arise as a result of this payment to you. You must also comply with any other conditions placed on your right to any payment. If you receive a payment in error, Apple may reverse or require the return of the payment, and you agree to cooperate with them in this process."

**Contract for Question b:**
"Payments to You. If Amazon owes you a refund, you agree to provide them with the necessary information to facilitate that refund. Amazon is not liable for any taxes that might be due as a result of such payment. You are responsible for reporting and paying any taxes incurred from the payment. In the case of an erroneous payment, Amazon may recover the payment and you agree to assist in this process."

**Contract for Question c:**
"Payments to You. If Google is required to pay you, you acknowledge that you must provide accurate and timely information to enable the payment. Google will not assume responsibility for taxes associated with any payments made to you. You will need to manage your own tax obligations. If there is an overpayment, Google reserves the right to reverse the payment upon discovering the error."

**Contract for Question d:**
"Payments to You. If Netflix has to make a payment to you, you agree to provide all necessary details to facilitate such payments promptly. Netflix is not responsible for any tax implications resulting from the payment made to you, and you hold the responsibility for any tax considerations. In the event of an erroneous payment, Netflix may reclaim the funds, and you agree to cooperate with them in this situation."

Original Question: "Does Microsoft agree to pay any applicable taxes arising due to payments that it is required to make to users?"

### New Contracts Corresponding to New Questions:

   - "Payments to Sellers. Amazon will ensure that any payments made to sellers are subject to applicable tax regulations. Amazon may deduct any required taxes from the payment before it is distributed. Sellers are responsible for reporting and paying any taxes due on their earnings."

b. **Contract for Google:** 
   - "Payments to Advertisers. Google agrees to handle relevant tax obligations that may arise from payments made to advertisers. Any applicable taxes will be accounted for within the payment process. Advertisers must ensure compliance with tax regulations in their jurisdiction."

c. **Contract for Apple:** 
   - "Payments to Developers. Apple commits to managing any taxes associated with payments made to app developers. Developers are encouraged to consult with tax professionals regarding any tax liabilities on their income from app sales, as Apple will comply with local tax laws in its payments."

d. **Contract for Facebook:** 
   - "Payments to Content Creators. Facebook will address any applicable tax implications arising from payments to content creators. Any necessary tax deductions will be calculated at the time of payment distribution, and content creators are responsible for reporting these payments in accordance with tax regulations."



338
Original Question: "Is a user required to be logged in to an application in order for Microsoft to download updates for such application?"

New Questions:
a. "Does a user need to be logged into their account for Apple to install updates on their applications?"
b. "Is it necessary for a user to be signed in to a Google Play account for the system to automatically download updates for their apps?"
c. "Must a user be logged into their Adobe account for the company to provide updates on its software products?"
d. "Is a user required to have an active account with Samsung in order for the company to update its mobile applications automatically?"

Contracts for New Questions:

a. Contract for Question a:  
"Apple Application Update Policy" refers to the terms that govern the installation and automatic update of applications on devices owned by Apple. This includes applications available through the App Store. Users may not be required to be logged into their Apple account for updates to be downloaded, as automatic updates can occur in the background, depending on device settings. However, users can manage their update preferences in the settings menu of their device. Users should ensure they have a stable internet connection to facilitate updates.

b. Contract for Question b:  
"Google Play Store Update Terms" refers to the regulations surrounding the download and installation of updates for applications acquired via the Google Play Store. Users are not mandatorily required to be logged into their account for Google to execute the automatic download of updates. Automatic updates are controlled through the settings of the Google Play Store application. Users can opt-in or opt-out of automatic updates at their discretion.

c. Contract for Question c:  
"Adobe Software Update Agreement" denotes the conditions applicable to the automatic installation of updates for Adobe products. Users are generally not required to sign into their Adobe account for software updates to be applied, as updates may be executed automatically based on their settings. Users should keep their accounts active to receive notifications about significant updates and changes.

d. Contract for Question d:  
"Samsung Application Update Agreement" outlines the policies regarding updates for applications sourced from the Galaxy Store. Users typically do not need an active Samsung account for automatic updates to occur, as the functionality may be dependent on device settings. Users can manage their preferences through the settings menu, ensuring updates are facilitated efficiently.

   i. Facebook and Instagram Content. The photos, videos, and other content shared on Facebook and Instagram are for personal use only. Any commercial use, including downloading or redistributing these materials for business purposes, requires express permission from Facebook or rights holders. All rights not expressly granted by these terms remain with Facebook and its affiliates.

   i. Twitter and LinkedIn Materials. Tweets, articles, and content provided on Twitter and LinkedIn are for non-commercial use. Any use of this content for business or commercial purposes must be authorized by Twitter or LinkedIn and may be subject to specific copyright laws. Rights not granted under these terms remain reserved by Twitter and LinkedIn.

All rights not expressly granted remain with Wikipedia and its contributors.

Original Question: "Does NYT check all user content before it's uploaded and posted?"

New Questions:
a. "Does the platform review all user submissions prior to their publication and display?"
b. "Is there a verification process for all user-generated content before it becomes available on the site?"
