New Contract for New Questions:

3. USER GENERATED CONTENT: SUBMISSIONS INCLUDING COMMENTS, READER REVIEWS AND MORE

3.1 If you upload, post or submit any content on the Service, you represent that you have all the necessary legal rights to upload, post or submit such content and it will not violate any law or the rights of any person. You acknowledge that the platform may or may not review user submissions prior to publication. However, you shall not upload, distribute or otherwise publish any libelous, defamatory, obscene, pornographic, abusive, or otherwise illegal material. You shall not impersonate anyone else or otherwise misrepresent your identity, affiliation or status. You agree not to provide material and misleading information knowingly and with intent to defraud. You shall not upload or distribute any malware, viruses, spyware, or other malicious software or files to the Services. You shall not use automated means to upload or distribute content to the Services.

Be courteous. You agree to refrain from threatening or verbally abusing other members, using defamatory language, or disrupting discussions with repetitive or meaningless messages or "spam."

Use respectful language. The online conversation thrives when members feel welcome and safe. You agree not to use language that abuses or discriminates based on race, religion, nationality, gender, sexual preference, age, region, disability, etc. Hate speech of any kind may result in immediate and permanent suspension of access to all or part of the Services.

Debate, but don't attack. Active discussions and heated debates are encouraged, but personal attacks are direct violations of these Terms of Service and may lead to immediate and permanent suspension of access to the Service.

3.2 The Services shall be used only in a noncommercial manner. You shall not distribute or publish any material containing solicitation of funds, advertising, or solicitation for goods or services without the express approval of the platform.

3.3 You acknowledge that any submissions you make to the Services (i.e., user-generated content including but not limited to: comments, forum messages, reviews, text, video, audio, and photographs, as well as computer code and applications) (each, a "Submission") may be edited, removed, modified, published, transmitted, and displayed by the platform, and you waive any rights you may have in having the material altered in a manner not agreeable to you. Submissions may also be included in our RSS feeds and APIs and made available for republishing through other formats.

3.4 You grant the platform a perpetual, nonexclusive, worldwide, royalty-free, sub-licensable license to the Submissions, including the right for the platform, or any third party it designates, to use, copy, transmit, excerpt, publish, distribute, publicly display, publicly perform, communicate to the public, create derivative works of, host, index, cache, tag, encode, modify, and adapt (including the right to adapt to streaming, downloading, broadcast, mobile, digital, and other technologies) in any form or media now known or hereinafter developed, any Submission posted by you.

3.5 You are solely responsible for the content of your Submissions. While the platform does not and cannot review every Submission and is not responsible for the content, it reserves the right to delete, move, or edit Submissions that it deems abusive, defamatory, obscene, in violation of copyright or trademark laws, in violation of these Terms of Service, or otherwise unacceptable.

3.6 By making a Submission, you consent to its display and publication on the Site and in the Services as well as for related online and offline promotional uses.



343
Original Question: "Does NYT review all user-generated content prior to such content being made publicly available?"

New Questions:
a. "Does the news website review all reader comments before they are published on the site?"
b. "Is every social media post checked by the platform for compliance before being visible to other users?"
c. "Do the forum moderators approve all submitted articles before they are accessible to the community?"
d. "Does the online publisher screen all user reviews before they are posted on their product pages?"

### Contracts Corresponding to New Questions

a. **Contract for New Question 1**: 
3.1 You understand that any comments submitted for publication on the website will be subject to review. You agree that the website reserves the right to remove, edit, or refuse to publish any comments at its sole discretion, including those deemed inappropriate or harmful.

b. **Contract for New Question 2**:
3.2 You acknowledge that all social media posts you submit may be reviewed prior to their public posting. The platform retains the right to modify or remove content that does not adhere to community guidelines or that it finds objectionable.

c. **Contract for New Question 3**:
3.3 You agree that articles submitted to the forum will undergo a review process before they become visible to other members. The moderators maintain authority over the publication and may alter or reject submissions based on guidelines.

d. **Contract for New Question 4**:
3.4 You recognize that user reviews submitted on the product pages of the website may be reviewed before being published. The online publisher reserves the right to edit, remove, or refuse publication of any review that violates its standards or policies.

Original Question: "Am I allowed to scrape articles from NYT?"

Contracts for New Questions:

a. Contract for BBC: You may not access or use, or attempt to access or use, the Services to take any action that could harm us or a third party. You may not use the Services in violation of applicable laws or in violation of our or any third party's intellectual property or other proprietary or legal rights. You further agree that you shall not attempt (or encourage or support anyone else's attempt) to circumvent, reverse engineer, decrypt, or otherwise alter or interfere with the Services, or any content thereof, or make any unauthorized use thereof. Without the BBC's prior written consent, you shall not:

(i) access any part of the Services, Content, data, or information you do not have permission or authorization to access;

(ii) use robots, spiders, scripts, services, software, or any manual or automatic device designed to data mine or scrape the Content, data, or information from the Services;

(iii) use any devices or processes designed to circumvent any restriction or technological measure that controls access to the Services;

(iv) cache or archive any Content;

(v) take action that imposes an unreasonable burden on our network; and

(vi) do anything that could damage or change the functioning of the Services.

Engaging in a prohibited use of the Services may result in civil, criminal, and/or administrative penalties.

b. Contract for Wikipedia: You may not access or use, or attempt to access or use, the Services to take any action that could harm us or a third party. You may not use the Services in violation of applicable laws or in violation of our or any third party's intellectual property or other proprietary or legal rights. You further agree that you shall not attempt (or encourage or support anyone else's attempt) to circumvent, reverse engineer, decrypt, or otherwise alter or interfere with the Services, or any content thereof, or make any unauthorized use thereof. Without Wikipedia's prior written consent, you shall not:
 
(i) access any part of the Services, Content, data, or information you do not have permission or authorization to access;
 
(ii) use robots, spiders, scripts, or any tool to scrape data from the Services;

(iii) circumvent restrictions that control access to the Services;

(iv) cache or archive any content;

(v) take any action that imposes an unreasonable load on our infrastructure; and 

(vi) do anything that could harm the functioning of the Services.

Engaging in a prohibited use of the Services may result in penalties.
 
c. Contract for CNN: You may not access or use, or attempt to access or use, the Services to take any action that could harm us or a third party. You may not use the Services in violation of applicable laws or in violation of our or any third party's intellectual property or other proprietary or legal rights. You further agree that you shall not attempt (or encourage or support anyone else's attempt) to circumvent, reverse engineer, decrypt, or otherwise alter or interfere with the Services, or any content thereof, or make any unauthorized use thereof. Without CNN's prior written consent, you shall not:

(i) access any part of the Services, Content, data, or information you do not have permission or authorization to access;

(ii) use automated tools or scripts to scrape content from the Services;

(iii) circumvent any technologies that control access to the Services;

(iv) cache or archive the Content;

(v) take action that imposes disproportionate load on our network; and 

(vi) damage or alter the Services or their presentation.

Engaging in a prohibited use of the Services may lead to significant penalties.

d. Contract for PubMed: You may not access or use, or attempt to access or use, the Services to take any action that could harm us or a third party. You may not use the Services in violation of applicable laws or in violation of our or any third party's intellectual property or other proprietary or legal rights. You further agree that you shall not attempt (or encourage or support anyone else's attempt) to circumvent, reverse engineer, decrypt, or otherwise alter or interfere with the Services, or any content thereof, or make any unauthorized use thereof. Without PubMed's prior written consent, you shall not:

(i) access any data or content for which you do not have proper permission;

(ii) use automated means to extract data from the Services;

(iii) bypass security measures controlling access to the Services;

(iv) cache or archive any materials obtained;

(v) impose excessive load on our system; and 

(vi) cause damage to the functionality of the Services.

Engaging in prohibited usage may result in legal consequences.

**Contract for Question a:**
7. ACCOUNT SHARING AND USAGE

7.1 Users are prohibited from sharing their Spotify account credentials with any third party, including family members, to ensure personal account security and maintain the integrity of subscriptions.

7.2 Each subscription is intended for individual use only. Users who permit others to access their account may face suspension or termination of their service.

7.3 If unauthorized access or sharing of credentials is suspected, users should report it to support@spotify.com for immediate resolution.

7.4 Users are solely responsible for all activities performed on their account, including any access by individuals they have granted permission.

---

**Contract for Question b:**
7. ACCOUNT AND AUTHORIZATION POLICY

7.1 Members of the online learning platform are not permitted to share their login details with anyone, including tutors, to maintain the confidentiality and security of their information.

7.2 Sharing credentials can result in account suspension or termination, as it compromises the integrity of the learning environment.

7.3 Any suspected unauthorized use of an account should be reported to support@learningplatform.com for further investigation.

7.4 Members are held accountable for all activities conducted under their account, including those by any authorized users.

---

**Contract for Question c:**
7. ACCOUNT INTEGRITY PROVISIONS

7.1 Participants of the gaming platform must not disclose their account login information to friends or any third party for collaborative gameplay purposes.

7.2 Sharing account credentials could lead to account suspension and potential loss of game progress or rewards.

7.3 Should users suspect unauthorized access or sharing of their account, they should alert support@gamingplatform.com for assistance.

7.4 Users are responsible for all interactions and activities occurring under their gaming account, inclusive of those permitted by them.

---

**Contract for Question d:**
7. ACCOUNT USAGE POLICY

7.1 Clients of the financial services platform are not allowed to share their account passwords with financial advisors or any third party to ensure the security of their sensitive information.

7.2 Unauthorized sharing of account credentials could result in account suspension or termination due to security breaches.

7.3 Clients should inform support@financialservices.com if they suspect any unauthorized access to their accounts.

7.4 Individuals are fully responsible for all actions carried out on their accounts, including those performed by any authorized third parties.

Original Question: "Can NYT ever charge me without my consent?"

New Questions:
a. "Can a streaming service increase its subscription fees without notifying me first?"
b. "Is it possible for an online marketplace to apply additional charges to my account without receiving prior approval?"
c. "Can a cloud storage provider impose fees for extra data usage without informing me beforehand?"
d. "Is there any way an app developer can start charging for features that were previously free without my agreement?"

Corresponding Contracts for New Questions:

**a. Streaming Service Fees and Payments**
1. We reserve the right to adjust subscription fees for the Services at any time. You will not be charged any increased fees without prior notification and your agreement to said fees. If there are changes to the subscription fee structure, we will provide you with advance notice. You may choose to cancel your subscription at any time before the new fees take effect.

**b. Online Marketplace Fees and Payments**
1. We may introduce additional fees for services within the online marketplace. No fees will be applied to your account without your prior consent. Should we implement any new charges or fees, we will communicate these changes to you in advance. You have the right to cancel your account at any time to avoid incurring these new fees.

**c. Cloud Storage Provider Fees and Payments**
1. The cloud storage service may require payment for exceeding capacity limits. However, no fees will be charged unless we provide prior notification of the applicable charges. If there is a need for charging due to excess usage, we will inform you before any charges are applied. You can terminate your account at any point to avoid future fees.

**d. App Developer Fees and Payments**
1. Our app may introduce in-app purchases or subscription fees as necessary. No charges will be made without your prior consent. Should we choose to start charging for previously free features, we will notify you ahead of time. You can opt to discontinue use of the app if you do not agree with the new fees.

10. TERMINATION

10.1 You may terminate your account at any time by contacting Customer Support at (888) 123-4567 or engaging with Customer Support through our website. For customers outside the U.S., e-mail us at support@onlineservice.com. Upon termination, you will automatically receive a confirmation via e-mail stating that your cancellation has been processed, and access to the service will be suspended within 24 hours. Termination of paid services will adhere to our Cancellation and Refund Policy.

10.2 The Company may, in its sole discretion, terminate or suspend your access to all or part of the Services for any reason, including, without limitation, violation or assignment of these Terms of Service.

11. GOVERNING LAW; JURISDICTION

11.1 These Terms of Service are made and will be construed and enforced in accordance with the laws of the United States of America and the State of California as an agreement wholly performed therein, disregarding any conflict of law provisions.

11.2 Any claim or cause of action arising out of or connected to your use of the Services or these Terms of Service must be filed within one year after such claim or cause of action arose or be forever barred. Any claim by you that may arise in connection with these Terms of Service will be compensable by monetary damages, and you will not be entitled to injunctive or other equitable relief. You further expressly waive any right to pursue any form of class action.

12. MISCELLANEOUS

12.1 These Terms of Service are made in and shall be construed and enforced in accordance with California law. Any action to enforce these Terms of Service shall be brought in the federal or state courts located in San Francisco.

12.2 Nothing in these Terms of Service will override the commitments made in our Privacy Policy.

12.3 Correspondence should be addressed to support@onlineservice.com.

12.4 You agree to report any violations of the Terms of Service to us immediately upon discovering them. If you have a claim of copyright infringement regarding material in a service, please notify copyrights@onlineservice.com. (General inquiries should be directed to support@onlineservice.com.)

12.5 Our failure to enforce any provision of these Terms of Service or to respond to a violation by you or other parties does not waive our right to enforce any terms or conditions subsequently or to act regarding similar violations.

If you are between the ages of 13 and the age of legal majority in your jurisdiction of residence, you may only use the YouTube Services under the supervision of a parent or legal guardian who agrees to be bound by these Terms of Service.

BY DOWNLOADING, INSTALLING, OR OTHERWISE USING THE YOUTUBE SERVICES, YOU REPRESENT THAT YOU ARE AT LEAST 13 YEARS OF AGE, THAT YOUR PARENT OR LEGAL GUARDIAN AGREES TO BE BOUND BY THESE TERMS OF SERVICE IF YOU ARE BETWEEN 13 AND THE AGE OF LEGAL MAJORITY IN YOUR JURISDICTION OF RESIDENCE, AND THAT YOU HAVE NOT BEEN PREVIOUSLY REMOVED FROM AND ARE NOT PROHIBITED FROM RECEIVING THE YOUTUBE SERVICES.

1. You agree not to violate any law, contract, intellectual property, or other third-party right; and that you are solely responsible for your conduct while using the YouTube platform.

You agree that you will comply with these Terms of Service and YouTube's Community Guidelines and will not:

i. create, upload, transmit, distribute, or store any content that is inaccurate, unlawful, infringing, defamatory, obscene, pornographic, invasive of privacy or publicity rights, harassing, threatening, abusive, inflammatory, or otherwise objectionable;

ii. impersonate any person or entity; falsely claim an affiliation with any person or entity; access the YouTube accounts of others without permission; forge another person's digital signature; misrepresent the source, identity, or content of information transmitted via the YouTube platform; or perform any other similar fraudulent activity;

iii. send junk mail or spam to users of the YouTube platform, including unsolicited advertising, promotional materials, or other solicitation material;

iv. harvest or collect email addresses or other contact information of other users from the YouTube platform;

v. defame, harass, abuse, threaten, or defraud users of the YouTube platform;

vi. delete, remove, circumvent, disable, damage, or otherwise interfere with security-related features of the YouTube platform;

vii. reverse engineer, decompile, disassemble, or otherwise attempt to discover the source code of the YouTube platform;

viii. modify, adapt, translate, or create derivative works based upon the YouTube platform, except where expressly permitted by law;

ix. interfere with or damage the operation of the YouTube platform by using malicious code or means;

x. access any website, server, software application, or other computer resource owned, used, and/or licensed by YouTube by means of any automated means;

xi. manipulate identifiers to disguise the origin of any content transmitted through the YouTube platform;

xii. interfere with or disrupt the YouTube platform or its networks, including through the use of a VPN;

xiii. use or attempt to use another user's account without authorization from that user and YouTube;

xiv. attempt to circumvent any content filtering techniques employed by YouTube;

xv. use the YouTube platform for any illegal purpose, or in violation of any local, state, national, or international law or regulation.

2. You agree not to violate any law, contract, intellectual property, or other third-party right; and that you are solely responsible for your conduct while using the cloud storage service.

You agree that you will comply with these Terms of Service and the cloud storage service's Community Guidelines and will not:

i. create, upload, transmit, distribute, or store any content that is inaccurate, unlawful, infringing, defamatory, obscene, pornographic, invasive of privacy or publicity rights, harassing, threatening, abusive, inflammatory, or otherwise objectionable;

ii. impersonate any person or entity; falsely claim an affiliation with any person or entity; access the cloud storage accounts of others without permission; or misrepresent the source, identity, or content of any information transmitted via the cloud storage service;

iii. send junk mail or spam to users of the cloud storage service;

iv. harvest or collect personal information or contact information of users from the cloud storage service;

v. defame, harass, abuse, threaten, or defraud users of the cloud storage service;

vi. delete, remove, circumvent, disable, damage, or otherwise interfere with the security features of the cloud storage service;

vii. reverse engineer, decompile, or otherwise try to uncover the source code of the cloud storage service;

viii. modify, adapt, translate, or create derivative works based on the cloud storage service, except as permitted by law;

ix. use or attempt to use another user's account without authorization from that user and the cloud storage service;

x. engage in any illegal activity or violate local, state, national, or international laws while using the cloud storage service.

3. You agree not to violate any law, contract, intellectual property, or other third-party right; and that you are solely responsible for your conduct while using gaming servers.

You agree that you will comply with these Terms of Service and the gaming server's Community Guidelines and will not:

i. create, upload, transmit, distribute, or store any content that is inaccurate, unlawful, infringing, defamatory, obscene, pornographic, invasive of privacy or publicity rights, harassing, threatening, abusive, inflammatory, or otherwise objectionable;

ii. impersonate any person or entity; or falsely claim an affiliation with any person or entity while playing on the gaming server;

iii. send junk mail or spam to users of the gaming server;

iv. harvest or collect personal information of users;

v. defame, harass, abuse, threaten, or defraud users of the gaming server;

vi. engage in disruptive practices while in gameplay by using malicious code or means;

vii. reverse engineer, decompile, or otherwise try to uncover the source code of the gaming server;

viii. modify or create derivative works based on the gaming server, except as permitted by law;

ix. use the gaming server for illegal purposes or in violation of local, state, national, or international laws.

4. You agree not to violate any law, contract, intellectual property, or other third-party right; and that you are solely responsible for your conduct while participating in online forums.

You agree that you will comply with these Terms of Service and the online forum's Community Guidelines and will not:

i. create, upload, transmit, distribute, or store any content that is inaccurate, unlawful, infringing, defamatory, obscene, pornographic, invasive of privacy or publicity rights, harassing, threatening, abusive, inflammatory, or otherwise objectionable;

ii. impersonate any person or entity while participating in the online forum;

iii. send junk mail or spam to users of the forum;

iv. harvest or collect personal information of users;

v. defame, harass, abuse, threaten, or defraud users of the forum;

vi. engage in disruptive practices by using malicious code or means;

vii. reverse engineer, decompile, or otherwise try to uncover the source code of the online forum;

viii. modify or create derivative works based on the online forum;

ix. use the online forum for illegal purposes or in violation of local, state, national, or international laws.

Original Question: "Does Twitch permit users to upload content to Twitch whilst using VPNs that alter the IP address displayed for such users?"

New Questions:
a. "Is it allowed for Spotify users to share playlists while using proxy servers that change their IP addresses?"
b. "Can users of an online gaming platform stream their gameplay if they are connected to a VPN that masks their actual location?"
c. "Are Facebook users permitted to post updates while accessing their accounts through VPN services that modify their visible IP address?"
d. "Does YouTube allow content creators to upload videos while connected to anonymizing services that alter their internet traffic's origin?"

---
Contract for Each New Question:

a. **Prohibited Conduct for Spotify:**
YOU AGREE NOT TO violate any law, contract, intellectual property, or other third-party right; not to commit a tort, and that you are solely responsible for your conduct while on the Spotify Services. You agree that you will comply with these Terms of Service and Spotify's Community Guidelines and will not:
i. create, upload, transmit, distribute, or store any content that is inaccurate, unlawful, infringing, or otherwise objectionable while using proxy servers.
ii. impersonate any person or entity or misrepresent any affiliations while accessing the Spotify Services via a modified IP address.

b. **Prohibited Conduct for Gaming Platform:**
YOU AGREE NOT TO violate any law, contract, intellectual property, or other third-party right; not to commit a tort, and that you are solely responsible for your conduct while on the Gaming Services. You agree that you will comply with these Terms of Service and the Gaming Community Guidelines and will not:
i. share or stream content that is offensive, illegal, or violates gaming policies while connected to a VPN that alters your location.
ii. impersonate any user or manipulate your account in a deceptive manner while using anonymizing services.

c. **Prohibited Conduct for Facebook:**
YOU AGREE NOT TO violate any law, contract, intellectual property, or other third-party right; not to commit a tort, and that you are solely responsible for your conduct while on the Facebook Services. You agree to comply with these Terms of Service and Facebook's Community Guidelines and will not:
i. post content that is misleading or violates privacy rights while using VPNs to alter your IP address.
ii. misrepresent your identity while engaging with others on the Facebook platform through modified IP means.

d. **Prohibited Conduct for YouTube:**
YOU AGREE NOT TO violate any law, contract, intellectual property, or other third-party right; not to commit a tort, and that you are solely responsible for your conduct while on the YouTube Services. You agree to comply with these Terms of Service and YouTube's Community Guidelines and will not:
i. upload or publish content that violates copyright or community standards while using VPN services.
ii. impersonate any creator or distort your user identity while using tools that change your visible IP address.

Original Question: "Does streaming Twitch Sings require me to install a special app (in addition to the ordinary Twitch app)?"

New Questions:
a. "Is there a need to download a specific application to play Fortnite besides the regular Epic Games launcher?"
b. "Do I have to install additional software for live streaming on YouTube, apart from the standard YouTube app?"
c. "Will I need to use a particular application to stream music on Spotify other than the basic Spotify app?"
d. "Is it necessary to set up a different app to host VR gaming sessions on the Oculus platform besides the main Oculus app?"

### Corresponding Contracts:
**Contract for Question a:**

Epic Games, Inc. ("Epic") offers Fortnite as part of its gaming services. Fortnite is available as a free-to-play battle royale game. Users can play Fortnite by using both the Epic Games launcher and the game client for their respective platforms. 

To fully enjoy the game, players must ensure that the Epic Games launcher is installed. This launcher allows access to Fortnite and other Epic games, ensuring that all updates and required files are seamlessly integrated.

Before dropping into the arena, users must agree to the following guidelines:
- Players must comply with the game’s rules and guidelines.
- Modification of the game client or unfair gameplay practices will not be tolerated.

Epic continues to work on licensing agreements with various rights holders to offer content within Fortnite and regularly updates the game with new seasons and featured elements. The licensing agreements allow Epic to use works solely within Fortnite and its services.

Importantly, any external applications or unauthorized tools must not be used in conjunction with Fortnite to avoid infringement or bans from playing.

**Contract for Question b:**

YouTube, LLC ("YouTube") provides its platform for users to share and live stream content. Streaming on YouTube can be done directly through the standard YouTube app. 

Users intending to conduct live streams must ensure that they comply with YouTube's Community Guidelines and Terms of Service. 

Before going live, users must adhere to the following requirements:
- Users must use the live streaming features provided within the YouTube app.
- Content must not infringe on copyrights, and users must have the appropriate rights to share the music or videos used.

YouTube continuously negotiates rights with content creators to offer diverse media options. Be advised, obtaining permissions for any copyrighted material is the responsibility of the user rather than YouTube.

Any unauthorized use of copyrighted elements may lead to actions taken by YouTube against the user’s account.

**Contract for Question c:**

Spotify Technology S.A. ("Spotify") provides access to a vast library of music through its streaming service. Users can enjoy music primarily through the basic Spotify app, which provides all necessary features for listening and curation of playlists.

In order to comply with Spotify’s Terms of Service:
- Users must listen through the official Spotify app and may not attempt to utilize external applications to modify or simulate Spotify functionalities.
- Sharing or streaming music entails responsibility for the user to have the necessary rights for any content used.

Spotify is committed to protecting artist rights and continuously engages with music rights holders to expand its library. Users should never attempt to claim ownership of songs or attempt to extract music purposes beyond Spotify's scope.

Any violation of these terms may lead to a suspension or termination of the user account.

**Contract for Question d:**

Oculus VR, a brand of Facebook Technologies, LLC ("Oculus"), offers virtual reality gaming experiences through its Oculus platform. Hosting multiplayer VR sessions can typically be conducted using the main Oculus app.

Users must adhere to Oculus' policies and guidelines, including:
- No unauthorized external applications are permitted alongside the Oculus app to manipulate or enhance the gaming experience.
- Compliance with community standards and fair gaming practices is mandatory during all sessions.

Oculus continuously works with developers to provide updates and new applications for users, promoting a diverse range of VR experiences.

Violations of these terms may result in penalties, including the restriction of access to the Oculus platform. Users are responsible for all content shared during VR sessions and must ensure they possess all rights necessary to share or distribute it accordingly.

b. Contract: Spotify (Spotify), as part of its service, allows users to create and broadcast music content through its platform. This usage is limited to Spotify's terms; broadcasting these playlists on other platforms may result in unauthorized use claims.

c. Contract: Apple Music (Apple), part of the Apple ecosystem, enables users to share music through various channels. By using Apple Music in your Facebook Live session, you agree to follow these Terms of Service, which dictate that the music can only be used within Apple's platforms. Broadcasting this music elsewhere may result in a violation of music licensing agreements.

d. Contract: SoundCloud Music (SoundCloud) allows users to incorporate music into their TikTok live streams within the boundaries of its Terms of Service. By streaming licensed tracks from SoundCloud, you agree to adhere to SoundCloud's usage policies. Any use of this music in other contexts might expose you to claims of copyright infringement by the music rights holders.

Original Question: "Am I allowed to manually scrape information from Apple's website?"

Contract for New Questions:

1. a. 
"Your Use of Google Search Results
You may not use any automated device, program, algorithm, or similar manual process to access, acquire, copy or monitor any portion of the Google search results or any Content, or in any way reproduce or circumvent the navigational structure or presentation of Google or any Content. Google reserves the right to bar any such activity.

You may not attempt to gain unauthorized access to any feature or service of Google, or any other systems or networks connected to Google by any illegitimate means.

You may not probe, scan or test the vulnerability of Google or any network connected to it, nor breach the security or authentication measures on Google or any network connected to it. You may not seek to trace any information on any other user of or visitor to Google or its services.

You agree that you will not impose an unreasonable or disproportionately large load on the infrastructure of Google or any systems connected to it.

You agree not to use any software or routine to interfere with the proper working of Google or any transaction being conducted on Google."

2. b.
"Your Use of Amazon's Product Listings
You may not use any automated device, program, algorithm, or similar manual process to access, acquire, copy or monitor any portion of Amazon's product listings or any Content, or in any way reproduce or circumvent the navigational structure or presentation of Amazon or any Content. Amazon reserves the right to bar any such activity.

You may not probe, scan or test the vulnerability of Amazon or any network connected to it, nor breach the security or authentication measures on Amazon or any network connected to it. You may not seek to trace any information on any other user of or visitor to Amazon or its services.

You agree that you will not impose an unreasonable or disproportionately large load on the infrastructure of Amazon or any systems connected to it.

You agree not to use any software or routine to interfere with the proper working of Amazon or any transaction being conducted on Amazon."

3. c.
"Your Use of Microsoft Support Site
You may not use any automated device, program, algorithm, or similar manual process to access, acquire, copy or monitor any portion of Microsoft's support site or any Content, or in any way reproduce or circumvent the navigational structure or presentation of Microsoft or any Content. Microsoft reserves the right to bar any such activity.

You may not attempt to gain unauthorized access to any feature or service of Microsoft, or any other systems or networks connected to Microsoft by any illegitimate means.

You may not probe, scan or test the vulnerability of Microsoft or any network connected to it, nor breach the security or authentication measures on Microsoft or any network connected to it. You may not seek to trace any information on any other user of or visitor to Microsoft or its services.

You agree that you will not impose an unreasonable or disproportionately large load on the infrastructure of Microsoft or any systems connected to it.

You agree not to use any software or routine to interfere with the proper working of Microsoft or any transaction being conducted on Microsoft."

4. d.
"Your Use of Facebook User Profiles
You may not use any automated device, program, algorithm, or similar manual process to access, acquire, copy or monitor any portion of Facebook user profiles or any Content, or in any way reproduce or circumvent the navigational structure or presentation of Facebook or any Content. Facebook reserves the right to bar any such activity.

You may not attempt to gain unauthorized access to any feature or service of Facebook, or any other systems or networks connected to Facebook by any illegitimate means.

You may not probe, scan or test the vulnerability of Facebook or any network connected to it, nor breach the security or authentication measures on Facebook or any network connected to it. You may not seek to trace any information on any other user of or visitor to Facebook or its services.

You agree that you will not impose an unreasonable or disproportionately large load on the infrastructure of Facebook or any systems connected to it.

You agree not to use any software or routine to interfere with the proper working of Facebook or any transaction being conducted on Facebook."



362
Original Question: "Do Apple's terms of use permit manual scraping of its website?"
New Questions:
a. "Do Amazon's terms of service allow for manual data extraction from its platform?"
b. "Are there any provisions in Google's terms of use that permit manual collection of information from its search results?"
c. "Does Facebook's user agreement authorize manual retrieval of data from user profiles?"
d. "Are manual content collection practices allowed under Netflix's terms of use for its streaming service?"

Contract for New Questions:
**Amazon's Terms of Service**
You may not use any automated means, including robots, spiders, or data mining tools, to gather data from Amazon’s website or services without obtaining prior written consent. Manual efforts to collect data are only permitted in accordance with the policies set by Amazon.

**Google's Terms of Use**
You may not use any device, software, or routine to interfere with or disrupt the proper functioning of Google’s services. Manual data collection methods may only be used as permitted under specific Google Guidelines.

**Facebook's User Agreement**
You agree that you will not collect, use, or access data from Facebook, including user profiles, without permission. Manual methods to access information are restricted unless explicitly allowed by Facebook's policies.

**Netflix's Terms of Use**
You may not engage in any unauthorized scraping or data collection from Netflix. Manual retrieval of data is prohibited unless the specific process is allowed by Netflix's approved policies.

368
Original Question: "Does Apple need to give me notice before it bars me from its website?"

New Questions:
a. "Must a social media platform notify me prior to suspending my account for violating their terms of service?"
b. "Is a streaming service required to inform me before canceling my subscription due to non-payment?"
c. "Does an online retailer have to alert me before blocking my access to their website for fraudulent activities?"
d. "Will an email service provider need to provide a warning before terminating my account for excessive spamming?"

**New Contracts Corresponding to Each Question:**

a. **Contract for Social Media Platform Terms of Service**:  
The social media platform may terminate your account if it finds that you have violated the terms of service or community guidelines. It reserves the right to suspend or terminate your account without prior notice if deemed necessary. However, the platform will make reasonable efforts to notify you of the violation and the resulting action, unless the situation involves immediate threats or illegal activities.

b. **Contract for Streaming Service Subscription Agreement**:  
The streaming service retains the right to suspend or terminate your subscription without prior notification if payment is not received by the due date or if your account is found to be engaged in fraudulent activity. The service may send reminders before taking such actions and provide an opportunity to rectify the payment issue.

c. **Contract for Online Retailer's User Agreement**:  
The online retailer reserves the right to restrict or limit your access to its website based on compliance with terms and conditions. If fraudulent activity is detected, the retailer may block your account without notice to protect itself and other users. However, they will typically attempt to communicate any issues that lead to account suspension whenever feasible.

d. **Contract for Email Service Provider User Policy**:  
The email service provider can terminate your account if it detects excessive spamming or any other violation of its usage policy. The provider is not obligated to issue prior notice in all cases of termination but may inform you of issues leading to the restriction of your account, especially if they involve less severe infractions.



369
Original Question: "Is Apple required to provide advance notice to users before preventing such persons from accessing its website?"

New Questions:
a. "Is Google obligated to inform users prior to restricting their access to its search engine services?"
b. "Must Microsoft give users prior notification before banning them from using its cloud storage platform?"
c. "Is Facebook required to alert users in advance before suspending their accounts due to policy violations?"
d. "Does Amazon need to notify users beforehand before revoking their access to its online shopping services?" 

New Contracts:
1. Contract: Violation of These Terms of Use
   Google may disclose any information we have about you (including your identity) if we determine that such disclosure is necessary in connection with any investigation or complaint regarding your use of the search engine services, or to identify, contact or bring legal action against someone who may be causing injury to or interference with (either intentionally or unintentionally) Google's rights or property, or the rights or property of visitors to or users of the services, including Google's customers. Google reserves the right at all times to disclose any information that Google deems necessary to comply with any applicable law, regulation, legal process or governmental request. Google may also disclose your information when Google determines that applicable law requires or permits such disclosure, including exchanging information with other companies and organizations for fraud protection purposes.
   
   You acknowledge and agree that Google may preserve any transmittal or communication by you with Google through the services or any facility offered on or through the services, and may also disclose such data if required to do so by law or Google determines that such preservation or disclosure is reasonably necessary to (1) comply with legal process, (2) enforce these Terms of Use, (3) respond to claims that any such data violates the rights of others, or (4) protect the rights, property or personal safety of Google, its employees, users of or visitors to the services, and the public.

   You agree that Google may, in its sole discretion and without prior notice, terminate your access to the services and/or block your future access to the services if we determine that you have violated these Terms of Use or other agreements or guidelines which may be associated with your use of the services. You also agree that any violation by you of these Terms of Use will constitute an unlawful and unfair business practice, and will cause irreparable harm to Google, for which monetary damages would be inadequate, and you consent to Google obtaining any injunctive or equitable relief that Google deems necessary or appropriate in such circumstances. These remedies are in addition to any other remedies Google may have at law or in equity.
   
   You agree that Google may, in its sole discretion and without prior notice, terminate your access to the services, for cause, which includes (but is not limited to) (1) requests by law enforcement or other government agencies, (2) a request by you (self-initiated account deletions), (3) discontinuance or material modification of the services or any service offered on or through the services, or (4) unexpected technical issues or problems.
   
   If Google does take any legal action against you as a result of your violation of these Terms of Use, Google will be entitled to recover from you, and you agree to pay, all reasonable attorneys fees and costs of such action, in addition to any other relief granted to Google. You agree that Google will not be liable to you or to any third party for termination of your access to the services as a result of any violation of these Terms of Use.
   
2. Contract: Violation of These Terms of Use
   Microsoft may disclose any information we have about you (including your identity) if we determine that such disclosure is necessary in connection with any investigation or complaint regarding your use of the cloud storage platform, or to identify, contact or bring legal action against someone who may be causing injury to or interference with (either intentionally or unintentionally) Microsoft's rights or property, or the rights or property of visitors to or users of the platform, including Microsoft's customers. Microsoft may also disclose your information when Microsoft determines that applicable law requires or permits such disclosure, including exchanging information with other companies and organizations for fraud protection purposes.

   You acknowledge and agree that Microsoft may preserve any transmittal or communication by you with Microsoft through the platform or any service offered on or through the platform, and may also disclose such data if required to do so by law or Microsoft determines that such preservation or disclosure is reasonably necessary to (1) comply with legal process, (2) enforce these Terms of Use, (3) respond to claims that any such data violates the rights of others, or (4) protect the rights, property or personal safety of Microsoft, its employees, users of or visitors to the platform, and the public.

   You agree that Microsoft may, in its sole discretion and without prior notice, terminate your access to the platform and/or block your future access to the platform if we determine that you have violated these Terms of Use or other agreements or guidelines which may be associated with your use of the platform. You also agree that any violation by you of these Terms of Use will constitute an unlawful and unfair business practice, and will cause irreparable harm to Microsoft, for which monetary damages would be inadequate, and you consent to Microsoft obtaining any injunctive or equitable relief that Microsoft deems necessary or appropriate in such circumstances. These remedies are in addition to any other remedies Microsoft may have at law or in equity.

   You agree that Microsoft may, in its sole discretion and without prior notice, terminate your access to the platform, for cause, which includes (but is not limited to) (1) requests by law enforcement or other government agencies, (2) a request by you (self-initiated account deletions), (3) discontinuance or material modification of the platform or any service offered on or through the platform, or (4) unexpected technical issues or problems.

   If Microsoft does take any legal action against you as a result of your violation of these Terms of Use, Microsoft will be entitled to recover from you, and you agree to pay, all reasonable attorneys fees and costs of such action, in addition to any other relief granted to Microsoft. You agree that Microsoft will not be liable to you or to any third party for termination of your access to the platform as a result of any violation of these Terms of Use.

   - **Miscellaneous**: You may not use or export any content, or any adaptation of it, in violation of any applicable laws or regulations. Any provisions deemed void or unenforceable by a competent tribunal shall be limited or replaced to maintain legal effectiveness. These terms constitute the entire agreement regarding your use of Samsung sites.

Amazon reserves the right to limit availability based on geographical considerations. Any offers made on the site are void where prohibited by law. If accessing from outside your country, you must comply with local laws.

c. **Microsoft Contract**:
   - **Void Where Prohibited**: Microsoft operates its websites from various global locations; accessibility to all features and services may not be uniform across countries. Microsoft reserves the right to limit provisions based on location. Offers on the site are void where prohibited. Accessing from outside your country requires compliance with local laws.

d. **Google Contract**:
   - **Void Where Prohibited**: Google operates its services from various locations; features and services may differ by country. Google reserves the right to limit access based on geographic criteria. Any offers made are void where prohibited. Users accessing services from outside their country must adhere to local laws.

These Terms of Use constitute the entire agreement between you and Netflix with regard to your use of the site, and any and all other written or oral agreements or understandings previously existing between you and Netflix with respect to such use are hereby superseded and cancelled. Other than as provided in a purchase agreement you enter into with Netflix, Netflix will not accept any counter-offers to these Terms of Use, and all such offers are hereby categorically rejected. Original Question: "Do I need to use my real name to open an Instagram account?"

Contract for New Questions:
Who Can Use Facebook. We want our Service to be as open and inclusive as possible, but we also want it to be safe, secure, and in accordance with the law. So, we need you to commit to a few restrictions in order to be part of the Facebook community.
You must be at least 13 years old or the minimum legal age in your country to use Facebook.
You must not be prohibited from receiving any aspect of our Service under applicable laws or engaging in payments related Services if you are on an applicable denied party listing.
We must not have previously disabled your account for violation of law or any of our policies.
You must not be a convicted sex offender.

How You Can't Use Facebook. Providing a safe and open Service for a broad community requires that we all do our part.
You can't impersonate others or provide inaccurate information.
You are not required to disclose your identity on Facebook, but you must provide us with accurate and up-to-date information (including registration information). Also, you may not impersonate someone you aren't, and you can't create an account for someone else unless you have their express permission.
You can't do anything unlawful, misleading, or fraudulent or for an illegal or unauthorized purpose.
You can't violate (or help or encourage others to violate) these Terms or our policies, including in particular the Facebook Community Standards and the Facebook Platform Policy. Learn how to report conduct or content in our Help Center.
You can't do anything to interfere with or impair the intended operation of the Service.
You can't attempt to create accounts or access or collect information in unauthorized ways.
This includes creating accounts or collecting information in an automated way without our express permission.
You can't attempt to buy, sell, or transfer any aspect of your account (including your username) or solicit, collect, or use login credentials or badges of other users.
You can't post private or confidential information or do anything that violates someone else's rights, including intellectual property.
Learn more, including how to report content that you think infringes your intellectual property rights, here.
You can't use a domain name or URL in your username without our prior written consent.

376
Original Question: "Is an Instagram user permitted to sell his or her Instagram account to a business in the entertainment industry?"

New Questions:
a. "Can an Instagram user transfer their account to a friend who wants to use it for marketing purposes?"
b. "Is a TikTok user allowed to sell their profile to a brand looking to reach a younger audience?"
c. "Can a Facebook account holder sell their profile to an influencer who wants to take over their content?"
d. "Is a Twitter user permitted to auction off their handle to a company in the sports sector?" 

Contract corresponding to the new questions:

Contract: Use of Instagram Account. We strive to maintain the integrity and security of our platform. Therefore, all users of Instagram are required to adhere to certain guidelines regarding the ownership and transfer of accounts.

1. Users are not allowed to sell, trade, or transfer their Instagram accounts or any aspect of them, including usernames, to any individual or entity without our explicit written consent.
2. If an account has been previously restricted or disabled by Instagram for violation of community guidelines or any legal regulations, it cannot be transferred.
3. Users must ensure that all information provided during the registration of their account is accurate and up-to-date and that they are the sole owner of the account. They cannot create accounts or operate accounts on behalf of another individual unless expressly authorized.
4. Any attempt to sell or transfer an account in violation of these terms may result in account suspension or termination.

How Users Cannot Use Instagram Accounts: Adhering to our ban on account sales is critical to maintaining a safe and trustworthy community for all users. Users cannot:
- Engage in any unauthorized trading of accounts, which includes, but is not limited to, selling their account to others for commercial purposes.
- Mislead or provide false information regarding the ownership status of their account.
- Engage in activities that would circumvent these guidelines, such as attempting to sell their account indirectly or using intermediaries.
- Contribute to any activities that may compromise the safety, security, or functionality of Instagram.

By using Instagram, you agree to respect these terms regarding account ownership and refrain from any unauthorized sales or transfers.

Original Question: "Does Instagram become the owner of content that I post on Instagram?"

a. "Does Facebook gain ownership of posts made on its platform?"

New Contracts:
---

**Contract: Permissions You Give to Us (Facebook)**  
As part of our agreement, you also grant us permissions necessary for us to provide the Service.  
We do not claim ownership of your posts, but you license us to use them.  
Your rights to your content remain unchanged. We do not claim ownership of the posts you share on or through the Service, and you are free to share your posts with others whenever you wish. However, we require certain legal permissions from you (referred to as a license) to ensure we can maintain the Service. When you share or upload content that is covered by intellectual property rights (like images or videos) on or in connection with our Service, you hereby grant us a non-exclusive, royalty-free, transferable, sub-licensable, worldwide license to host, use, distribute, modify, run, copy, publicly perform or display, translate, and create derivative works of your posts (consistent with your privacy and application settings). This license will terminate once your content is deleted from our platforms. You can delete individual content or all at once by deactivating your account. For additional details on how we manage information and how you can control or remove your content, please review the Data Use Policy and visit the Facebook Help Center.

**Permission to use your username, profile picture, and actions with sponsored content**  
You grant us permission to display your username, profile picture, and information regarding your actions (such as likes) or relationships (such as follows) next to or in relation to accounts, ads, offers, and all other sponsored content you engage with on Facebook Products, without any compensation. For example, we may display that you liked a sponsored content posted by a brand that compensates us for showing its advertisements on Facebook. Similarly, actions related to other content and follows of accounts can only be viewed by individuals who have permission to see that content or follow. We will also respect your settings regarding advertising. For further information about your ad settings, you can learn more here.
  
**You agree we can download and install updates to the Service on your device.**

Original Question: "Does Instagram acquire ownership rights in or to content posted by users on the Instagram platform?"

New Questions:

Contracts corresponding to new questions:

**Contract for Twitter:**
Permissions You Give to Us. In our agreement, you give us the permissions necessary to provide our service. We do not claim ownership of your tweets, but you grant us a license to use them. Your rights in your tweets remain unchanged. We do not claim ownership of your tweets that you share on or through the service, and you are free to share your tweets with anyone else, wherever you choose. However, we need certain legal permissions from you (known as a license) to provide the service. When you share, post, or upload content covered by intellectual property rights (like tweets) on our service, you grant us a non-exclusive, royalty-free, transferable, sub-licensable, worldwide license to host, use, distribute, modify, run, copy, publicly perform or display, translate, and create derivative works of your content (consistent with your privacy settings). This license will end when your tweets are deleted from our systems. You can delete tweets individually or all at once.

**Contract for YouTube:**
Permissions You Give to Us. In our agreement, you give us the necessary permissions to offer our service. We do not claim ownership of your videos, but you grant us a license to use them. Your rights in your videos remain unchanged. We do not claim ownership of your videos shared on or through the service, and you are free to share them with anyone you wish. However, we require specific legal permissions from you (known as a license) to deliver the service. When you upload or share content covered by intellectual property rights (like videos), you grant us a non-exclusive, royalty-free, transferable, sub-licensable, worldwide license to host, use, distribute, modify, run, copy, publicly perform or display, translate, and create derivative works of your content (consistent with your privacy and application settings). This license ends when your videos are removed from our systems.

**Contract for Facebook:**
Permissions You Give to Us. As part of our agreement, you grant us the permissions necessary to provide our service. We do not claim ownership of your photos, but you give us a license to use them. Your rights to your photos remain unaffected. We do not claim ownership of the content you share on or through our service, and you are free to distribute it wherever you like. To provide the service, we require certain legal permissions from you (known as a license). When you share or upload content covered by intellectual property rights (like photos), you grant us a non-exclusive, royalty-free, transferable, sub-licensable, worldwide license to host, use, distribute, modify, run, copy, publicly perform or display, translate, and create derivative works of your content (according to your privacy settings). This license will cease when your photos are deleted from our systems.

**Contract for TikTok:**
Permissions You Give to Us. In our agreement, you provide the necessary permissions that allow us to offer our service. We do not claim ownership of the videos you upload, but you grant us a license for usage. Your rights in your videos remain intact. We do not claim ownership of videos shared on our platform and you are free to share your videos with others at any time. However, we need specific legal permissions from you (known as a license) to deliver our service. When you share or upload content protected by intellectual property rights (like videos), you grant us a non-exclusive, royalty-free, transferable, sub-licensable, worldwide license to host, use, distribute, modify, run, copy, publicly perform or display, translate, and create derivative works of your content (consistent with your privacy and application settings). This license will cease when your videos are deleted from our systems.

380
Original Question: "Do the terms imply that, 30 days following a user's request to delete content, other users may be able to view such content?"

New Questions:
a. "Do the terms suggest that, within 30 days of a user's request to disable their account, other users may still have access to the user's profile information?"
b. "Does the agreement indicate that, after a customer requests to cancel their subscription, their billing information may remain accessible for 30 days?"
c. "Do the policies state that a participant's posts can still be visible to others for up to 30 days after they submit a request to remove them from a forum?"
d. "Is it correct to infer that, within 30 days of an individual requesting to terminate their membership, their shared content might still be visible to other members?"

### New Contracts Corresponding to New Questions:

**Contract for Question a:**

**Content Visibility and Account Disabling**

We reserve the right to maintain visibility of profile information for a period up to 30 days after a user requests to disable their account. During this time, other users may still have access to view the profile, including any publicly shared posts or details. If a user believes their account has been disabled erroneously, they should refer to our Support Center for resolution.

**Contract for Question b:**

**Subscription Cancellation and Billing Information Retention**

Upon a customer's request to cancel their subscription, their billing information may remain retained in our system for a period of up to 30 days. This retention is necessary for processing any final payments or adjustments. If customers wish to inquire about specific data retention policies, they are encouraged to contact our customer service department.

**Contract for Question c:**

**Post Removal and Forum Visibility**

When a participant submits a request to remove their posts from a forum, such content may remain viewable to other users for a period of up to 30 days while we process the removal. This interim timeframe allows for the necessary checks and balances in our content management system. For any questions regarding content visibility, users should refer to our Community Guidelines.

**Contract for Question d:**

**Membership Termination and Shared Content Visibility**

After an individual requests to terminate their membership, any shared content may remain accessible to other members for a duration of up to 30 days. This policy ensures that we can appropriately manage content removal processes and address any necessary compliance matters. For further clarification, users can consult the relevant sections of our Terms of Use.

Original Question: "Do the terms impose the same governing law in respect of all consumers who are subject to the terms?"

Corresponding Contracts:
1. **Contract for Guidelines**: 
   Our Guidelines.
   Your usage of the Service is governed by our Privacy Policies, which apply uniformly to all users. If you utilize specific features or services, additional guidelines will be provided and become part of our agreement. Each user's compliance is critical; however, if any guidelines conflict, the more specific ones take precedence. Any part of the guidelines that is unenforceable will not affect the remaining provisions.

2. **Contract for Policy**: 
   The Company Policy.
   All employees are subject to this policy, which details jurisdiction for dispute resolution. In the event of any disagreement, claims made by employees will be adjudicated under the laws of the state where you work. If the state laws conflict, the laws favoring employee rights will be prioritized.

3. **Contract for Service Agreement**: 
   Liability Terms.
   The service is provided on an "as is" basis with all users accepting the same limitations regarding liability. This agreement explicitly states that we are not liable for any indirect, special, or consequential damages, inclusive of profit losses, across all users under the service agreement.

4. **Contract for Contributors' Rights**: 
   Contribution Rules.
   Ensure that all contributors are aware of the identical intellectual property rights stated in the rules. Any contributions made under this agreement will grant equal rights in accordance with the developed content, and all contributors must adhere to these unified regulations.

B. Agreement. You represent to [Company Name] that you have read, understood, and expressly agree to be bound by this Agreement, and the terms, conditions, and notices contained or referenced herein, whether you have created an account (and agree to this Agreement at the time you created that account) or whether you simply browse, use, or access a product offered directly by [Company Name] or through a third party (and agree to this Agreement when you browse, use, or access any aspect of the product). If you do not agree to the Agreement, you may not use the products.

C. Supplemental Terms. This Agreement governs the products in general. More specific and/or supplemental terms and conditions may apply to some products, including but not limited to, a particular contest, software, application, promotional code, service or other activity; availability of certain merchandise, content, programs, or other activities; conditions or other limitations for users under certain ages; and/or specific terms or restrictions that may accompany certain territories, programs, content, products, websites, applications or other software. Any supplemental terms and conditions are in addition to this Agreement and, in the event of a conflict, the supplemental terms will prevail over this Agreement. If you do not agree to the applicable supplemental terms and conditions disclosed, you may not use the product.

D. Amendments. We may need to make changes to any portion of this Agreement from time to time and for many reasons, including to reflect updates to the products or changes in law. If we make a material change to this Agreement, it will be effective thirty (30) days following either our dispatch of a notice to you or our posting of the amended terms through the products, the third party that makes products available to you, or at [website]. You are responsible for periodically reviewing this Agreement for updates and amendments. By continuing to use the products you will be deemed to have agreed to and accepted any amendments. If you do not agree to any change to this Agreement, you must discontinue using the products. Our customer service representatives are not authorized to modify any provision of this Agreement, either verbally or in writing.

E. Accounts. Some products permit or require you to create an account to participate or to secure additional benefits. You agree that any information you provide and maintain is accurate, current and complete, including your contact information for notices and other communications from us and your payment information. You agree not to impersonate or misrepresent your affiliation with any person or entity, including using another persons username, password or other account information, or another persons name or likeness, or provide false details for a parent or guardian. You agree that we may take steps to verify the accuracy of information you provide, including contact information for a parent or guardian.

F. Passwords and Security. You agree that you will not share your account or account information with others. You are responsible for taking reasonable steps to maintain the confidentiality of your username and password, and you are responsible for all activities under your account that you can reasonably control. You agree to promptly notify us of any unauthorized use of your username, password or other account information, or of any other breach of security that you become aware of involving your account or the products.

G. Electronic Notice. You consent to receive notices, including agreements, disclosures, and other communications, electronically from us at the email address you have provided. You agree that these electronic notices satisfy any legal requirements that such communications be in writing.

H. Termination or Suspension. We may terminate or suspend your access to any products, and/or terminate this Agreement subject to the survival of terms as provided below, if required by law, or if we have objective reason to believe you have used the products in violation of any provision of this Agreement or any supplemental terms, and/or if you engage in or encourage infringement or any other illegal conduct as it relates to your use of the products.

Original Question: "According to the terms, will Disney by default send me push notifications?"

New Contracts:
**A. Consent to Messages.** When you utilize the Netflix services, you may be presented with the option to opt-in to receive communications from us via email, text, and/or push notifications regarding new releases and updates. Standard text and calling fees may apply. You agree that texts, calls, or pre-recorded messages may be generated by automated dialing systems. You can opt out of promotional communications by following the unsubscribe instructions for emails, through your account settings on the Netflix service, or by responding STOP to text messages. You acknowledge that opting in for notifications is not a condition for using Netflix services.

**B. Notification Settings.** When using the Spotify application, you may choose to grant permissions to receive notifications regarding new music releases and artist updates. Your device settings provide additional information on how to adjust these notifications. By using the Spotify service, you consent to receiving such communications.

**C. Alert Functionality.** When using Amazon services, you may elect to receive notifications regarding the status of your orders. The conditions specify that these alerts may be delivered automatically and can be managed within your account settings. You are not required to agree to this notification feature to access Amazon services.

**D. Messaging Consent.** When utilizing Hulu's services, you may be offered the choice to receive messages about new episodes and content updates. These will be sent automatically unless you opt out through your account settings. You can decline to receive promotional messages without it affecting your access to Hulu content.

Contract for New Questions:
1. **Promotional Emails**: You may be presented with an option to receive promotional emails from us, but we will not send such emails without first obtaining your consent. You understand that standard email rates may apply.

2. **Text Messages**: If you choose to receive text message updates, we will ensure that your consent is obtained before sending any promotional text. You acknowledge that you will not receive text messages unless you have agreed to this.

3. **App Notifications**: Users may receive app notifications once they provide consent to receive them. We will not send notifications without the explicit agreement of the user.

4. **Unconsented Notifications**: The policy clarifies that promotional communications, whether through text or other methods, will not be initiated prior to obtaining user consent.
