Original Question: "Can I get a refund for a virtual item that I purchased?"

New Questions:
a. "Am I eligible for a refund if I cancel my subscription to an online service after one month?"
b. "Is it possible to receive a refund for an in-game currency that I accidentally bought?"
c. "Can I return a digital movie code if I no longer wish to use it?"
d. "If I decide to cancel my subscription to a music streaming service, will I receive any of my money back?" 

Contracts corresponding to the new questions:

a. **Subscription Cancellation and Refunds**: If you cancel your subscription to an online service, you may not be eligible for a prorated refund for the period following your cancellation. You will retain access to the service until the end of the billing cycle that includes the date of your cancellation. Any charges incurred prior to the cancellation remain your responsibility.

b. **In-Game Currency Returns**: In-game currency purchases are generally considered final and may not be refunded or exchanged for money or other items. When purchasing virtual items, please review the terms of sale carefully before completing the transaction.

c. **Digital Movie Code Returns**: Digital movie codes that were purchased are non-returnable if they have been opened or redeemed. If you feel you have purchased a digital code in error and have not yet redeemed it, you may be able to return it in accordance with specific guidelines provided during the purchase.

d. **Music Streaming Subscription Policy**: Upon cancellation of your music streaming service subscription, you will not receive a refund for any subscription fees already paid, but you will maintain access to the service until your billing cycle ends. Be aware that terms for refunds may vary by provider, and it’s advisable to read the terms stated at sign-up carefully.



389
Original Question: "Are users entitled to refunds in connection with the purchase of virtual items?"

New Questions:
a. "Is a customer eligible for a refund after buying digital tokens for an online game?"
b. "Do subscribers have the right to a refund if they purchase a virtual subscription service?"
c. "Can players expect a refund when they buy in-game currency for a mobile app?"
d. "Are users allowed to request a refund after purchasing virtual merchandise for a social media platform?" 

### Corresponding Contracts for New Questions:

**Contract for Question a:**
A. Virtual Tokens. When purchasing digital tokens for an online game, you are acquiring a limited, non-transferable license to use those tokens solely within the game environment. These tokens are not eligible for refunds and cannot be exchanged for monetary value. All purchases are final, and no refund will be issued for digital tokens once the transaction is completed.

**Contract for Question b:**
A. Subscription Services. By purchasing a subscription for a virtual service, users agree to pay the specified fees for access to the service. All subscriptions are non-refundable, unless a specific refund policy is outlined at the time of purchase. Users understand that cancellation of the subscription does not lead to refunds for any fees already paid.

**Contract for Question c:**
A. In-Game Currency. Users who buy in-game currency for a mobile app are granted a non-redeemable license to utilize the currency within the app. Purchases of in-game currency are final, and users are not entitled to refunds after payment authorization has been completed.

**Contract for Question d:**
A. Virtual Merchandise. When customers purchase virtual merchandise for a social media platform, they acknowledge that these purchases are final and not eligible for refunds. The virtual merchandise can be used as intended within the social platform and retains no monetary value outside of that context.



390
Original Question: "Do I have the right to return within 30 days any physical product that I bought from Disney?"

New Questions:
a. "Can I return any physical item purchased from the Amazon store within 30 days of receiving it?"
b. "Am I allowed to cancel my order and receive a refund for any clothing item purchased from Fashion Retailers within 30 days?"
c. "Do I have the option to return a smartphone that I ordered online within 30 days of delivery?"
d. "Is it possible for me to return a book I bought from a local bookstore within 30 days for a full refund?" 

Contracts:
a. **Right to Return Physical Products from Amazon**: Customers have the right to return physical items within 30 days of receipt. To initiate a return, follow the provided instructions on the Amazon website. Certain items, such as electronics with broken seals and personalized gifts, may not qualify for a return.

b. **Clothing Return Policy from Fashion Retailers**: You may return clothing items purchased from Fashion Retailers within 30 days of purchase. All returned clothing must be in new condition with tags attached. Some items may be marked as non-returnable.

c. **Smartphone Return Policy**: Customers who purchase a smartphone online can return the device within 30 days of delivery for a full refund, provided it is in its original packaging and condition. Certain conditions may apply, including a restocking fee for opened products.

d. **Book Return Policy from Local Bookstores**: Customers may return books purchased from local bookstores within 30 days of purchase, as long as the book is in new condition and not marked as final sale. Refunds may be subject to store policies regarding returned items.



391
Original Question: "Does Disney allow for the return of all physical products within 30 days of when such product was purchased?"

New Questions:
a. "Can customers return all physical goods purchased from Amazon within 30 days of receipt?"
b. "Is it permissible to return any physical item bought from a retail store within 30 days of purchase?"
c. "Are all physical products sold by Target eligible for return within 30 days of their purchase date?"
d. "Does Walmart have a policy enabling the return of every physical merchandise within 30 days of purchase?"

Contracts Corresponding to New Questions:

a. **Contract for Amazon Returns**: 
   "Right of Cancellation; Return of Goods.
   You may have the right to cancel an order placed for an Amazon Product depending on the nature of the Product. Please read the following information carefully to understand your right of cancellation.

   If you wish to cancel, you must do so by following the cancellation instructions for the particular Amazon Product.
   
   - Physical Goods: You have the right, within thirty (30) days from the date of your receipt of physical goods, to cancel our contract with you and return the goods. This right does not apply to goods stated by us to be non-returnable, including but not limited to: items without their original packaging and personalized items."

b. **Contract for Retail Store Returns**: 
   "Right of Cancellation; Return of Goods.
   You may have the right to cancel an order placed for Products purchased from our retail store depending on the nature of the Product. Please read the following information carefully to understand your right of cancellation.

   - Physical Goods: You have the right, within thirty (30) days from the date of your receipt of physical goods, to cancel our contract with you and return the goods. This right is void for goods that are opened or used."

c. **Contract for Target Returns**:
   "Right of Cancellation; Return of Goods.
   You may have the right to cancel an order placed for Target Products depending on the nature of the Product. Please read and understand your rights carefully.

   - Physical Goods: You have the right, within thirty (30) days from receipt, to return physical goods purchased from Target. This does not apply to items marked as non-returnable or that have been opened."

d. **Contract for Walmart Returns**:
   "Right of Cancellation; Return of Goods.
   You may have the right to cancel an order placed for a Walmart Product depending on the nature of the product. Please read our cancellation policy carefully.

   - Physical Goods: You have the right, within thirty (30) days from the date of receipt, to cancel your order and return the goods. Exceptions apply for certain items that are marked as non-returnable or opened."

394
Original Question: "Do the terms say who the actual arbitrator will be?"

New Questions:
a. "Do the terms specify who will conduct the mediation process?"
b. "Are there any details in the agreement regarding the appointed neutral evaluator for disputes?"
c. "Does the contract outline who will serve as the referee for the arbitration proceedings?"
d. "Is there a mention in the document about the individual responsible for resolving disagreements through arbitration?"

New Contracts:
**Contract for New Questions:**

a. **Mediation Terms**
   All disputes between you and Disney will be subject to mediation, which will be conducted by a mediator selected by both parties from a list provided by JAMS Mediation, Arbitration and ADR Services. In the event of an unresolved dispute that goes to mediation, both parties agree to attend sessions scheduled at a mutually agreed-upon location. 

b. **Neutral Evaluator Terms**
   You and Disney shall appoint a neutral evaluator from a preapproved list agreed upon by both parties to assess any conflicts that arise. The evaluator will have the authority to provide a non-binding opinion on the dispute, which may lead to an agreement before proceeding to arbitration or litigation.

c. **Referee Terms**
   In the event of a disagreement, you and Disney agree to appoint a referee from the American Arbitration Association (AAA) to oversee the arbitration process. All proceedings will follow established AAA rules and guidelines to ensure fairness and transparency.

d. **Arbitration Resolution Terms**
   You and Disney consent to resolution of disputes through a designated arbitrator from the JAMS organization, who shall have the final authority on the matter. Terms of arbitration, including the process and fees, are to be governed by the JAMS Streamlined Arbitration Rules and Procedures.



395
Original Question: "Does the above specify the identity of the arbitrator?"

New Questions:
a. "Does the document outline the process for selecting a mediator?"
b. "Is there any mention of the qualifications required for the arbitrator in the agreement?"
c. "Does the contract provide information about the organization that administers the arbitration?"
d. "Is there a description of how the selected arbitrator will be compensated according to the agreement?"

New Contract Corresponding to New Questions:
**Contract for Mediation Process:**
In the event of a dispute, you or Disney agree to engage in mediation prior to arbitration. The mediator's identity will be mutually agreed upon by both parties, and the selection process involves choosing a mediator from a list provided by an agreed-upon mediation service. This service will ensure that the mediator has adequate qualifications and experience in resolving disputes related to Disney Products or this Agreement.

You and Disney must send a notice of mediation request, which includes the name, address, and contact information of both parties, along with the facts giving rise to the dispute. The designated mediator shall facilitate discussions to help both parties reach a resolution within thirty (30) days from the date the notice of mediation is sent.

If a resolution is not reached within the thirty (30) days, either party may initiate arbitration as per the terms outlined in the original agreement. All other arbitration terms remain applicable. The mediator may not act in a representative capacity, and the costs of mediation will be shared equally unless otherwise agreed upon.

**Contract for Arbitrator Qualifications:**
In the event of a dispute, you and Disney agree that any arbitrator will be selected from the panel of arbitrators certified by JAMS, possessing experience in the entertainment or technology sectors. The identity of the arbitrator will be mutually agreed upon within a stipulated time frame, and both parties will have the opportunity to review the arbitrator's qualifications before selection. 

You and Disney shall send a written notice detailing any disputes as described in the original arbitration agreement. The costs associated with the selection of the arbitrator will be borne by the party initiating the arbitration, unless the arbitration ruling is in favor of the initiating party, in which case all costs will be reimbursed by the opposing party.

**Contract for Arbitration Administration:**
In case a dispute arises, you and Disney agree to submit to arbitration that will be administered by a recognized organization specializing in mediation and arbitration services, such as JAMS or equivalent. The process for the selection of the arbitrator shall be defined in accordance with the chosen organization's rules.

You will be responsible for filing the initial claim and any associated fees, whereas Disney will cover all fees associated with the arbitration should you be awarded damages exceeding any previous settlement offers made by Disney.

**Contract for Arbitrator Compensation Description:**
If a dispute is not resolved informally or in small claims court, it shall then be settled through binding arbitration, with costs incurred for the arbitrator's services falling to the initiating party unless otherwise delegated. In the case of a favorable award, reimbursement for the filing fees will be provided by Disney, covering any additional costs for arbitrator compensation as governed by the arbitration service's established fee structure, detailed within the contract terms.
